The Amazon library of TV shows and movies is extensive, and when you pair a Kindle Fire with an Amazon Prime subscription, you even have a very nice selection of content that costs you nothing to view. Web browsing is quick and easy. Although the number of apps is limited (this is a custom-tweaked Android device), the set that is provided is good and more than meets my needs.I'm a happy camper.

Reviews.Title: Gift
Reviews.Author: Princess
Reviews.Content: Gift for 92 year old Mom.  A great pass time for her and she loves it.  The good variety of free  games and books plus inexpensive ones that you can purchase.  All around great gift for any age.

Reviews.Title: I'm so jealous right now!
Reviews.Author: Janice Broderick
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my 13 yo son.  I have to say, I love it!  The size is great, the resolution spectacular, and it has so many amazing capabilities.  I almost bought an iPad mini, but when I compared the two and added Prime to the mix, there is no comparison.  The Kindle Fire is a great product and the packaging was beautiful.  I couldn't have thought of a better gift.  Now, I'm jealous and can't wait to get one for myself!

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Larry
Reviews.Content: Everything works great right out of the box. This is my first tablet so I had a little learning curve to get started but progressing without any problems. Haven't done any streaming yet. Waiting untill I join prime to try that.It connects to wi-fi quickly ,boots up fast, and surfs the internet great.  I don't know what could be any better.Larry

Reviews.Title: media magic
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey C. Joseph
Reviews.Content: I am not a big gamer or apps dude. I am into movies, music and books. Given this, there is no tablet better. the movie display rivals my wife's IPAD 3 while the sound beats the Ipad and Samsung by leaps (my brother has a Samsung). the book reading experience is also terrific. If you are into lots of games and are an apps freak then, I have to be fair the IPad and the Google devices are better. so it all comes down to what you want your tablet to do. The Kindle does, for its price, deliver media magic to me. let me end by saying this, no tablet, not even the all holy, all wise Ipad, is in a position to replace a laptop..yet. So when purchasing a tablet and you are tempted to spend ridiculous amounts of money remember it's still not a laptop. one other thing. i didn't pay the $15 to remove the ads. i knew then what I still know now. it's not a big thing to me. I only see the ads when the tablet is locked. why am I going to fret over what's displayed on my screen when I am NOT using the Kindle?

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: author
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful upgrade to the basic Kindle. My son really enjoys playing games on this in addition to reading books.

Reviews.Title: Good product that could have been better
Reviews.Author: Vaughn "I'm a casual gamer, and music and mov...
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 16GB for christmas as a gift for my family (2 adults and 2 kids). I also own an original fire that I got last year for myself. I have mixed feelings on the new HD fire tablets. First I'll briefly go over how I use my kindle, then the good and the bad stuff. So far I think it's definitely a step up from the previous generation and worth the purchase though. I do have a few gripes.I use my fire to do quick internet checks as it starts up much faster than a computer. I have a few eBooks and a LOT of audio books. Since our family has Amazon Prime and Netflix accounts I can also watch video on it when convenient. Finally, I surprisingly enjoy gaming on the tablet. I have a few gaming systems and with excellent games like Rayman Jungle Run, Cut the Rope, and Stupid Zombies 2,to name a few, I probably play games on the kindle more than on my PSP.So whats better? The new Kindles have an app called Free Time which finally gives parental control options for the device. And you can opt into the Free Time Unlimited service which is basically like Netflix for children's programming. This includes apps, videos and over 1,000 books. It's good but not perfect. I can micro-manage and designate how much time the kids can spend playing games versus reading for example. Or I can simply give them 2hrs per day and they can do what ever they choose. But I can't give them a different time allowance for weekends which is not cool. I'd like to, for example, have the option to maybe give them 2 hrs on school days and 5hrs on the weekends. Another shortcoming is that there is no way that a kid can log out of their account without a parent entering the password. This probably isn't an issue if the kid is the sole user of the tablet but I have 2 kids sharing so when they need to switch I have to log them out every time. It would have made more sense to let them log out to the profile selection screen and require a password only if backing out of that space. This wouldn't work for 5 year olds but at least allow this option for older kids who can have passwords. On the positive side, the parental feature disables ads and in-game purchasing in the child accounts. Unfortunately you still can't have more than 1 adult account though.Another new feature than I really enjoy is the immersive reading. If I have the eBook and audio book for select titles I can sync them. So I can look at the eBook text which highlights words in real time as the audio book plays. Or I can listen to my book during my commute and then read the ebook at home and the ebook will sync up to where the audio book left off. Thats very cool. The speaker sound is also much improved.The new models also have more storage. The screen also looks really good though I admit it doesn't really make that much of a difference for streaming video. It also had an HDMI port, but it's micro HDMI so you'll have to get the cable as it's unlikely you own one. On the up side it now has physical volume buttons. The virtual volume controls still exist. On the down side, the new models don't come with chargers included anymore and it seems to take much longer to charge than before. They can be purchased though.  Thats about all I can say. It does have a few more tricks like  wireless options and wifi, bluetooth for access external keyboards, and skype capabilities if you have the model with the built in camera. You can also take pics but since there is only the front facing camera it might be a bit awkward for taking pics of anything but yourself. And there are also new apps like the mail client, but since I share my tablet and you can't have more than one adult account I am unlikely to use it. Also I miss seeing the glowing power button or the charging battery animation when my old kindle charges. The new one doesn't seem to have it.One odd thing to mention is that the partially subsidized models (which is probably what you'll get if you buy from a physical store - Amazon calls it "special offers" on their site) have ads on the screen saver. You buy it a few bucks cheaper but you see the adds. If that bothers you, you can still pay the difference (one time fee - just a few dollars) to not see them though.Overall I like it. If you own a 1st gen and the new features don't appeal to you then stick with the first gen. Otherwise I think its a good buy. Hopefully this helped someone. :)

Reviews.Title: Better then I expected!
Reviews.Author: Paula Chapman
Reviews.Content: This has been such a dream come true and so much less expensive then a ipad. It has the camera, you can do video, take pictures, even skype with it. The pictures and video are wonderful. The screen is truly high defination. Those on comcast can put the comcast app on it from Imobile..and control what to watch, you can record from the DVR..you can even change channels from the Kindle fire. TV Shows are amazing with the high def screen.  The memory is amazing. Tons of room for apps, music, books..you name it.It does text to speech,surf the web.. the deal of ATT for 39.95 is perfect for me. When I am out and need to pull up a map of where I need to go, it is perfect. WiFi is almost everywhere...so the deal works wonderfully on the inbetween places where there is not wifi. If you need a comparable device to the IPAD and can not afford it.. this is so wonderful. Another plus.. Amazong gives one APP a day (full version) free. I am very pleased with this one! Very well worth the money you pay for it!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Dolby Audio, Dual-Band Wi-Fi, 16 GB - Includes
Reviews.Author: Sandra Gayle Ogilvie
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT !!!! To me its as good as having one of those expensive ipads. Couldn't be any better and so glad I decided on it.

Reviews.Title: 3RD Kindle
Reviews.Author: Betty Montgomery
Reviews.Content: I was given the Kindle Keyboard as a gift from my Husband..Loved it ..Then he gave me the Kindle Fire ( he liked the keyboard)AND THEN out comes the KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9 You guessed it, HE BOUGHT IT FOR ME>>> (he really liked the Kindle fire) haha So now I am really enjoying my new Kindle HD 8.9  I would like to hang on to it. So dont hurry to put out another one right away! My 6 year old granddaughter really wants mine. But I am keeping it. Also got 21 year old Granddaughter one....

Reviews.Title: I LOVE THE NEW KINDLE
Reviews.Author: Desiree Churbe
Reviews.Content: I DO LOVE THE PRICE AND NOW A BIGGER SCREEN, I APPLAUD AMAZON!!!A big Thank You from TEXAS State

Reviews.Title: great product
Reviews.Author: Denise Johnson
Reviews.Content: great product - easy to use - fast shipping exceded my expectations ! Would reccommend to all of my friends

Reviews.Title: Great!!!
Reviews.Author: J.B.Vesely
Reviews.Content: I purchased this in order to read books, but also to use the web, etc.I have not had any problems with this Kindle Fire HD, not even setting up the 4G with AT&T.;Any questions that I have had, I either read the user guide or asked on "chat" my question.  I'm very pleased with this purchase.Also, This product is on the same level ( from my point of view) as the apple IPad, if not better.The apps was easy to purchase and like magic the items appeared on the screen.I'm very glad that both wi-fi and 4g was offered, since I think when your lights go off due to storms and no wi-fi connections, I can use the 4g to connect to the web and the local tv station to fid out the status of the storm.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Size & Display Fantastic
Reviews.Author: Emily Ferris
Reviews.Content: The Kindle 8.9 was so easy to use.  Music sound was great.  My husband had a smaller one and could show me how to do things before I explored the options available. This product is really great!!!  I am taking online chef classes and need Adobe Flash Player & this is not compatible. I wanted to use this in my kitchen.Please know this Kindle is wonderful to read books, etc. It was beautiful to watch a movie, the clarity of the display is hi-tech. It is absolutely perfect for what it is intended.

Reviews.Title: Laney'
Reviews.Author: Laney
Reviews.Content: Great is all I can say.. Love using Prime..unlimited video and games. I now have Access to unlimited TV show that I may have missed.  love the Kindle Fire .

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9" Dolby, Dual-Band WiFi,16GB
Reviews.Author: caritas7
Reviews.Content: No disappointments, here.I love the Fire, but I still need to discover all its mysterious..this is a senior speaking. I ordered another guide for help. It sohld be here soon and I can give you a better resume.

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle fire
Reviews.Author: cynthia constable
Reviews.Content: I really hesitated about this purchase,but I have no regrets. The kindle arrived registered to my Amazon account,and I have had no problem navigating,or adding apps. I agree that the wall outlet charger should be included with purchase,shame on Amazon Gave the kindle 5 stars!!

Reviews.Title: Very cool tablet!
Reviews.Author: Robert
Reviews.Content: This is the first tablet I have ever owned and I am quite happy with it. I decided to go with the Kindle Fire HD because of the price compared to others.  So far I've used my device to read books and magazines as well as stream amazon prime movies and tv shows. I also did some studying as well as Christmas shopping on my kindle. I look forward to all the new content  that will  become available as the Kindle community grows.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Sylverdollar "Sylverdollar"
Reviews.Content: I love this tablet!  I have an I-Pad.  The two are similar, yet very different.  I purchased the Kindle to be my reader, but I got much, much more.  I also purchased the Prime Membership, so I have the perk of borrowing movies and books as a Prime member.  I am still learning how to maneuver the Kindle, but it is fun discovering how to use it.  I recommend it, and the price is very reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Great HD
Reviews.Author: Jean L. Taylor
Reviews.Content: Loved watching HD programming on this product.  Fully met my expectations. Picture and sound better than the smaller Kindle Fire..though it is a fine product, as well.

Reviews.Title: I really like the size of the screen.
Reviews.Author: DenM
Reviews.Content: Not as large as the ipad but costs a lot less. The sound is great from the dual speakers. It is a bit heavy to hold a long time but the Subcase Slim Fit Leather Case makes into a stand for reading a long time. Haven't tried out the features but I don't expect to be let down.

Reviews.Title: Kindle
Reviews.Author: Jackie B. Garner
Reviews.Content: Words can't express how much I love this little pad of greatness.  It is just the right size for traveling.  The HD picture color is just wonderful.  The first one I received had a problem but amazon replaced it within 2 days.  No problems with the second one.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD is HOTT
Reviews.Author: Pen Name
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is everything I expected and more. Fantastic picture quality, great sound, no hassle touch screen, and super easy set up! It literally took me 10 min to have this kindle fire HD set up with proper parental controls. The only downfall is that when a section is blocked it also blocks items purchased. The 8.9 inch screen is an excellent choice!

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: MikeyS
Reviews.Content: So far I love it. Great screenSound pretty goodWifi is fastCon, my wife wants to trade her 7 inch Fire for a 8.9

Reviews.Title: Bigger and Better
Reviews.Author: Big Ham
Reviews.Content: Although not much different than the 7 inch Kindle, I love the screen quality and the digital sound on my Kindle.  Good purchase.

Reviews.Title: It has some glitches
Reviews.Author: D. Friday
Reviews.Content: I find for the most part that I love this, however, it has some glitche's  that need to be worked out.  The tabs stop working at times and the screen freezes.I know that some of the issues are user problems.... lack of knowledge.  Saving downloaded info seems to be an issue for me.  Not with books, but with pics and crochet patterns.Otherwise, I can see how much I'm liking this.  Great to take along when going to have to wait at an office or in line somewhere.

Reviews.Title: Video
Reviews.Author: Eva McGhee
Reviews.Content: I am a kindle fire fan. I purchased the 4G for my son. We can't watch movies from amazon prime on the 4G but can movies from amazon prinme when connected to Wi-Fi. He is able to watch Netflix when on 4G. So I am not sure what's going on. But other than that issue, I really do like the New 8.9 Fire HD. And i plan to purchase the 8.9 Fire HD Wi-Fi for myself. I have the 2 first generation kindles and still enjoy those kindles as well.

Reviews.Title: nice
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I have had this for a month, and really like reading on it/ playing a casual gave from time to time, watched several movies on it. the sound for the movies is faaaaantastic. What a nice media piece. I Read two  magazines on it  for 1 dol a month. nice price.  Good number of quality apps.

Reviews.Title: Super TABLET
Reviews.Author: Rhonda
Reviews.Content: This has got to be the GREATEST WI FI Tablet EVER! Crystal clear pictures, sound and overall quality is beyond the other brands that cost two to three time what my Kindle cost and are not as good.

Reviews.Title: Amazon ROCKS!!!
Reviews.Author: RollTideGrl
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle fire, but first HD and I am loving the first few hours of owning it.  I have noticed that it is much faster than my last Kindle Fire and the touchscreen is better as being responsive.  You guys will not be disappointed with this purchase.  I own a Ipad with retina display and I love my Amazon on some many levels better.  I think music and books are cheaper and better deals on Amazon than Itunes. After all, on Amazon ecosystem you can buy groceries, household and everything else in between on your kindle.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Tina Leanne"
Reviews.Content: I can't seem to get enough of my Kindle! I miss it when I am at work and physically look for it when I don't have it in my hands.  I can use the keyboard like a typewriter...it is so awesome!  Love!

Reviews.Title: LOVE  LOVE  LOVE
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: THIS KINDLE IS AWESOME!!  SO GLAD I PURCHASED THE KINDLES FIRE HD..HAD A NOOK BUT THE KINDLE IS 50 TIMES BETTER.  GREAT PICTURE AND EASY TO USE.  I CAN'T PUT IT DOWN.  GREAT VALUE FOR ALL THAT IT IS CAPABLE OF DOWNLOADING AND DOING.

Reviews.Title: Awesome....
Reviews.Author: Vic Gonz
Reviews.Content: I must say this little item is a keeper... and I'm not even  an avid reader... But I'm getting there... lol... Sooo many thing you can do on this Kindle Fire H.D 8.9... I don't complain when i have to sit and wait at the Doctor's office anymore...lol... And everywhere I go I get asked about my kindle and I end up doing demonstrations and basically helping others buy one and it's needed accessories....

Reviews.Title: Despite a few minor design flaws, the Kindle Fire HD is an exceptional tablet
Reviews.Author: Snoopy1
Reviews.Content: The decision to go with an Amazon Kindle Fire HD (8.9") tablet versus an iPad or other tablet was admittedly heavily influenced by the amount of media that I had purchased from Amazon over time.  However, I still did my homework before I made the purchase including playing with both side by side for over an hour.  Since the iPad is the benchmark everyone seems to use, I will make some comparisons to that tablet.  First of all, the cost for a comparable tablet (I purchased a 32GB model) was considerably less for the Kindle Fire HD.  You only get the single camera with the Kindle Fire and the screen is smaller (8.9" versus 9.7" for the iPad) which wasn't a big factor for me.  What was a factor is that the Kindle Fire is lighter and a bit thinner, has dual Dolby speakers (compared to one for the iPad) and dual WiFi antennas.  The resolution on the new iPad is exceptional, but then again so is the Kindle Fire.  You need to compare them side by side to see if there is enough difference to justify the added cost of the iPad.  Battery life is advertised as about the same (11 hours for Kindle, 10 for iPad).  There are some minor design glitches on the Kindle Fire HD that have been covered in other reviews.  (1)The location of the power switch is not only hard to find, but you find yourself accidentally touching it frequently and turning off the tablet. I partially solved this problem by taking a silver marking pen and placing a dot next to where the power button is so that you don't have to turn the unit sideways to look for it and you can avoid it more easily with the dot marking the spot.  (2) the connection for the power cable is located at the bottom of the tablet (if you are holding the tablet horizontally).  If you are watching a movie and want to have the power cable connected, the plug rests on the surface which crimps the wire a bit and can't be good for the plug and wire.  I place two paperback books under the tablet at about the height of the plug which keeps it off the surface.  Obviously when you use the tablet on battery which is probably the majority of the time, this isn't an issue.  I have watched about 10 movies since I received my Kindle Fire and I must say that I am very impressed.  I have a high speed wireless internet connection (18 Mbs) and the movies are delivered without any pauses or jerky motions.  It is just like watching a movie on TV.  The sound is very good and the picture is truly HD quality.  Navigating around the Kindle Fire takes some practice.  The Help pages that Amazon provides are worth printing off for reference but still do not provide a full user's manual.  With time, I found that I liked how the screens were displayed and moving between the Amazon cloud and items loaded on the device a snap.  While it is not all totally intuitive, it doesn't take long to master the major steps to get through books, movies, etc.  Email was a little harder for me.  I have AT&T; (Uverse) email and there were some issues (for example not syncing contacts) that you won't face with something like gmail.  Finally, I saw a lot of comments on the case that is custom made for the Kindle Fire HD (about $54).  I didn't care whether it looked like leather or not.  I wanted something that had a custom fit look and protected my Kindle.  It does that.  The material it is made of looks more like a polycarbonate material and the cost is probably higher than it should be, but so far, I like it.  I have very little slippage problem when I stand it up on a hard surface.  Overall, I am very happy with my purchase and would recommend it to anyone that isn't an Apple fanatic.  I was all prepared to consider the new iPad, but I just didn't see enough difference that mattered to me to justify the added cost, but then each of you has your idea of what features matter the most.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: AnnS
Reviews.Content: This is my third kindle and I am happier than ever! The sound is so much better than the earlier kindle. The picture is clear and the color brilliant. This kindle is totally worth the price and every bit as good as it is advertised!!

Reviews.Title: Very nice product
Reviews.Author: Joseph A. Chitwood
Reviews.Content: This product is very well built. Very solid! There are a lot of features and apps available. So far, I am very happy with my purchase!Kindle Fire HD + Amazon Prime = Very Happy Wife

Reviews.Title: Great movie experience and good OS
Reviews.Author: Shawn Chen "Shawn"
Reviews.Content: The OS is better than I expected and movie experience is super.The appstore is a little limited but it's easy to work around and side load install other apk files like Chrome/QQ/etc which makes it more useful.Overall i like it very much.

Reviews.Title: Not bad at all
Reviews.Author: Walker
Reviews.Content: I don't live online and don't have, want, or need a smart phone; but I do travel a lot and ride a motorcycle so wanted a tablet to have at hand without unpacking the laptop; so I narrowed it down to this and the Samsung Tab.  All-in-all I think I made a good choice with this Kindle 8.9HD WiFi.No problem with the mail setup, even with my business servers; The screen is great; movies and reading excellent; it's easy to setup and use; it's fast; FB, Twitter, and other apps are there & all work great (no FourSquare app available - but I wouldn't use it anyway).  There seem to be enough app's available to do pretty much everything I need especially ones' to support other file formats for things I need to have with me.  It would be nice if Amazon would play nicer with the android community for other "toys", but, I'm not going to lose sleep over it.However ... had I known, the deal-breaker would have been that there is no driver for voice navigation and speech-to-text, and it doesn't support the TCM apps (just means I'll eventually get something else unless they do a software update).  But it is exactly what they say it is and a great little high-quality tablet.  If you're not too demanding on all kinds of extras, this thing is perfect.

Reviews.Title: Love It So Far
Reviews.Author: Ginny from AZ
Reviews.Content: Having owned the Kindle 2nd generation I was really excited about getting my Kindle HD for my 70th BD.  I just have to learn all the ins and outs with it, but I am happy with the voice, internet, and can read my books in any light now.  I wish it had come with a manual, but expected that as the 2nd didn't either, so I have downloaded from the internet the info I need, so I can reference what I want to know.  I also found that some of the shop tv shows were showing it, and I learned a few things watching them. If I find I don't care about some things, I will come back and add more.  I was really excited that we could travel and I could use this as a computer and book, leaving the laptop for my husband to use.After almost a month, I LOVE THIS EVEN MORE.  So, unfortunately, does my husband.Sooo I bought him one for Christmas!  I don't like sharing!!!!I was so excited about this that I didn't look far enough to find that the manual is on it.  Don't hesitate.  Buy this!!!!Note:  Still loving it after 5 months.  I have also added word and downloaded documents from my computer to the Kindle so I could take to meetings.  Worked great.Still happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Cynthia Rogers
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love the kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I wanted something I could read on and get on the internet with.  It works great!

Reviews.Title: beats the others hands down
Reviews.Author: evans
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as an upgrade from the original kindle and have been singing your praises all around. T he picture responsiveness are excellent! I used it to do lots of Christmas shopping due to its portability, and ease of use. Who needs an Ipad, I`m sticking with my Kindle :-)

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hd
Reviews.Author: Christy
Reviews.Content: I love the new kindle and now i will be able to skype with my kids.  I just need to learn how to do more things with it.  It should come with a book for dummies!

Reviews.Title: As advertised.
Reviews.Author: David M
Reviews.Content: Much debate between the Fire and iPad.  Graphics are outstanding and the physical thickness (overall size) is very similar to the iPad.  Overall, very pleased with the 9" Fire.

Reviews.Title: so far so good
Reviews.Author: L. Belasco "belascol"
Reviews.Content: I just got it, and I haven't tried out everything that I can do with it yet.  I love the bigger screen than the original Kindle Fire, and I love that Amazon is giving us more options with movies--renting as opposed to buying.  But so far all my books, movies, newspapers and magazines are all coming through fine--great picture quality, and I can adjust the print for my books so that I don't need my drug store glasses.  I may review again--but for now 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE
Reviews.Author: b
Reviews.Content: I LOVE IT! The HD is awesome and I can play all types of games and the color is amazing. The only down side is that about four times a day it freezes and I have to turn it off. The battery lasts all day (I'm sure it would last longer if I wasn't on it all day long) but it is awesome. It is my first tablet and I wouldn't trade it for anything.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Lena Grey
Reviews.Content: I'm still learning to use my Fire, but so far I like it a lot. It's definitely worth the money. Thanks Kindle!

Reviews.Title: Love it.
Reviews.Author: Tina
Reviews.Content: Was very excited to get my new Fire. Love the larger screen size. Video is very crisp and clear. Sound is good. Haven't had lots of time to play with it yet, but so far it is everything I've come to expect from Amazon and Kindle. It is a little heavier, which was expected because it is bigger and the case I bought with it adds a little weight. Adding my email account was a snap and it linked me with my Facebook account as part of the registration process.... however, I can't seem to find the Facebook app now. Don't know if I inadvertedly deleted it or what, but it seems to have disappeared. Has anyone else had this problem?

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" HD is all it is advertised to be!!!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: The Fire 8.9" HD is everything I hoped it would be and more.  Picture quality is excellent and sound quality is very good, considering the size of the speakers. Surfing the web is very fast.  All in all, a great return for the money.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: The Pros:Amazon Prime Instant Videos - awesomeExtremely sharp picture. I did a side-by-side comparison with my Samsung Galaxy Tab. I froze the pictures in the same spot while streaming. The Kindle HD won hands down.The build is very solid, however this Pro comes with a caveat (see below).The software, with one exception (see below) is very solid-responsive and quick.The sound quality through the on-board speakers or through headphones is quite good. The Cons:It boots up slowly.It is too heavy, in my opinion, in relationship to it's size. It has a smaller footprint than the Tab or the iPad, but weighs more (the caveat mentioned in Pros).Buttons are too small, poorly placed, and unresponsive, in my opinion.The software issue I mentioned in Pros was the email app. I use Gmail and the interface presented in the mail app is lacking in functionality and lacks the simplicity Gmail usually presents.It takes a LONG time to recharge, even plugged in to the wallNo access to the Play Store. I realize it's a closed system but it is too closed. Apps I use often that I am unable to access on the Kindle include:DropBox, Directv, Delta, an actual Gmail app, Google drive, Logitech Alert, American Express, and Scrabble. Summary:A well built, albeit heavier machine. As mentioned, the picture, sound and content purchase options are great. The buttons need work, the apps need work, the closed system needs work. If you are looking for a device to mostly consume items from the Amazon storefront(s)and do not mind some functionality trade offs, this device will work for you.

Reviews.Title: Mostly good, room for improvement and all about usage
Reviews.Author: Caveat Emptor
Reviews.Content: Kindle's HD 8.9 is a product I had waited for since before it was even a rumor.  On balance its actual performance should please some, displease some and mostly be found a welcome addition for those whose digital world is centered in the Amazon eco-system.  It all rather depends on what you are looking for--- even within the Amazon system.  As an owner of the iPad's every generation, a couple of iterations of various android tablets, iPods/iPhones and the odd e-reader, including the original kindle, I believe I have a better grasp than many on the real world factors which judge success and failure in such devices generally.Without trying to reinvent the wheel in this review or go too far afield in measurements and techno-speak, I feel a select group of factors are to the point particularly with this specific item and I will confine comments to those, so that a concise and understandable comparison with not only choices of other devices, but most importantly the unique and singular needs this one fulfills best.Specific factors: size, screen quality, form factor, durability, flexibility, value (cost/what you get) and continued satisfaction in longterm.This version of the Kindle has a number of capabilities: as a limited personal computing device for web-surfing, document handling and light office duty, as an ebook reader, streaming media player, etc., but not to get into the weeds of such a shopping list I will jump to the end and simply state that what it is or should be seen as is as a media player which occasionally is used for some of these other  tasks.  A laptop, even a lightweight and inexpensive ultra-book is going to do office jobs and web-surfing better, a couple of tablets, most notably the Nexus and the iPad are more flexible and higher powered for running apps, with greater libraries of apps to draw on even.  A smartphone is lighter and more portable.  However--beginning with a screen that is absolutely comparable with the deservedly touted retina display, a nimble combination of hardware components that make for stellar responsiveness-- especially for those persons within the Amazon Prime family, this tablet leaves all others in the dust for the breadth of high quality media (movies predominantly) delivered.As a streaming media device the amount of storage is of relatively minor impact as what is left of the baseline 16 gigs should absolutely be more than enough for a few apps, pictures, a moderately robust collection of audio books, books and music (think of this device as the equivalent of your everyday carry bag or commuter backpack for your media).  Since you are streaming your movie content from Amazon and have an infinite storage space for your Amazon content: books, audio books and music; you really shouldn't be storing much on it.If you are more about a purse or a briefcase or if what you are predominantly doing is reading ebooks then you need to look to the 7" little brother with its lower price, as the greater real estate of the 8.9 inch doesn't do for you or doesn't appreciably add, respectively.  Similarly, if your primary thrust is for your children, since it is easier in smaller hands and comes with all of the same services, the smaller/less expensive version is your sweet spot.It feels solid and sturdy, much more so than a number of similarly sized android tablets.  It has a nicely finished surface for gripping and has an edge to edge glass screen which is scratch resistant and tolerably low in reflective glare.  Though some reports have contested the claim of its speedy wifi connectivity, for streaming video it is second to none and flawless with no discernible stuttering, freezing or hiccuping for buffering.  The pricey, optional Amazon tablet cover/case preserves all the physical aspects of the tablet including its svelte lines, further extending its durability without turning it into a giant plastic brick.Finally, while including most every nicety you find on other tablets bluetooth, hdmi out, support for Exchange based corporate email, Skype and social media integration--- it adds a few of its own, Amazon specific extras like Read to me, Whispersync, integration into the Amazon shopping experience including product suggestions etc, the new X-ray function for most consumable content, a huge lending library of free books and a gigantic and heavily discounted textbook rental library-- making overall value untouchable (again for those in the Amazon system) by any of its tablet competitors.The single, largest deficit is the battery life.  While an improvement on the earlier version of the Fire, the 10 hour claim is pure marketing fantasy.  One of the real pluses, its thinness, doesn't leave enough room for a sufficiently sized battery. The real world battery usage will run between 6-71/2 hours depending on screen brightness being set anywhere from 50-100%.  While minimally acceptable, in the age of similar devices running in excess of 10 hours, this is far from ideal. On the flip side of that, with the speedy charger (which should be free, but isn't) the recharge time from near 0 to fully charged is considerably under the 5 hours they promise---taking roughly 3 1/2 hours or around 2 1/2 hours for 80%.The single biggest asset of the device is Amazon, itself.  Its track record, its overall services, but most of all its customer service--which in my considered opinion is not only light years ahead of its nearest rival, Apple, but in a consumer world of deception, built in obsolescence and recorded telephone loops...the closest thing to absolute perfection any of us will ever see from a business.  For this alone you may bank on the long term reliability and value of your purchase.Final thoughts:  I underscore that this is a media streaming device, if your primary thrust is something else, look elsewhere (though as an affordable electronic babysitter or a way of cutting textbook costs it may likewise prove the singular touchstone for those strongly of those needs).  The 4G LTE option is potentially a killer for Amazon, but not as it exists now.  Until Amazon can work out a deal with a cellular provider based upon the muscle of their client base so that an unlimited or at least a very large allotment per month (5-10 gigs) for a reasonable, flat yearly charge, it is all but useless.  For a media streaming device, what does the present allotment buy you in terms of streaming--1/2 of one movie?  Why would you pay double for the LTE version, essentially so you could do email and download that book which you JUST can't put off another 15 minutes until you reach home, office, Starbucks or the train? I don't think so!!If there were a percentage rating possible I would have given something in the mid to upper 80s, even with the very disappointing battery life, but with stars it has to be 4 until that one problem is substantially solved.  On balance, I love this device.

Reviews.Title: WOW!!!
Reviews.Author: V. Woyak
Reviews.Content: I am a first time ereader/tablet owner.  All I can say is, WOW! Oh, and now what do I do with my almost new laptop that is now going to collect a LOT of dust!!!  The Kindle's screen is so sharp and clear it's just amazing!!!  2 complaints however.  first, this is going to cost me some money because I want EVERYTHING it can do and all the books!!!!  Many of the coolest apps are free!!!  I love the "toys" on it as well, like the autoharp and piano. My only serious complaint is the inability to upgrade the flash player so I can play my favorite FB game on my Kindle.  I know this is not Kindle's fault, but am wondering what this will mean down the road since Flash player is no longer supporting the android format. Not seriously concerned however because I am sure someone will quickly come up with a fix, they always do :)Overall, any one considering the Kindle Fire Hd 8.9, WHAT ARE YOU WAITING FOR???

Reviews.Title: ATT service does not activate
Reviews.Author: caroline a strachan
Reviews.Content: I had to go to 3 different wifi locations to activate the Kindle but the ATT service never activated. I called Amazon twice and they said call ATT. So I called ATT and they said call Amazon. I have been bounced back and forth but no one can help me. I spent $500. for something that does not work.

Reviews.Title: Not a smart purchase
Reviews.Author: ChadK
Reviews.Content: Had a terriable experience.First problem. It is loaded with intrusive adds to include the lock screen. There's an option to pay $15 to remove adds. That's only for the lock screen there are still all over once you get past lock screen.Second problem.You can't customize anything. Lock screen back ground, nothing. Even if you pay to remove the adds.Third problem.It's slow and doesn't play a lot of videos on websites such as ABC or NBC for shows like SNL.Fourth problem.It wouldn't charge past 80 percent when it would charge. I had to send it back and told them to keep it.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service Was Bad
Reviews.Author: Norman T. Franklin
Reviews.Content: Worked GREAT until Oct. 20th, 2013.  Would not download any games but everything else worked fine.  After several hours on phone with techs they decided to replace it.  The new one did the same thing...would take several days to download a game and then get an error message.  Again spent several hours on the phone with techs over three days.  I was disconnected twice while being transferred. Got to the point again of returning and replacing kindle when I got transferred to a tech in APPS Store.  He wanted to go through the whole troubleshooting process again after being on the phone for over 2 hrs prior.  He was rude and had a superior attitude after I could not keep up with him and what he wanted me to do.  Finally I told him I wanted to return the kindle completely for a refund.During all of this we did talk to one customer service lady, Mary Ann, and she was wonderful.  Thank you Mary Ann.My advice is to make sure you buy the extended warranty and be ready to deal with some horrible customer service.

Reviews.Title: Do Not Waste Your Money
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Keeps FreezingI have had to return 3 times and am still without a working device. It freezes, screen flickers, and now the newest one will not hold  a charge.

Reviews.Title: I can't put it down!
Reviews.Author: Sandy C.
Reviews.Content: I had an older Kindle that needed to be replaced, so I researched iPads, Windows tablets, and other options, but ultimately decided that my needs suited the Kindle.  I upgraded to the smaller model with less power and without 4G.  Once it arrived, I loved it and also realized I couldn't ever put it down, so I immediately upgraded to the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" 4G LTE Wireless.  It is far more than I ever imagined, and I don't know how I've lived without it so far.  I LOVE, LOVE, LOVE my new Kindle.

Reviews.Title: Good if you never want anything but Amazon stuff
Reviews.Author: Dudley's Dad
Reviews.Content: I have the original 7" Fire and an 8.9" Fire HD and have had much experience with both.  The physical construction of both is quite good, although I find the smaller Fire much easier to move around with, and I like its implementation of the Starter page for the Web browser infinitely better than that of the HD, which sticks one with a bunch of crappy "Selected" sites that apparently pay Amazon to stick links on your screen that you have zero control over, and a bunch more of "Trending" stuff that I would love to disable. I would really like to have MY Selected sites (favorites) displayed on screen in lieu of Amazon's, and perhaps more of my recent history.  However, two thirds of the screen is consumed by the Amazon-imposed links.  I also miss the externally viewable LED indication of "Fully Charged/Charging" status...if the HD is turned off, I have to turn it on to see if it is charged, which seems a bit regressive in terms of human design.  However, the addition of an external volume control with the HD implementation is quite helpful.  As for the power button, I like the Fire's better because of instant feedback, where with the HD I just have to wait to see if I depressed it far enough.  That a minor annoyance, at most, but one designers may want to look at in the future,As I noted, the physical quality of the units is excellent, so my beefs are with the software/firmware limitations.  My major grouse is the intentional blocking of apps that run fine on other Androids, but apparently Amazon has crippled their version so that it will accept only apps obtained via Amazon.  Worse yet, some apps that would run on the Fire won't run on the Fire HD.  Let me state now that if one is technically proficient and determined, one can often "sideload" apps not approved by Amazon which work fine...in fact, I routinely use a browser on my HD that I find more responsive than Amazon's and it displays what I want displayed, not what Amazon selects for me, plus I can watch webcasts and similar videos which apparently Amazon hasn't figured out how to handle since Adobe refused to support Flash Player on Android. I understand the desire to control what is loaded, but some of their protection is clearly self-serving, and not about users at all (at least in my opinion).  So here is the important take-away from this:  If you are willing to live exclusively in a world where Amazon dictates what is available to you, you'll love the unit.  Otherwise, get ready to live without some really useful apps or to take the risk of running them down on the net and side-loading them (some of which can indeed booger up your system).By the way, for those grousing about the power charging unit not being included, that is clear in the material and ordering process. Since some people already have several adequate charging modules, and since Amazon cuts you a deal when you order if you don't already have one, that's just not a legitimate gripe!  After all, why should those who don't need a charger have to buy one anyway?However, when one pays to avoid advertising content, only to have it imposed on the start page of the browser in terms of "Selected" internet sites not controlled by the user, I feel that I have been had.  However, as stated above, I don't necessarily use their browser that much anyway, so what the heck!  It is just so dishonest!If I buy another tablet, it will absolutely be a tablet upon which I can load whatever I want to load so long as it is written for Android, so it will likely not be another Amazon product, unless they alter course considerably.  Of course, they make their choices, and we all have to ultimately make ours.  Just be fully informed, check out some online demo's or evaluations and/or check out a friend's before you buy.

Reviews.Title: product is great.......app selection is for children.
Reviews.Author: taw
Reviews.Content: I've been a huge amazon fan for a long time. So when I was looking around for a tablet or reader my first thought obviously went to amazon.  The quality of the actual kindle is great. And I had been aware before I purchased it that I wouldn't have access to google play apps(which seems very odd since my google phone goes out of its way to promote amazon). That said I expected amazon to have at least comparable app's. Much to my surprise I can't get my local bank app,  groupon which has my local discounts, nor can I  get my local news app just to name a few. Very disappointed in the app selection offered, every time I open the page it looks like it's set up for a 6 or 8 year old.I also have a lot of issues with connectivity to WiFi even at home. I'll be able to connect to my laptop but not to my kindle. If you want the kindle to read it's a great option, but if you want more think about going with an android full operating system tablet. I will still shop with Amazon because the products and service are above average. I however can't say that I will push to purchase a direct Amazon product again.

Reviews.Title: I can't believe after all of the research that I did, I don't like it.
Reviews.Author: B. Elmore
Reviews.Content: I sew a lot, so I keep movies and tv shows streaming on my computer for entertainment. I'm also read a lot. I also buy a lot of music. All of these things have Amazon in common.  I am a good customer.  So since my computer was suffering under the weight of all of those downloaded files and since I was getting the blue screen of death about once a week, I decided to take action.I researched and looked for a solution.My thinking: if I could get a tablet that could take the Amazon content off my computer, I might be able to extend the life of my laptop.  I looked at the Microsoft Surface and the Amazon Kindle seriously. I read all of the reviews, I put out messages to friends who have one or the other, I asked questions.  In the end, mostly because of price and ties to Amazon, I opted to get the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  Since most of my online activity includes Amazon, I thought it would be the better purchase.My first complaint is about the shipping service. I am a Prime customer. I deserve better shipping than what I got.  Now, I do have many of my Amazon purchases sent to a PO Box.  I know, how un-American of me, but I don't live in a sweet little neighborhood with mailboxes out front. I live in the wild west with directions to houses that go something like this: Go five miles out and take the only road that you see left. Go another 2.56 miles and when you see the bush on the left, turn right.  Now, the UPS driver that serves our area knows all of us. He knows where we live, he knows where we work, he knows our children and where they work. He knows if he can get down our road if it rains, he knows who our friends are and where he can leave it if our road is impassable.  Fed Ex sends a different driver almost every time. Packages get lost or left with the wrong person. No worries. They signed for it!!  Now, if you were me, would you have your expensive Kindle purchase sent to your house or would you go ahead and have it sent to your PO Box.  Most people can find the post office. Even FedEx.  My Kindle sat at the FedEX facility in a large city in my state for 36 hours!!!  There is no excuse for that.  The post office does have expedited shipping, why can't Amazon use that?  Or let me have the choice between UPS and FedEX on everything that I purchase. That would be great and worth the $79 that I spend every year to enjoy Prime shipping.Right out of the box, I could have used a manual.  I'm not stupid and I'm not of the "no tech" generation.  I'm of the "it's passing me by" generation.  The little iphone sized card called "Getting Started" isn't very informative. I found the on/off button and the volume.  I found the USB charger outlet thing. That mini USB connection feels so fragile. I miss the big ones. They at least felt like you could plug it in and not be damaging it.  The cord and the connector are stiff and I'm really worried that I'll mess those pins up when I plug it in.  I don't care for fragile things.  I like things with a more substantial feel.So, I finally get my Kindle.  Being so rural, I admit that my internet options are limited. But, I chatted online with someone from Amazon about the Kindle and the possibility that the internet wouldn't work.  It does work, but it doesn't work like Amazon said it would. I said that I have DSL. I didn't hide anything. Internet reception is just ok.  If you live in a really rural area and you have to rely on DSL, it is going to be slow.  The Kindle will stream a little less well than streaming on your computer. It won't get better. You've been warned.Next, I have had a few electronic devices. I was a technology geek for awhile, but just got tired of trying to keep up. So, I know some things and haven't a clue about others.  Here is something I do know. Screens need to be calibrated.  If Kindle has a way to calibrate screens, I haven't found it.  Another good topic for a manual.  The reason I say this is because when I try to move a book off of my device or from the carousel, I'm supposed to be able to put my finger on the image and hold. After holding, a menu pops up and says, "remove from device, or carousel" depending upon which screen you are in.  This is the most frustrating procedure!! Six, eight times I placed my finger and hold and the image just shivers and there is no menu.  And typing a help message to the Kindle crew was a disaster. The space bar wouldn't engage and if I wanted to move the cursor, I couldn't move it with a key, I had to place my finger on the message in the approximate position and  hold. It took me 30 minutes to type a simple help message of 5 lines.  The screen needs to be calibrated.Next, my audible books didn't transfer.  I had my audible account long before Amazon bought them, so my passwords were not synced.  Last night, when I tried to use the help, I got a "contact us" (the awful email). This morning when I looked I got an explanation.  I changed my audible account in order to use my Amazon credentials.  Still nothing. There is no way, that I can find, that will let my Kindle know that I've made the changes.  Help search was no help and this would be a good time for a manual.  I still have had no word from the help team at Amazon.  I also had trouble with my email account, but that did work itself our this morning.Finally, as I'm checking out all of the features, I went into books.  I downloaded several books and went exploring.  I went into my ESV Bible hoping that I could take my Kindle to church (larger fonts).  I could not figure out how to move around in the book.  Once you are in it, any book, all of the options, like the back arrow and the home button disappear.  Okay, maybe you access those buttons like the settings, you pull down with your finger from the top, right? No.  I completely stumbled on tapping the book to get the options back.  Manual. Or at least another little iphone sized card with helpful hints.  Good Grief.By this time, I'm pretty frustrated. I'm happy that I saved my boxes and that I opened everything carefully.After sleeping on it, I got up this morning to take another look. I did get my email account on, but I still don't have access to my Audible account. I can access Prime Instant video and it will stream. Until the buffer is full, it pauses about every 30 seconds.  I pause at the beginning and then once it buffers, I watch.  But that dual antenna thing doesn't work in rural areas.  That was the main question that I asked, and I always got the same answer: If you can stream on your computer, you can stream on a Kindle. True, but you neglected to mention that it doesn't stream AS WELL.What do I like?The picture and the video are good.The sound is good.I like the fact that I can move content from Kindle to Cloud and back again.  That feature on the PC versions of Kindle and Unbox would have been very helpful and I wouldn't have found myself in that original predicament.  Anyway, I'm glad to have that ability. That is probably THE reason that I won't return this to Amazon.The core stuff that the Kindle is meant to do...works.I uninstalled Unbox off of my computer this morning and regained 220 GB of space. My computer already runs a little better.Bottom line: After taking some time with the Kindle Fire, I'll keep it.  I think that it will do what I wanted it to do. It will take over my Amazon content. I can do my browsing on it. I don't go that many places.  I can't watch hulu because I don't have a hulu plus membership and I can't watch anything on CBS, but I can still do that on my computer.  I'm going to reserve judgement about whether I'd buy the Kindle again. Maybe in time, I'll love it or at least like it better.`

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire great when it works
Reviews.Author: judith wallace
Reviews.Content: I was very excited when I got my first kindle as a gift from my husband. Three weeks later it just quit working. Would not turn on or recharge. After talking to a customer rep. I was sent a new Kindle and I returned the one not. working. The new one that the company sent me worked fine until last Thrusday. My husband and myself were playing Dragon Gem on it. Later on in the evening, I turned it on and went to Facebook to see if my Brother was on line. He was not, so when I closed out Facebook to go back to games, the screen went black and I HAVE NOT been able to get it to turn on. This morning I tried and all that came up was a picture of the battery showing it needed charging. The Kindle has been charging over night and all day yesterday. I really enjoy my kindle, but this is the second one that has quit working on me. I have babied both of these because I know what was paid for them. I would like for the company to replace this one also, or send me my money back. I really enjoyed the Kindle WHEN it worked and love the games I have loaded on it. Thank you, Judy Wallace

Reviews.Title: It really is a great product.
Reviews.Author: NJGirl
Reviews.Content: For the money, this tablet is fabulous. Other "big name" tablets may seem to have all the glamor, but honestly this works JUST as well. It's easy to use and it has a ton of apps. I purchased a cover and bluetooth keyboard from amazon.com for it too for $30 and it really is one of the best purchases I've ever made. And since it works on the android system its charger is android so you can interchange them with your cellphone if you have an android.

Reviews.Title: Not Quite Ready For Prime Time
Reviews.Author: Eric Garlepp "EEG"
Reviews.Content: Basically I had 4 different Kindle HD 8.9" fire's sent to me.  Each with a different hardware issue.  I really, really wanted it to work especially since i bought my son a 7" one and i have all the Amazon services.  But it was not to be, the first one had a problematic screen with a line through it after a day or 2 or very lite usage. The second one came and would not charge at all, i tried a few different chargers including the extra one i bought.  The third one, half the screen went black after using it for 3 hours and it would not charge and the fourth had charging issues as well. I gave ti 2 stars instead of 1 was because when it works it works well, but i can't deal with hardware issues especially when it is a gift for my wife. My sons 7" is working fine, i just bought my wife a refurbished iPad and will wait till they come out with the next iteration of hardware.  Come on Amazon, i have all your services and want to invest in your ecosystem, i just can't have spotty hardware.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Customer Service - Fantastic!!!
Reviews.Author: E. Schroder
Reviews.Content: I have not received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 yet....  I called (or actually they called me at my request) today at 11 am to tell them that my original Kindle Fire (from 11/11 when they first came out) would not charge anymore.  We went through a few 'fix-it' things and both agreed that it was not going to charge no matter what.  So - I was offered some very nice deals (for a device that was well out of warranty..) and chose the one to get a significant dollar amount ($100) off of a Fire HD 8.9.  Because I am a Prime member they said that I would get it in two days.  Thinking that I would have withdrawals for at least one day, I used up the remaining battery power on my beloved Fire.  But guess what!?!?!  I just got an email saying that my new Fire would be here tomorrow!!!! I am delighted! People may complain about Amazon not including the charger (and I agree with the complaints) but you cannot beat 24-30 hour delivery on an significantly discounted item.  I realize that about 2 people will read this review - but I had to write it.  It is SO easy to complain about bad service, but not enough people talk about good service.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: sandy
Reviews.Content: I suffered  a broken neck and have problems with processing and comprehension.  It has affected my ability to use the computer upstairs because of walking, my laptop is too bulky and the Kindle is just right.  I need to spend more time learning how to use it properly though.  Since retiring from teaching 12 years ago, I have not kept up on the latest technology so the first 6 year old I could find gave me a crash course on how to use my new Kindle.  I'm still learning and know many adventures await me with my Kindle as my guide.

Reviews.Title: I continue to be in awe over your service.
Reviews.Author: A. Berry
Reviews.Content: Never have I gotten less than extra special service from Amazon.  At Christmas when my order of 2 Kindles wasn't delivered, a replacement was sent at once.  Last week, my Kindle wasn't charging and immediately the rep said a new one was on the way.  This is before the broken Kindle was was shipped back.  Awesome.  Most companies want the other broken one in hand before sending a new one.  When I call for service, the phone rings at once and a live person talks to me.  I use Amazon for publishing as well and enjoy the same stellar service.  I go out of my way to buy from Amazon, I am so pleased with the service.

Reviews.Title: Initial Thoughts
Reviews.Author: tunafish
Reviews.Content: I purchased a Nexus 7 but exchanged it for the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 at my local Office store. The reason is that I found the 7 inch screen to small to comfortably watch movies or do much of anything else. Also, the Nexus 7 had terrible wifi reception for me. I would need to stay within about 30 feet of my router to get at least two bars out of four. And forget about getting any reception once I walked out the front door. The Kindle Fire has been much better. Whereas I was not getting any reception bars just outside my front door with the Nexus 7, I am still getting 3 bars out of four with the Kindle Fire 8.9. I am finding that no matter where I go in my home, I am able to get a good reception. Also, the extra two inches and increased resolution of the Kindle Fire makes a world of difference. I talked myself into thinking that a pure version of android, which the Nexus 7 had, would be great. But I found I only need or would use maybe 30 or so apps. So why on Earth would I need over 700,000 apps, or even have the time to look at that many apps? The only negative I have with the Kindle Fire 8.9 is that just like other tablets, it is hard to use  in sunlight with all the glare. Otherwise, I think it is a very good value.

Reviews.Title: A stable platform for what you need.
Reviews.Author: Charles Ballard "I'll get a better sig when I...
Reviews.Content: Friends,  I am a courier and I got the AKFHD primarily so I could access my company's server for data entry while working.  I ordered it on Friday morning around 7a.m. central time, and requested next day delivery.  Sure enough, it was delivered before noon Saturday.  I immediately signed up for Amazon Prime and ATT 4GLTE service.  I later discovered that you can't access AMAZON PRIME videos from the 4GLTE connection.  Why?  I'd like to know!!!!  You can only access it from the Wi-Fi connection.  Which I CANNOT do when my computer is on (apparently 100% of my ATT DSL speed is good enough to stream Amazon Prime, but 50% is just NOT enough as it kept exiting after about 30 seconds because the vid hadn't started yet.  It wouldn't even BUFFER).  But I have watched vid on it while the computer was off, and it does work fine on my wi-fi connection.  It just needs to be alone.  For the record, I have DSL that is rated at 50X faster than dial-up.  In my area that is the 2nd tier of service, with 2 tiers above it (I believe 75 and 100X faster than dial-up).  The video NEVER exhibited any flaws while I was watching.  I have yet to explore all of the AKFHD's features, but I am enjoying this little black box.  I even found myself "Borrowing" a book from Amazon Prime today.  I have to be honest, I did not think I would be able to read a story that was not on paper, but this has changed my mind.  I won't stop collecting paper books, mind you.  If anything I think they will become much more valuable and desirable in years to come.  But the AKFHD is usable and I will most certainly be borrowing and probably purchasing books digitally.  I hope this review helps someone.  And if I may make a suggestion... if and when you order yours, get the QUICK CHARGER (you'll be glad you did), and get a COVER or CASE as well.  I did not get the case, so now I have to make the big decision.  Decisions, decisions....

Reviews.Title: I LOVE MY KINDLE!!
Reviews.Author: Kate Fredericks "Kate"
Reviews.Content: I have already reviewed the smaller Kindle Fire, so I'm not going to do the two page report like I normally would. Let me just say that one of the reasons I upgraded to the larger tablet is because I want to watch movies on it and not have to watch it on a micro mini screen. The reason I bought the KINDLE as opposed to the Motorola or the Ipad are a bit more involved. I have the Motorola tablet - admittedly an older one - but it was very heavy and it used Windows which meant I had to have a browser - Google or Firefox or whatever. I found it to be sluggish and confusing. Enough said. I refuse to buy into the Apple world simply because they are trying to set themselves up with the snob factor, like - I own a Mercedes Benz, aren't I cool? NO!! You aren't cool when you could have bought TWO really nice Buicks or Hondas for the same price - buy one for yourself and buy one for the poor family in the next, lower class neighborhood who can barely keep their old car running! Oh, I own an Ipad, I paid twice as much as the cool Kindle, but don't I look successful???? NO! You look like somebody who doesn't care that there are people starving and freezing because they can't afford food and oil. Take the extra $300 you paid for the Ipad and donate it to the nearest homeless shelter!OK, I had to get that out of my system because it really is something I do not understand in humanity today. The Kindle - I LOVE the Silk they use. I can move around in my Kindle just as fast as I can in my laptop. I love the book section and spend more than my share of time browsing around. There are a ton of really good FREE books you can get. Plus, unlike the other snobby tablet, you can buy books at other estores, too! Isn't sharing nice? I LOVE the movies. Oh my goodness!! I just got this tablet Tuesday night and luckily, the young lady who took my order had it all set up for me so I just opened it, plugged it in, and there everything was! With the exception of my notepad, which I had to hand type from the old Kindle to the new one. Small issue. Anyway, I plugged in my earphones and flipped into a movie supplier and BOOM!! The sound was outstanding. I cannot tell you how amazing it was. The difference between the sound in this Kindle and the non HD Kindle without Dolby sound is spectacular. I am going to get Titanic out tomorrow JUST for the sound!!! The picture is so clear, honestly is hurt my eyes (I am just too used to blurry pictures, my eyes need to literally adjust to the pure clarity of this larger HD Kindle).So, yes, I LOVE this Kindle. So, why didn't I give it 5 stars? Because, the reason I upgraded from the regular to the tablet HD was that the Keyboard was so wonky, I had trouble ALL THE TIME. I thought it was broken, honestly. But, this one does the same thing. Also? I cannot for the life of me get my email working or Facebook to work. Not a BIG deal since it is fast and easy to get on the web and get there that way, but I just think they could have gotten the glitches OUT of these Kindles by now!!! Those are my two reasons for them losing a star.Another thing I LOVE about the Kindle (in general) is the Carousel. I don't know why it is so easy for me to get around using the Carousel, other than the fact that the things you use most (having Facebook and my email up there would be nice!), books, movies, weather apps, games, magazines, whatever you use most are always right up front on the Carousel when you open it. So convenient! And as for jumping on the web, it's also on a sort of Carousel above the Carousel. In other words, if you want to go to your books section, it is written across the top of the Carousel, along with the movie section, the magazine section, the app section and the web. The web is SO EASY TO USE on Kindle. What I have learned to do is simply leave FB open in a tab (not my email, having had someone TRY to hack it in January), so I go up and hit web and flip open Facebook and voila! There it is! Oh, also, you have the really wonderful Mp3 Amazon Cloud Player which I also LOVE LOVE LOVE!!! Again, not snobby in that you can ONLY by from Amazon, but you can buy from other stores as well (unlike the snobby tablet). I found it easy to use and the sound is spectacular. Again, you can also find some awesome free music there as well.So, yes, I am a Kindle all the way kind of girl. That's my opinion and the fact that this tablet is so thin and light, there is a lot of WOW factors there! One more thing? I want to shout out to the Customer Service Reps at Amazon. Because I am an Amazon junkie, I end up talking to a lot of Customer Service people. Once in a while I get a clunker, but that is rare. I have found most reps to be very helpful. I buy from other sources as well, but hands down, Amazon has the BEST Customer Service that I deal with. So, I HIGHLY recommend, for the money and the experience, getting a Kindle instead of "other" tablets. Still need to work on the keyboard, my phone has a MUCH better keyboard than the Kindle, but I can live with it. The set up, the books, the sound, the convenience, the fast pace, is superb. Get thyself out and buy the Kindle. Pay the extra $50 and get the HD, too. I didn't think it would make that much of a difference, but having had both, I can say without a shadow of a doubt, it does!

Reviews.Title: Love my new kindle!
Reviews.Author: maviboncuk
Reviews.Content: I'm going to make my review short and quick. I gave it five stars because it's an awesome tablet that is fast, sleek and very easy to use.  I previously had t he original kindle fire and needed an upgrade. It's well worth the money and would recommend it to anyone who is considering purchasing this item.

Reviews.Title: Latest and greatest
Reviews.Author: S. Carlson
Reviews.Content: I owned the original Kindle Fire, which I have thoroughly enjoyed for over a year...simply put it is a very good tablet, which I didn't believe was due for replacement. Until now. The Fire HD takes everything I love about the original (graphics, sound, ease of use) and blows me away all over again. I love the huge screen and the stunning resolution it can achieve when watching streaming video. The Dolby audio system is stellar and sounds as good as I'd imagine something that small can sound. Downloading apps is significantly faster with the dual antenna Wi-Fi setup. I can't wait to see what Amazon does next...I'm just hoping for a little more longevity out of this one than the last.

Reviews.Title: I am in love, well at least in serious like!!!
Reviews.Author: Kenshin
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I will admit that I was a little upset that my hubb got this for me.  It seemed somewhat extravagant and I figured, I would just use my old "tablet" and be happy.  WRONG.  The kindle is the boss of all ereaders and tablets.  I have tinkered with various tablets, in our home we own three other brands and none are superior to this kindle. The HD looks better than our HDTV. It does EVERYTHING that it claims and more.  If you are an amazon prime member, which we are...Jackpot, yatzee and bingo.  You have literally hit the mother load.  It is very user and kid friendly.  For specs watch a youtube video or read the box.  It rocks, so worth every penny!!!

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: South Shore Art on opensky
Reviews.Content: It took me a few days to fall in love with the Kindle Fire HD after using the Galaxy tab 10. I wasn't sure at first and was disappointed that I can't get nook on my Kindle Fire, but I hear there are ways around this. I wish they would have added it so people wouldn't have to bother with the hassle of trying to get nook because people WILL find a way (and a lot have). BUT outside of this fact, I fell in love with my new Kindle Fire HD. The graphics are very very nice, sharp and clear and colorful. I think I now like it better than the Galaxy tab! I just paid for a magazine from better homes and gardens, the Dec issue and it is amazing! I will no longer have to keep stacks and stacks of magazines laying around the house hoping to get to them later, and just think of all the trees it will save! But there are so many features, and I just discovered there's a little magnifying glass that pops up when you hold your finger over some text! It is so cool! Can't wait to discover what else it will do! I love it!

Reviews.Title: WOW!!! I love it better than my IPAD2
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Enough said here about the Kindle HD. I have an IPAD 2 and I gave it to my wife.Comparing to Ipad2, it is little bit sluggish at times, on/off button hard to find, missing some good apps like YouTube, TV shows app for ABC, CBS, NBC etc, no podcast similar to iTunes BUT if you are looking mainly to surf the internet, watch movies, read books (it's not heavy to hold it), audio books, Skype, so THIS is the tablet for you and save your money instead of buying high priced tablets in the Market.The kindle is not big and not small, beautiful color screen display. strong WI-FI connection. So how can I complain if the price was only $249 ($50 off when Amazon ran the 1-day discount). I was using IPAD2 for the same purposes with a price for $500.If you have an Amazon prime, that's even better, you will get a FREE Two-Day Shipping, Prime Instant Videos, Kindle Owners' Lending Library, free 5GB to your Amazon cloud account, and unlimited space for all the Amazon content you buy.Amazon produced a tablet that probably coincides with what the most users want from a tablet with a very good price.I recommend this device for everybody who has a laptop because it won't replace a PC or a lap tap but just for entertainment.I give it 5 stars of the good quality and the price. I hope this review helps some prospective buyers.Note: I read so much about the adds that I thought adds would pop up while watching a movie, they are only on the start up screen.

Reviews.Title: Love, love, love it!!
Reviews.Author: karent
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love my new kindle fire HD!  My husband has had an ipad since May and it was great, but the kindle is much faster and the picture is incredible!!  I have owned a kindle for several years and read almost constantly in my spare time, but the new kindle fire allows me to do so much more!  I would highly recomend it!  The only thing it doesnt have that the ipad has is the camera, but we don't use the ipad to take pictures anyway.

Reviews.Title: I luv my Kindle
Reviews.Author: Russ H.
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle Fire HD for my wife as a birthday gift. Big problem. I can't get her to put it down. It was easy to set up, connected to my router WiFi, set up her gmail and off she went, shopping for holders, screen protector and MORE books.Looks like I will have to buy one for myself.

Reviews.Title: Fun to use!
Reviews.Author: S. Fergason
Reviews.Content: You can do almost anything on the Kindle you can on a pad.  I don't like that the camera is only usable for what is facing the screen.  If you have the camera app you can't take a picture of someone on the other side of the Kindle. That goes for the video as well.  I really don't like that.  Other than that it is easy to navigate.  The picture and sound quality are great.  I am not a computer novice by any means so this suits me greatly.

Reviews.Title: Great product minor complaint
Reviews.Author: Bob Harte
Reviews.Content: We are now on our 8th Kindle the last two a Paperwhite for my wife  which she loves) and the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for myself.  Over all I would give this product a five star plus rating except for one minor flaw. we purchased the std case and love it, that is until I try to fold it back to rest on a table and find I can't  because the charging cable is coming out of the bottom (when folded back) of the kfire and it interferes with the table. Something to fix in the next generation.

Reviews.Title: Should be TWO reviews
Reviews.Author: Walter E. Obrien "Dogjudge"
Reviews.Content: From my perspective there should be two reviews of the Kindle Fire HD. One for those people who have never owned a Kindle Fire and one for those people who have.I've owned the original Kindle, a Kindle Fire and now the Kindle Fire HD.For those who have never owned a Kindle Fire. You are going to be extremely happy with your purchase whether you are upgrading from a Kindle, or if you have never owned a product such as this before. You are going to love this. Books, movies, TV, Music, etc. is second to none. My wife has an iPad and the graphics are just as good, if not better.The only thing that I would complain about, and this relates to any item where you use the screen to type, I simply don't like it. My iPhone is probably the worst. At least on the Kindle Fire HD, you have the ability to turn the unit to landscape mode and get a bigger keyboard.For those who have a Kindle Fire. You are going to have to ask yourself it the larger screen is worth it. Yes, the graphics are better. Yes, the screen is brighter. Amazon says that this screen is not as reflective. Perhaps it's me, but I didn't find it all that noticeable a difference. Sound from the speakers and through earphones (Bose) are definitely a step up.I've never had a problem with my Kindle Fire viewing movies, etc., so the best that I can is that the Kindle Fire HD is better, or worse. It's the same.Overall, I'm happy I upgraded.

Reviews.Title: Not a fan of Silk bit overall good price and quality
Reviews.Author: snocaps231 "Kindle Touch 3G, Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Content: I have owned a few tablets in the past: iPad 1, iPad 2, Galaxy Tab 2 7.0 and my KFHD 8.9 will probably rank 2nd to my old iPad 2 but then again, I spent $699 on that. Instead of repeating a long drawn out review, I rated my kfhd 4 due to Silk. I dont know if its just mine or if its a glitch but I tend to get a lot of tab stopped working would you like to recover previous tabs. I dont lose my pages but the fact I continue receiving the error troubles me. I do miss Chrome and maybe still getting use to this Silk, but it just does not seem as stable.Overall, great device. Planet Amazon is complete.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Tablet!!!
Reviews.Author: Kristina
Reviews.Content: I've had my new Kindle Fire HD for three whole days now and I love it. My hubby bought it for my B-Day and it seems like he's used it more than me. Compared to similar tablets, this one is lighter, slick, brighter resolution, extremely easy to use and the sound/speakers are the best! I love the home screen and how it tracks all of the recent things and or places you've visited and or worked on. I have Amazon Prime and love how easy it is to view free movies, read books/ magazines and all the Apps available. The x-ray addition while you are viewing movies is a neat feature, especially when you want to know who the actors are and a little more about them. I also like how you can set different profiles for my children and be able to monitor/control what they do and for how long, etc. The battery will last you half a day if you're constantly using it. I would have loved to see a rear facing camera as well. There is just so much to this tablet that I have yet to figure out. So far,i am extremely satisfied with my new Kindle. This is the best product by far for the $$$ you pay and for what you get. I have already customized my Kindle to fit my style with a new Pink(Fuchsia) Amazon cover and Stylus  :-)

Reviews.Title: I'm in love...
Reviews.Author: Jennifer E. Monroy "Mom of 4"
Reviews.Content: I just received my Kindle Fire last week, and I can't put it down.  I stream all kinds of video from Amazon, and the display/sound quality are fantastic.  I love the touch screen.  It feels great!  Web browsing is easy and fast.  I just need to figure out how to sync the Kindle calendar with the calendar on my phone.  Other than that, I love my Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: Totally not what I understood it to be
Reviews.Author: Lawrence Ballesteros
Reviews.Content: I bought the Kindle to take to Europe to check e-mails, do internet searches and such.  It's supposed magical ability to snoop out wireless where-ever available is a total fallacy.  I could not access my internet so then my e-mail and internet searches were totally non-existent.  It's supposed great camera, I found out to my dismay does not take pictures.  I am so angry at this product I cannot be objective about it, I have never been so disappointed by an Amazon.com purchase in my history with this company.  It totally stressed out what should have been an exciting adventure.  I will not miss an opportunity to share my negative experience with anyone considering purchasing the Kindle Fire.  I want my money back, Thank you.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet with stunning display
Reviews.Author: The Kurgan
