Reviews.Content: My thoughts on the tablet:Display- As has been commented many times, the display is stunning, a HUGE selling pointSound- You can comfortably watch movies or TV without using headphones. Granted, I turn up the volume all the way, but there is zero distortion and the quality of the sound is quite highBattery indicator- I read a lot of reviews before I bought this and many complained there was no battery charge indicator on the tablet. This was obviously corrected by Amazon before I got my tablet because there most certainly IS a battery charging indicator. Granted, there is no light indicator to show when fully charged, but this is not needed.The OS- Many complaints focused on this being a locked down version of Android, can't customize, blah blah. It's true, it is "locked down", but everyone should bear in mind so is the IPAD and more so than this tablet. Many complained there was a software glitch in the carousel where you could not remove items, this has obviously been fixed because it works perfectly. In general, I like the carousel and the general operation of the OS. It's super fast and super easy, between the favorites star and the carousel you have pretty much everything you needThe app store- The app store is very good, easy to navigate and purchase. True, they don't have everything, but they have a LOT of thingsThe browser- I had no issues at all with the stock browser, but thought I'd pass this on. There were a great many people saying to use the "Dolphin" browser because it was supposed to be a great browser and also because it supported flash so you could work around the "no flash" issue. There were tons of remarks about having to "sideload" Dolphin and about a million different instructions on doing so. Forget all that. You don't need to do that. You can just download an alternate app store called "good e reader", there are excellent instructions on youtube, not that it's really needed, you literally have to change one setting and then you can download it normally, there is nothing strange or exotic required. Once you have this app store, IT has the Dolphin HD browser, flash, and probably a ton of other stuff, I haven't downloaded much else. The point is, you can just download from this appstore, there is no "sideloading" shennanigans needed and have the Dolphin Browser. I will say, the Dolphin browser DOES live up to its billing, it's fantastic, I'm glad I downloaded itAmazon ecosystem- amazing, far better than apple's in every regard except number of apps. The music is far superior as are the video offerings. I have watched a bunch of free stuff with my prime membership and it works flawlessly. Shopping directly from amazon for anything else on the planet is super convenient and works flawlesslySize/Shape compared to full sized IPAD: The 8.9 is almost identical to IPAD in Height. The difference is really in the width, the fire HD is narrower than the IPAD, which mostly accounts for it's reduced spec of 8.9 as compared to 9.9. What this really amounts to is the IPAD is much more of a square shape, it's almost like a 4:3 aspect ratio TV. The Fire HD is shaped much more like a modern TV or computer monitor, with a 16:9 ratio. One benefit besides better movie and TV shape that I did not expect is that if you turn the tablet into a "portrait" orientation to type, you can type very quickly with both thumbs just like a cellphone.

Reviews.Title: update:  charging issues
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This is an entertainment device, not a computer tablet, unless you willing to root.  Got mine last night, played around with it and went to bed.  I'm now typing this review on my 10.1 Acer, its what I reached for this morning, not the Fire.The Google play store, home screen, access to multiple browsers, etc, all confirm the Iconia tablet  is a mini-computer.The Fire has a beautiful display and great sound.  It will be handy when I go to the gym and travel as a way to pass the time.  Wonderful as a reader, the text is incredible.  The layout and ads all suggest, however, that it is meant as a marketing device, profit tool, not a portable pc.I suspect a lot of the unease with using this device, from the critics, is psychological...it's true, somehow it doesn't feel like "mine".BTW, the on/off button is ridiculous, way too flat.  First Generation power button was much easier to find.If I could only have one, it would the Acer...same price, but with a larger screen.  Since my husband uses the tablet at home as well, we will switch back and forth and have the best of both.Otherwise I would return it.Update:  2/2:  charging issues...I've tried all the usual strategies and called Amazon and they are sending a replacement.  Why the hell does the kindle have so many charging problems?  Acer tab has been chugging along with no battery issues whatsoever, and the charger lasts so much longer.  Something to be said for reliability...

Reviews.Title: Great but...
Reviews.Author: Sharon Eagle
Reviews.Content: I really like my new Kindle and use it quite a bit. However there are 3 things that REALLY bug me about it. 1. The on/off button needs to be relocated or protected somehow. Located where it is, it is WAY to easy to accidentally hit it and turn the Kindle off while I'm using it. Just watching a 3 hr movie I accidently turned it off at least 6 times. Fortunately it was easy it hit "resume" when I turned it back on and continue with my movie. 2. The touch feature is often unresponsive. it is annoying to have to repeatedly touch things over and over to try to get them to respond. 3. Advertisements show up WAY TOO OFTEN and interrupt what I'm doing. I paid a big chunk of money to use and play with my new Kindle, not to deal with a continual barrage of advertisements. If I knew then, what I know now, I'd probably think twice about buying it, for this reason.If the next version addresses and fixes these 3 problems then I'd gladly give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: more trouble than worth?  frustrated trying to get set up.
Reviews.Author: DianaInTheD
Reviews.Content: My overwhelming reaction has been frustration.  I've had Apple products and Android products, and I've never struggled so much.  My main complaints:1.  No Gmail app.  I use Gmail on my phone and on my laptop.  Not being able to use it here, and being limited to a clunky email program is very frustrating.2.  No Google Play.  After spending time trying to work with the Amazon Cloud Player, I bailed - the thought of paying for what I was getting free on Google Play wasn't sitting well with me.  I was able to get my music transferred over to the Kindle Fire via USB, but for some reason some of the album artwork covers aren't displaying.  They display fine in iTunes and in Google Play, but not here.  I have no idea if something isn't embedded properly, but........  somehow it all magically worked in Google Play and iTunes.  So, i'm annoyed that I'm spending time trying to figure out what's wrong with 500 of my 3500 music files.  It's important to figure out, because the music display is primarily the album covers - having tons of matching grey ones is not helpful3.  Clunky music interface.  There's no way to play by genre.  Your only options are playlists/artists/albums/songs.  Do I really have to make a playlist for each genre?  Also, the search capability is poor, it's hard to maneuver around even if you know exactly what you're trying to play.  Because I used the USB to transfer my music, I have no playlists transferred, so i have to recreate painfully on the device.  Also because I'm not paying for the cloud, I can't do my playlists on a laptop and transfer them.  Again, it's frustrating because none of these are issues on Google Play. I'm finding I'm pulling out my phone and playing music on my phone 'cause it's easier to maneuver.4.  No categories/folders in the books area.  I am heavily dependent on that on my Kindle Touch to sort into different categories.  Here, I'm supposed to buy another app that doesn't work seamlessly with the Kindle Fire?  And again, we've had the concept of organizing electronic things into folders since DOS.  Really, Amazon?  You can't add a folders capability?5.  No Google Drive.  Same with the email and music - I'm cut off from something I rely on quite a bit.I am an Amazon Prime member.  I've enjoyed the free streaming - that's beautiful.  I really like Amazon - but this is very frustrating.  If I can figure out a way to make all of this work, I think I'll be fine.  It's just the initial setup is way more painful than I expected.  I'm unsure if I want to keep right now.

Reviews.Title: A nice little device
Reviews.Author: Matthew Erler
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle for a week and it's been generally good so far. My uses for it:1.  Reading my comic book collection.2.  Reading books purchased from Amazon.3.  Reading ebooks checked out from my local library.4.  Looking up people/movies on IMDB.5.  Watching move trailers.Pros:  1. Price.  Especially today with the $50 discount.  I didn't get it when I originally ordered it 3 weeks ago but customer support gave it to me anyway when I asked for it.  2.  Screen quality.  It's very nice.  video is clear.  Images are sharp.  Refresh rate is good.  3.  Sound is good for two little speakers.  I use a wireless bluetooth Plantronics BackBeat 903+ Headset when I watch movies.  Sound is great then.  4.  Router connectivity.  The Kindle found my Cisco-Linksys E2000 Advanced Wireless-N Router right away.Cons:  1.  The power button is hard to find with my finger.  That's not a big deal though.  I only turn it off at night.  2.  It insists on adding apps/doc that I open to the carousel.  I don't want it to do that because I don't want seldom used apps/docs to clutter up the carousel.  3.  DRM has been an issue.  I've purchased several books but couldn't open them due to DRM.  That's frustrating because reading books is what this thing is for and anything purchased from Amazon should work on Amazon's tablet IMHO.  I returned them without a problem.  4.  App selection is limited in Amazon's store.  5.  Browser is buggy.Work arounds: 1.  I install apps from another app store to work around Amazon's limited selection.  I use 1Mobile Market.2.  I've installed an alternate browser, Dolphin, from 1Mobile Market and it works great.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9" HD
Reviews.Author: Chris
Reviews.Content: Just a starter observation...................delivery from time of shipment to receiving was snail slow,so if you want it quick eat the cost and pay the extra,I was in no rush but just advising those who need the item for a gift quick.  This is my second Kindle,I dont use them personally but my wife is an avid reader loves chatting with friends on Facebook type sites so this particular tablet works well for her.............and it is that,a Tablet,has everything she needs,I found she favours this over the laptop as it is fast when going from site to site so is a good multi tasking tool,as with anything I buy i like to buy the accesories for an item,the fast charger is really a good buy as was the Amazon Kindle cover,can recommend the HDMI lead too I bought 2 and have them in 2 TV's so movies etc can be watched in either room.  The Kindle was VERY FAST SETUP,transferred everything from the 1st kindle so nothing was lost.Exceptionally clear screen,very responsive screen and seems to work quickly without issue on anything,admittedly this is early days so will update as time goes on.....................I am not a computer whiz if it turns on great,if it doesnt,its broke.Sorry if this review is unhelpful to some,I feel it was a worthwhile purchase worth the $$$$$,cant really comment on the speakers as it plays thru a bluetooth speaker which by the way is awesome.March 2013...........updating..........the cloud player feature for music is great,downloaded alot of my wifes music cd's to the cloud then sent to her Kindle so lots of music to listen to,micro hdmi plugged into back of TV plays movies great too,predominatley purchsed as a reader she has fast learned alot about it,emails web etc all work flawlessley,havent had any problems so far,only thing i noted is books are sent to Kindle lightening fast,some apps may not appear for a few hours,not sure why but it happens on occasion.Fast charger is GREAT my wife uses this all day to read play games,surf the web,emails...........point being it holds a charge along time,no where near as much as the original kindle(days at a time) but can last couple of days between charge with alot of use.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire 8.9 Review- Good but problems with charging
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer
Reviews.Content: I've been a great supporter of Amazon and their eco-system for years. I have a prime membership which I enjoy quite a bit and my wife and I have purchased numerous Kindle products over the years for ourselves and family members.I have been going back and forth for the last month on purchasing a new tablet with a HD screen. I was torn between the new Ipad, the Asus TF700 and the Kindle fire HD 8.9. On a side note I am heavily invested in Apple as well as I own several of there products including an Apple TV and earlier Ipad models, 1 and 2.In the end I picked the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 because of the beautiful screen and very attractive price. I went to Best Buy to purchase the Kindle only because I had a $50 gift card that I put towards the purchase price, otherwise I would have brought it from Amazon.I came home excited, opened the package and started to set up my new Kindle. The screen is stunning to say the least and it appeared to work much faster then the original Kindle Fire we brought last year. I knew I was going to enjoy my tablet.That is until I plugged it in to charge. I notice that the charge indicator kept turning green which meant it was charging, but then it would stop after a few minutes. I had a charger from our original Kindle Fire we were using and verified it worked with the other Kindles in our household. At one point it appeared the charge was holding so off I went to attend to other errands. When I came back the Kindle was at 17% charge, and the indicator was no longer showing green. I ended up getting another charger in the house and tried that one to no avail. I ended up buying the Kindle accelerated charger and that did not work as well, but it worked for our original Kindle fire. I gave up a little upset but I also understand these things happen to electronic products. I took the Kindle back to Best Buy which was a no fuss process and they took it back with no complaints. It was exchanged for a new Kindle Fire HD 8.9.I went home excited once again and went through the previous process of setting it up. Once done I plugged it into the Kindle charger we had brought and once again the indicator came on that it was charging. At least it was working. I came back about an hour later and saw that the indicator was off and the Kindle had not charged. I could not get the Kindle to charge no matter what I did.Frustrated, I drove once again to Best Buy and they tested it out and had the same outcome. They brought another Kindle Fire to me, but this time they allowed me to open it up in the store to make sure this one worked. Can you believe three different Kindle Fire HD, and all 3 had the same issue. At this point I gave up and ended up purchasing an Asus TF700, which up to this point has worked as advertised and whose screen is equally stunning.Again, I'm not naive to know things happen like this, but after 3 attempts it appears there is an issue because I have now seen other reviews describing the same issue. I love Amazon and our other Kindle products have work with no problem. Maybe next year I will attempt to buy one of these models after the kinks have been worked out.

Reviews.Title: Comcast email problems
Reviews.Author: Richard S. Scull "Slotdoc"
Reviews.Content: I would have given the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" tablet a 5-Star rating if it weren't for the email problems encountered with Comcast.  I'm completely satisfied with all the other features except email - which I consider one of, if not the most important functions of the internet.  After contacting customer service 4 times on this issue, they reluctantly devulged that the upgraded software version is probably not compatible (yet) with Comcast's email since the 8.9" tablet is so new (in other words - it was rushed into market). They have no idea when this problem will be addressed by their programmers...not my words - theirs. Here's the problem(s): Comcast email must be set-up manually on the Kindle HD.  After verifying all info with their tech support reps it seemed that the service worked OK once or twice, then it ceased to operate - it actually wiped itself clean from the Kindle upon startup.  When I went back into the email accounts area - Comcast was "gone" - and I had to go thru the set-up function again.  This happened several times; it failed to perform properly every day after "sleeping" for a while; usually not finding any mail when I had personally sent some from my other computers. By the way, I'm not new at this - I've been around computers for over 40 years and taught electronics in the Army. My temporary solution - I went into my Comcast email account and activated email "forwarding" to my Gmail account; then set-up my Gmail account on the Kindle HD.  If you decide to go this way, be sure to "keep a copy of emails" in your Comcast box so you can access them from your computer. Here's hoping Amazon makes this issue a priority - this is a Great Product!

Reviews.Title: Some improvements some things worse
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Nathyn"
Reviews.Content: I had an original 7" fire and decided to get the new 8.9" HD.  There are some definite improvements to this device and some things were Amazon took steps backwards.The good:Screen looks much better.  Very sharp, very clear.Audio is great. Loudest on any tablet I've owned.Xray and read along with audiobooks is awesome.The bad:Power and volume buttons about the hardest to find and push. They're flush with the case and there's virtually no tactile indication that this is where you push or know when you've pushed it. Very annoying.  The power button issue makes me come close to returning it.Apps that used to run on the fire now need tablet versions and have to be rebought.The carousel is not as easy to use as on the original.I'm probably going to pay to get rid of ads.  I don't mind them on the paperwhite, but they feel horribly intrusive on the Fire.All in all, it's a solid tablet for the price, but there are issues that can be very annoying.

Reviews.Title: Bigger is Not Necessarily Better
Reviews.Author: Carol
Reviews.Content: I bought the 8.9 HD kindle, after having owned my first kindle fire for over a year. I was thinking it could be a substitute for a laptop. I was wrong it is just like the smaller kindle, but not "purse size" Yes, it is bigger, but not that much, as the border around the screen is an inch wide. I bought a small Bluetooth keyboard, and it works like a phone keyboard, but for someone like me who does not text frequently, the words often came up incomplete and if I made a typing error I would have to take time to edit. So now I basically have two reading devices, and I take the smaller one when I am going out. The bigger one works great, and I can get the same books I purchased on both at the same time, but I wish I had put the money on a laptop instead.

Reviews.Title: Beautiful Device - When it Works!
Reviews.Author: Jean M. Fortier
Reviews.Content: I am currently on my 3rd replacement Kindle in less than a year. When the Kindle works, it is a beautiful tablet; screen is great, speed is good, wifi reception is better than my husband's ipad. But Amazon has had replace my Kindle twice since I received it as gift late last April. The original one had problems with the volume control, on the second one the screen rotation would not work and it was locked in portrait mode. The third Kindle is still functioning but it has a lot of problems; the screen/device locks up for no good reason, it spontaneously shuts down, the screen does not always respond well when tapped. I will say that Amazon's customer service was professional,  responsive and replaced the defective devices with little or no hassle, but i would not recommend this product due to it's poor reliability.

Reviews.Title: this kindle is not worth the money
Reviews.Author: Janice  Fraser
Reviews.Content: It  freezes and becoming unresponsive and takes awhile to respond again . I should have insisted to have money refunded when the first one did the same thing. I probably would have spent my money more wisely on a different tablet as my friend. When hers starts to give problems at least  she will  not have lost over two hundred dollars. This is the second  kindle for me in less than five months. The first one broke in less than three months. When it would download it would not open it afterwards when it did try to open it then it would close out..so amazon replaced it with a refurbished one which I have had approx one month now it is starting to freeze up. I do not recommend anyone to spend the money. At least when you call amazon they  do respond quickly and try to correct the problem. I bought the first one as a today's special value from a home shopping network which it didn't matter in the long run since then you have to deal with amazon since the network will not accept its return after thirty days.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Biscuit 08
Reviews.Content: I am a very happy with my new kindle fire hd 8.9. I have an ipad also but I am happier to have my kindle. The kindle makes things so much easier and I am not tied down or limited by apple and all of their restrictions on which apps I can use and apps that apple can't run.Thinking of selling my ipad now, that is how much I love my kindle.Amazon comes through once again..

Reviews.Title: fun to use
Reviews.Author: Robert T. Potter
Reviews.Content: very convenient, very fast. needs some sort of magnifier for visually challenged. Had problem using voice guide. causes unit to freeze.

Reviews.Title: No Battery light
Reviews.Author: Marilyn Kesterson
Reviews.Content: I really love my Kindle Fire HD EXCEPT there is no indicator light that shows you when the batter is completely full.  You have to unplug it from the battery charger, turn it on and THEN you have to look at the little tiny battery indicator on the Kindle itself to see how far it has charged!  BIG PAIN IN THE neck!  Why would you not put an indicator light like they do with even the lowest black & white Kindle??  I don't want to have to buy an upgraded Kindle, just so I can have this inconvience....

Reviews.Title: A Very Good Value
Reviews.Author: dannman57
Reviews.Content: Bought this for my wife's birthday and she loves it! It appeared brand new. Only downside is that the device appears to have some built in advertising that is a small nuisance.

Reviews.Title: freezing kindles
Reviews.Author: Robert C.
Reviews.Content: I have problems with it. It freezes up a lot. I have had it replaced twice and still having problems. Tried to sell for  up grade but Amazon would not do it. Had kindle 1st generation and kindle HD  not sure I would purchase another.

Reviews.Title: I am not pleased
Reviews.Author: mary
Reviews.Content: I am not pleased with my Kindle Fire because it keeps freezing up on me, and all I am doing is scrolling on Facebook and playing Words with Friends.  I got the new one this winter to replace my old one which was no longer charging unless I jerryrigged it to keep charger in place. so  I called to see what could be done about the new one and was told to reboot it which I had been doing, so they told me to return it and a new one would be sent.  Got that taken care of and now this new one is also doing the same thing.  Called about that and was told the same thing, reboot it.  Still doing just that.  Not pleased at all.. also do not like that I am trying to explain all this to someone who does not understand me or that I have a difficult time understanding.  I like that I can take a Kindle on the plane and out visiting with family who can then see family events that are occurring with grandchildren and such, my parents are elderly and I am beginning to think I am too!!  I bought your product thinking it would make things easier and it has been harder.

Reviews.Title: Loved it at first... but it died 3 months after the One Year Warranty
Reviews.Author: ShellyP
Reviews.Content: I loved my Kindle.  But I am very disappointed that 3 months after my warranty was up - my Kindle froze on the Kindle Fire screen with no apparent reason (I am very careful with this as a I use it every day).  When calling Customer Service, after trying to re-set it 900 times to no avail I was told that basically I can have a "discounted" price on a refurbished Kindle Replacement... and a $30.00 off certificate.  For me, that answer was not good enough and it never will be.As a pretty loyal customer to AMAZON I am extremely disappointed and am considering cancelling PRIME and finding other avenues for online ordering that have nothing to do with AMAZON.  This includes Zappos I believe.  Anyway, unfortunately there are few things I still need so I will be placing a couple more orders - but I'm not sure about after that.Also, why would I want the same KINDLE back when it only lasted a year and a half.  I think now I should have just taken my $300 and put it towards the iPAD.  Although more expensive, I know it would last and there would be more technical help available.  However it probably wouldn't be needed as I most likely wouldn't have this issue with it.I am appalled that I have read numerous complaints about the same issue with the Kindle, but yet AMAZON doesn't seem to think it's a problem with their Software.Pay the extra money for a table that will last.

Reviews.Title: What a disappointment! Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: C. Fletcher
Reviews.Content: I cannot for the life of me understand the positive reviews on this clunker. I got it for my birthday last year and noticed soon thereafter that it had a tendency to freeze. "Silk browser is not responding, would you like to close?" So I would close and restart and it would happen all over again. After putting up with this sorry state of affairs for several months, I wrote about my frustrations using the feedback feature. Customer service was prompt and worked with me for about two weeks resetting and registering etc etc, before offering to replace the device. But guess what - this new one is doing the very same thing! Could I possibly have received two lemons? Aaaargh!

Reviews.Title: kindle fire review
Reviews.Author: Patricia Berry
Reviews.Content: The worst.  I returned three times and still all three would freeze.  The silk browser is terrible.  For 449.00 I expected convenience.  It was not reliable.  Recommend staying with regular old kindle for reading only.

Reviews.Title: refurbished is a no no
Reviews.Author: Kamela Gomez
Reviews.Content: I have had nothing but problems with this Kindle. My original Kindle never gave me a problem but then I bought this one and it has been frozen more than it has worked!  I am very disappointed!

Reviews.Title: Nightmare experience with Amazon
Reviews.Author: Mary McMahon
Reviews.Content: I did not chose a refurbished device, and wouldn't have done so.  I was under the impression that I ordered a new device and was surprised to discover that my "new" device was not new after all.  The term refurbished was never disclosed to me..  The device I received was inferior.  There were "dead spots" on the screen and I was unable to access my email for days at a time.  I subsequently returned this one for a brand new device.Would I recommend this to anyone?  I'm afraid I would not.I have also had problems with my new Kindle Fire.  I still am not able to access my email for days, and then all of a sudden, the emails will appear, but only from the date that the emails stopped.  I am so frustrated with this whole experience, and it has left me with  a bad feeling for Amazon.  All levels of technical support have been unable to fix this problem, or to explain what the problem actually is.  Any suggestions??

Reviews.Title: Paper weight
Reviews.Author: brian
Reviews.Content: I've had this Kindle for about 14 months and it suddenly became a paper weight.  Upon powering the device on, the "kindlefire" logo appears and that's it.  It won't do anything else.  Customer service has said that it can't be fixed and that my only option is to buy a new one.  I loved this device, but it is completely useless and infuriating now.  Not worth it, buy something more reliable.

Reviews.Title: I expected better
Reviews.Author: Clara McKennett
Reviews.Content: I am surprisingly disappointed with the Fire HD 8.9".  I want to love it, but it has some clunky features that make it not very loveable to me.  I am also an owner of a first generation Fire which I loved.  If it didn't have charging issues, I would not have sought a replacement.I will start with the good points.The screen is lovely, large and clear.Overall, it is not heavy for the size.There are more apps available on this version and some are ones that I had been wishing for.The browser is much more stable.The e-mail program is far superior.Now for the bad points.The charging port could not be in a worse location.  It is right at the bottom of the screen.  For someone holding the tablet while charging it is either pointing at you, potentially causing harm to the port or pointing straight up which means it is in your way constantly.  It was on the side on the first generation and is on the HDX so I guess lessson learned from this model.  If you like to watch video while using a standing cover like I do, you have to delicately balance it on the edge of a table or dresser so the charging cord can be plugged in.The mini HDMI port is in the same location with the same issues.The power button is inferior, it is hard to push, it is a small rectangular button flush with the edge of the screen.  It also does not have any indicator light.  The only way to know that your tablet is charging is to open the cover, turn it on and look at the corner of the screen.  That's also the only way to know the charge is complete.  The first gen had a nice round button on the side, it glowed orange while charging or starting up and green when the charge was complete.These issues seem minor until you realize how much time you are going to be charging this tablet.  It takes hours to charge, probably close to 4 or 5 for a full charge.  I use the tablet for about 30 minutes in the morning, surfing the web and checking e-mail and then in the evening for the same for another 45 minutes or so and then to stream 2 hours or so of video.  That fully depletes the battery daily.  If I forget to charge during the day, I have to have it plugged in while I stream the video which requires dealing with the charging cord hanging out of the bottom.In short, I should have ponied up the money for the HDX, but I didn't check these features before buying.  It honestly didn't occur to me.  I'd give it at A for software and a D for hardware.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: C. Hari "Look Ahead"
Reviews.Content: I had Kindle Fire first generation. I now bought this expecting it would be much superior. Though the screen is HD, the silk browser is at its worst. Often crashes. The device itself is so slow, I would rather go back to the old device.Not much difference as a book reader. I was expecting improvement from the 1st generation device. Not much, besides HD.This is a huge disappointment.

Reviews.Title: good but not great
Reviews.Author: meme
Reviews.Content: I had a earlier kindle and upgraded to this. But the battery stinks on this one. It always seems to need to be charged then it takes forever to charge. So I feel like I am always waiting on the kindle.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad but Not Great
Reviews.Author: Nathan T. Stitt
Reviews.Content: I got a great deal on this or I would not have purchased. It handles many things very well, and my favorite things are reading a news app and watching Prime videos. My kids like playing the games. However, there are two things that would prevent me from buying another one.First, the silk browser is not good. It struggles with many web sites and is very poorly implemented. Speed isn't an issue, usability is. I sometimes do not visit links because I don't want to fight the silk browser. This would be less of a problem if not for the second issue, which is huge. Kindle's are locked out of many apps for android devices. I knew this going in and almost did not buy one for this reason. You simply cannot download many android apps. It sucks. Can't replace the silk browser. Can't use many apps.I would recommend the Kindle for someone that is not very interested in app variety and if you can get them for a cheap price. Not worth the MSRP, but they frequently go on sale. If you are a heavy Prime video user and don't require much variety in apps, or want one to read from they are worth while I guess. I don't plan to buy another one at this time. I'll get a regular android tablet next time. The only exception would be if I got one for my kids to use.So high marks for value, build quality, and multimedia. Low marks for poor internet browser and extremely limited app options. Unless you want a dumbed down tablet or Kindle-specific features get a proper android tablet. Amazon needs to open up the store and change their tactics here...

Reviews.Title: This replaced my original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: curious cook
Reviews.Content: My Kindle fire simply froze after I'd owned it for two years, and I have to give Amazon five stars on how they handled my out-of-warranty device. They offered my a very reasonable deal on this replacement, along with several other options, and shipped it immediately before I had shipped back my malfunctioning device. I have never had a bad experience with Amazon customer service.That said, my new 8.9" HD device can be very touchy. Sometimes the touch screen will freeze up, and I will have to do a hard reset two or three times before it will unfreeze. At other times, the screen will vibrate like it has delirium tremons. Then it will lull me into complacency by working fine for several days. Then we're back to all the quirks. Quite annoying, and not at all like my experience with the original fire, which was amazingly dependable until it just melted down.I will say the HD picture is quite nice, and visibly sharper than the original fire. And the sound from the built-in speakers is impressive for their size.

Reviews.Title: Terrible with e-mails
Reviews.Author: Paul Petrilli "Paul in TN"
Reviews.Content: If I knew that this device was not e-mail user friendly, I would have never bought it.  I am tempted to sell or give it away and get an I-Pad

Reviews.Title: Replacment
Reviews.Author: E. Matsko
Reviews.Content: What great customer service.  My just 1 yr old Kindle WI-FI stopped and Amazon replaced it.  It works great once again.Thanks so muchEric

Reviews.Title: Amazon Service
Reviews.Author: Gregory J. Bartels "gb"
Reviews.Content: I was a huge fan of Amazon until this week. The 32 GB Kindle Fire HD showed up with only .98 GB and many other problems with apps such as Facebook and Skype. Their customer service is terrible, the representatives and the systems are not capable of solving or properly escalating many of the problems with the hardware and software.  After 5 hours on the phone, including three disconnects from my landline and calls to 6 reps, two that were said to be "specialists", I gave up trying to address the problems with the Device and returned the item. 20 minutes later I completed the return process.Amazon is not going to achieve their goal of "best customer service on earth" with their offshore and severely lacking systems and customer service model.

Reviews.Title: Feeling Frustrated
Reviews.Author: Mallory Smith
Reviews.Content: I'm very disapointed to find that this product came without a wall charger.  The enclosed cord works in my computer, but only charges when both are sleeping and charges extremely slowly.  It doesn't work with the wall charging units I've had for cell phones.  It is very frustrating to see the wall charging unit that is made for this product to be sold for 20 dollars extra.  I've always been a huge fan of Amazon, but not today...

Reviews.Title: LOVE IT
Reviews.Author: Charlotte B.
Reviews.Content: I had a nook color before this. I treated myself to a refurbished Kindle before Christmas. It came in a factory sealed box and there is not a darn thing wrong with it. Still comes with the same 1 year warranty as a new one. GO FOR THE REFURBISHED. It will save you anywhere from 50+

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: F. Borrego
Reviews.Content: We've had the Kindle Fire HD for a little over a month.  We also have a Windows desktop, an Apple Mac, and an iPad.  Lately we, the wife and I, were using the iPad 80% of the time, fighting as to who would get iPad.  We decided to get another tablet.  I was using the iPad for reading the daily news and to read books.  After reading reviews, we decided to get a Kindle.  We are both retired in our late 60's, so a large screen was essential.  For most things, the iPad and Kindle HD are comparable.  The iPad has a much bigger selection of apps.  The Kindle is better at downloading books, mainly free books from the library and from the other free book sites.  We do buy an occasional book from Amazon.  All these books can be viewed on the iPad or the other devices.  There are a few Kindle apps not available on the iPad.  All in all, the Kindle has been an economical way to get another large screen tablet.  I bought the 9W charging adapter which I don't think necessary.  I use the small charger from my old kindle and charge over night every other day.  I guess I use the Kindle HD about 3 to 4 hours a day.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic!
Reviews.Author: LYNN W.M.
Reviews.Content: I wasn't sure that I would use a Kindle; however, now that I have it, it goes everywhere with me.  I absolutely love it and am amazed at everything it can do and that I can do with it.  Now it is almost my constant companion.  Highly recommend getting one.

Reviews.Title: bad charging
Reviews.Author: PCGAMER
Reviews.Content: amazon support could not figure out why the device would only charge by using the pc usb cable. device was charging using a kindle fire charger, then quit charging at less than 25% and tried different chargers but nothing worked except for connecting it to a computer. amazon sent out a replacement right away but hate the hassle of a return, especially when i have to travel to the city to mail it out. i would have asked for a refund if it wasn't for that my wife had already ordered a case for it. our previous(smaller) kindle has ran perfect for over a year now of steady usage. i hope that this time that i just received a new lemon device !

Reviews.Title: Buy a new one
Reviews.Author: I love to shop
Reviews.Content: I bought this refurbished kindle fire and have had nothing but trouble with it. I am on my 3rd one it works better, but still not quite right. It turns it's own volume up and down at will, freezes and won't move until a forced power off and this is the best of the 3 I've had.  So save your money and buy a new one, or an iPad I never have a problem with it.

Reviews.Title: Great as an e-reader, terrible as a tablet.
Reviews.Author: gopackgirl
Reviews.Content: I have had this Kindle for about a month now. It is great as an e-reader and I love that it syncs with the Kindle apps on my other devices (at least most of the time). It is also my first time owning a tablet. I must say that this device is at best disappointing when it comes to any function other than the e-reader. The device itself is pretty glitchy. For example, when you tap on the screen to move the cursor while typing, the cursor only goes to where you tapped about half the time (and that's being generous). The rest of the time it appears where you tapped for a split second and then automatically jumps to another spot in the text field, sometimes clear on the other side of the text field. The Facebook app is incredibly glitchy and in group pages will show the first five posts, but beyond that it's just a gray background with posts shown, but no way to like or comment on the post itself, and no way to click on the post or the author's profile. In these posts the pictures are also not displayed. That is very frustrating since one of the main reasons I bought this device is to use it to buy/sell items in fb buy/sell/trade groups. It is impossible for me to do that since I can't even see what other people are posting. I called Kindle tech support about this two weeks ago and  they said they could not find a fix because it was a previously unknown issue, even though I can see in the Kindle forums where people have been having this exact same problem since at least 2012. I keep getting emails from them saying they have not yet found a fix and are continuing to look into the problem. I doubt it will ever get fixed. The app selection is disappointing also, because of the exclusion of Google based apps, and other fairly common apps in Android and Apple stores. If you plan to use this as a tablet, don't waste your money. A device that is functional solely through the use of it's apps becomes useless when it's apps themselves are not up to speed, and the selection of available apps leaves a lot to be desired. I researched for a long time before making this purchase and thought I was making a wise decision going with the Kindle. I expected it to be fun to use and helpful, but it's been one disappointment after another. If you are looking for a killer e-reader buy this, if you are looking for a tablet, buy an iPad.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I wanted!
Reviews.Author: Catboy55
Reviews.Content: The complaints about this are unfounded. Amazon has an AMAZING no hassle return policy. So buy one...this one is 229.00 for the big 8.9" screen. If you hate it...send it back for a quick refund. Does any other tablet maker offer that kind of risk free policy? No. And they do it because they know their product rocks...and no I am not an employee...just a HUGE fan. Ex iPad user...

Reviews.Title: Wonderful for reading.
Reviews.Author: Wendy Wilkins
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle for reading books, emails and any online activity. I also have an Ipad, and have found the Kindle to be more difficult to understand the functions and how to get around. But I love reading books on it.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire bricked, Amazon offered a terrific deal on a replacement
Reviews.Author: Shelley R Wiltrout
Reviews.Content: When my daughter's Kindle Fire went toes up, Amazon customer service offered an outstanding deal on a new Kindle Fire HD 8.9" The price was 25% less than the first generation Kindle Fire I was replacing. They promised it in two days, it showed up at the door less than 12 hours later. Shipping was so fast and efficient that I was unable to register and sync to her account as it wasn't to be delivered to the next day. Customer service was able to correct the shipping status so I could complete the registration. If you have a non-functional Kindle of any model or generation, give them a call they may offer discounted replacements.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed.
Reviews.Author: lindamar
Reviews.Content: You didn't include the charging cord that plugs into an a/c outlet.  How can you manufacture an item and not include that as part of the purchase.  Very disappointed.  I called and they said it would cost an extra $20.00 more.  I was very impressed with amazon before always and having second thoughts about purchasing amazon electronics in the future.

Reviews.Title: This is awesome!
Reviews.Author: Jonathan G.
Reviews.Content: This is my first tablet and I was torn between buying this, the Windows Surface, and the Ipad. I have used Ipads frequently, and have an Iphone so I'm used to the operating system so going that direction seemed the most logical however they are just so damned expensive. Upon reading lots of reviews, as well as trying out a few of my friends different tablets I decided I was going to get either the Kindle Fire HD 8.9" or the Kindle Fire HDX 7".  I liked the idea of having both the front and rear camera as well as the ability to download videos for prime in order to watch them without wifi, but decided I would try this first and upgrade in the future if I thought it was neccesary. All I can say is this does everything I need an more. I use it so much it has completely replaced the use of my PC. If you do your research there are plenty of "must have" apps out there that let you get the most out of your kindle fire.  I would also highly reccommend that you have an Amazon Prime account, otherwise you won't be able to fully utilize this tablet.You have have read reviews complaining about the advertising, that had me somewhat skeptical to begin with, but the complainers neglect to mention the advertisements are only on the locked screen. Whenever you turn on the kinle you see an advertisement and an unlock Icon. Once you swipe into your home screen there are no more ads to worry about. To me this isn't a big deal, and occasionally the ads are very interesting, such as a book or movie that Amazon wants to reccommend.As far as screen clarity, I can't tell a difference between this an ANY of the Ipads I have used (I haven't used the newest Ipad air yet) and the resolution is crystal clear. The volume is impressive for a device this size, and its amazingly light weight. I was suprised by how little it weighed when i first picked it up. The battery is impressive, when they say it lasts ten hours they mean it. I watched 6 hours of a TV series from the netflix app over 2 days without charging it, and still had about 20% battery life left.If you are new to the world of tablets and aren't going to be a "power user" this should be more than enough for you, and at a price that is much better than most of the other's out there.  Just remember to buy the "Amazon Kindle 9W PowerFast Adapter for Accelerated Charging" (the adapter to allow you to charge from an outlet rather than your computer) because it doesn't come standard with it.ENJOY!!

Reviews.Title: Love my kindle but battery life short!
Reviews.Author: Laura Loyd
Reviews.Content: I love my new kindle, it is great for surfing, games checking email in a flash. Very convenient and easy to use. The only downside is the battery life, not what I expected. The battery lasts more like 3 hrs instead of six or seven. As much as the kindle costs it should have came w/wall charger. Because I'm new at this  I wasted money on two usb chargers, finally went to Radio Shack n got a wall charger for $17. Charges way faster.

Reviews.Title: Silk browser is the worst
Reviews.Author: Kevin Neathery "klneat777"
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to receive my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 on Father's Day 2013. I wanted it for its reader capacity but looked forward to using it to surf the Web. Boy, was I disappointed! Silk Browser freezes more often then works. There is certainly nothing "silky"about it. I have seen many others write the same criticism. Why will Amazon NOT address this issue with some sort of fix? I suppose their solution is to replace the whole thing with a new device and expect we who are stuck with one that will not access the web without freezing to buy the newest one. I would be most pleased to give this device 5 stars IF Amazon would update or replace this software since many, many people have this problem.

Reviews.Title: A progressive learning experience--like it more everyday--anticipate to love it in near future
Reviews.Author: Maria
Reviews.Content: It will take time to learn to use all the features available, but it is worth the effort. I enjoy learning, so I'm up to the challenge and it gives me something to do during TV commercials:) I recommend downloading one of the free manuals for new Kindle Fire users. I'm using "Kindle Fire HD Manual--The Ultimate Kindle Fire HD Gide for Beginners" by Amber Norato.I bought the version with the Amazon ads, because it was less expensive and have no regrets. They only appear when you turn on the Kindle and once you unlock it they don't reappear.I took my time deciding which Kindle to purchase. I finally decided to buy the 8.9. I expected that it would do so much that it would replace my laptop, I was extremely disappointed within an hour of using it. It seemed that I could have gotten the same benefit with the $69 Kindle reader. Then it happened--Amazon began sending me offers for additional Apps--now I can do so much with it.There are many, many free Apps--games, printing, streaming, etc., etc. etc., so explore those first. I also got "tokens" for buying it that I can use to buy more apps. I'm also trying Amazon Prime for 30 days--movie and TV program streaming, but still undecided about it.I like that my Kindle has built in speakers, a great picture--I find it sharper than my HD TV. I leave the music playing in the background, while I explore other apps. Now what to do with my laptop???If you are buying this for a child, don't set up the "one-button payment" feature. It is easy to run up a large bill.You'll need to buy a charger, because it only comes with the USB cable.The next challenge was getting a case for it, without breaking the bank. I'm still waiting for the one I decided upon--$5.95 vs. another I saw for $54, so I can't make a recommendation right now. I also bought a stylus, because I hate to see fingerprints on my screen and because I press the wrong links when using my fingers. I sent for the Marware Stylus, based on reviews. It is expensive--$15, but sounds like the best one. I'll review it when I get it.I recommend assessing what you will do with the Kindle and using the comparison feature on Amazon, before buying. If you just want it as a reader, buy the $69 Kindle. Although the Kindle HD has beautiful color, the reader is black and white, which I like.Enjoy your Kindle, whichever you decide to get--I'm enjoying mine.

Reviews.Title: Kindle FIre HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: C. Osman "Grandma"
Reviews.Content: I am quite disappointed with the charger.  I have it plugged in all night and open it and use it less than 1 hour and it tells me I need to charge it.  I had it replaced once and an finding the same problem with the second one.  There seems to be a known issue with this item.  If this is the case, it may have to go back.

Reviews.Title: one year in and i dont leave home without it
Reviews.Author: Darren Gears
Reviews.Content: I did not need a tablet...i have a very new laptop and never found a need for a tablet. I decided i wanted one after playing with a display model in office depot simply wanted it to be "in" with the new app phenomena.  One year in now i look at my laptop with its inch of dust on it and just wonder why i didnt get a tablet sooner. The kindle fire hd is just awsome! It surfs thw internet fast. Netflix streams without a hiccup. Ebay is simplified,and ofcourse you got the kindle app store whixh has jsut about anything you will ever need.thebkoolest thing is i gave my tablet to my 56 year old stepdad and told him to have fun. He is a total tech novice and he got the hang of the kindle within 30minetes. I bring my tablet to work with me every single day to catch up on reading. I am a little sad to say i have read literaly 10 times as many books this year then in the last 7 years since i graduated from high school. I would recommend this for anyone who wants a great tablet but on a budget

Reviews.Title: Happy!!
Reviews.Author: rae
Reviews.Content: I never leave home without it.  It's amazing all I can do on this device!  My on the go one stop entertainment!

Reviews.Title: Best for the Dollars Spent
Reviews.Author: Tomas
Reviews.Content: After owning and using a 7" Samsung Galaxy Tab 2, 9.7" Ipad, and now the 8.9" Kindle Fire HD I have to say with out a doubt, that the kindle is definitely the best machine for the price. Don't believe what others may say about android and apple having more apps. Kindle may not have as many in terms of shear quantity but it has everything one would need and the majority perform better than android. I still like some of the specialty apps ipad has but the need for most of them are very individualistic (your neighbor may need it but you don't). I rate the Kindle display the best of the them due to its color, definition, brightness and responsiveness. I also rate the network ability of the Kindle the best due to the MIMO built into it along with it's dual band ability. It can be put on your routers 5Ghz band while the other machines are using the 2.4Ghz band your in video and internet response heaven. Ipad has always been know for having difficulties in the dual band arena. The Kindle runs dual band with out any problems. It can even run both bands simultaneously switching between them to gain the best performance. Android gets a low third place.

Reviews.Title: Otherwise Good Machine Wrecked by Stupid Cramming Policy
Reviews.Author: Arthur G. Broadhurst
Reviews.Content: It has a clear screen and it connects to wi-fi with no difficulty.  I bought the $15 reduced price "with offers" and that was a bad mistake that I now regret.  On my earlier B&W; kindle the ads are not annoying, but on the Fire there is no way to get rid of the ad without clicking on it and then closing the web page that opens automatically.  You cannot get past the "unlock" screen without clicking on "buy this."  So I was already irritated by that inability to get past the ad, when the biggest irritation of all came with an "upgrade" download a few days ago.  Now my library contains 11 entire book length foreign language dictionaries from Chinese to Japanese to German to Polish.  They clutter up my library and make it hard to find things, and moreover an email from Kindle Support admitted that it was intentional and there was no way for the user to delete those useless dictionaries from the account.  It certainly doesn't help Kindle to have them there and it is irritating to have dictionaries that I have no use for cluttering my library so I do not see what point there is other than being irritating.  I WOULD NOT BUY ANOTHER KINDLE KNOWING WHAT I DO NOW.

Reviews.Title: Short Life of 16GB Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Nana "Nana"
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 was a replacement for my original 7" Fire when it failed after two years. I am giving this Kindle #2 only a 2-star rating because it froze and failed to boot up within 5 weeks of receipt and I cannot obtain a refund because I am a week over the 30-day refund period. My only option is like-in-kind replacement. I was told by customer service that my problem was unusual; that they rarely have problems with this model, yet I opted to think about it until after Christmas and do more research. Winter storms have me snowed in. I find the reading and game apps addictive and really miss my Kindle. I also found the new screen responsive and easy on my eyes, I think it responded better than my first Kindle. However as I stated earlier, in a short time the screed started freezing and it failed to boot up after an overnight charge.Needless to say I was very unhappy with the turn of events. As I am reading customer reviews, I now find that I am NOT the only person with failure issues within a short time of purchase. However, I will probably request replacement for #3 after the holidays because it appears to be my only option. I will not purchase a newer device until I see more positive reviews. I decided on 1 star for the product and added the 2nd star for the prompt customer service. CS was accommodating but I didn't get what I wanted so my frustration remained because I have cloud investment with Amazon that I can't recover if I don't keep some type of Kindle device.

Reviews.Title: Best buy in electronics
Reviews.Author: Beverly J. Kester
Reviews.Content: Best buy I have ever made in electronics!  I can highly recommend this version of Kindle Fire.  The larger screen is much better than the 7".  A good buy for older (I am 70) people like me, easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Kindel Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Marlou
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle.  I upgraded  from the original Kindle Fire.  You can not go wrong with the HD of this Kindle.  From movies to games and going on the web.  Enjoy.

Reviews.Title: I didn't know how much I needed this Kindle!
Reviews.Author: lin
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD, I got it for Christmas last year. I have called the help service at Amazon a few times in the past year for technical help. They are patient and walked me through any issues I needed explained, I'm not very tech savvy. I am  very satisfied with this Kindle, it was money well spent, it is so handy when, (somebody else hogs the computer). I use it every single day, now I  couldn't do without it. I send and read my emails from it, I watch old movies no one else likes on hulu while I do dishes or listen to my favorite radio station ( like right now!) while I wright a review  about my Kindle. I can see things enlarged on the touch screen better than on the desktop, ( great for Pinterest)!

Reviews.Title: One great tablet!
Reviews.Author: Avery Gordon "muse77"
Reviews.Content: I traded up to this from my first generation Kindle Fire 7". I am so glad I did! This thing is a joy to use, and there are many great apps available as well. It's easy to set up, it will automatically transfer all your Kindle books and music over with no fuss. The HD is truly eye-popping, and on top of that the sound in the unit itself is great without using ear buds, but of course with ear buds it's even better. It has an Office Suite for work, too. There's a camera installed that I haven't used yet, but it enables you to Skype, which is a great addition! I am simply thrilled with this trade-up!

Reviews.Title: Perfect Tablet for anyone and everyone
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: Amazon. You've done it again.  Try a Kindle free for 30 days is unbelievable. I actually couldn't believe what I was seeing. I was able to get a Kindle for doing my work and play on, while allowing my family the time to save up the money to buy this for me for Christmas.I was a first generation Kindle Fire owner, and a huge fan ever since. The Kindle Fire HD is great, the web browsing is fast and simple, the sound using DOLBY sound is just what I expected from the Kindle. The screen is fabulous, and the weight and size is great. Anyone who doesn't have the money for a more expensive tablet, know that you will get everything you would out of a more expensive model out of this Kindle Fire HD 8.9

Reviews.Title: Love hate that it had no charger!!
Reviews.Author: G. slone
Reviews.Content: love it only thing that mad me mad was the fact that it didnt come with a charger that is stupid i paid a lot for it ...why souldnt amazon throw in a freaking charger come on amazon a charger would cost u all mere pennies why not make your customers happy 100%

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD does not work properly outside the US
Reviews.Author: Ilona S.
Reviews.Content: Not working properly outside the USTook it to South America.  I could not see any of the movies I had downloaded, not Amazon Prime nor Netflix.  Could not download any of the free books either.  I installed Magic Jack on it.  After five days it stopped working, it shows Beta on it.  Have not managed to make it work again.  My main purpose for the Kindle was to use it while traveling.  It is not working.  It only works in the US

Reviews.Title: A tablet to consider
Reviews.Author: E. Pope
Reviews.Content: I bought this for my wife, who wanted a tablet large enough to use the virtual keyboard for emails and web browsing.  She primarily uses the internet for searching for information, shoppiing, email, Skype (with video) and reading books.  This Kindle does exactly that and more.  Easy to use right out of the box.  Definitely recommend it for such users.

Reviews.Title: Dont even consider it for cruising the web
Reviews.Author: hodad
Reviews.Content: Bought the HD Fire 8.9 when it first came out.  Wanted something to watch music videos and movies.  Works great for Netflix and Amazon Prime, but accessing anything on the internet is a collosal nightmare!  I love to watch youtube music videos.  While typing in on the touchscreen, you'd better get it right, or the browser will send you off into the stratosphere, and most often not even let you find your way back to the previous page.  The apps are a huge disappointment as well.  Most of the apps will also send you off somewhere that you never even thought possible if you hit the wrong button.  Absolutely frustrating trying to navigate.  The apps are terrible, period!I use both Windows and Linux, and have lots of experience with computers in general.  I was hoping that this would be a good internet device, but WOW, was I wrong!  Don't get this if you like browsing.I got a "standing leather case", and I couldn't plug in a headphone until I carved the hole bigger so the normal sized plug could plug in. Still, it does automatically turn the unit off/on when closed/opened, which works well.The power cord goes into the bottom of the unit, so it won't sit up straight unless I prop it on two separate pads, and the cord gets in the way when you're sitting with the Kindle in your lap.Before I got the case, the Kindle would turn itself on in the middle of the night, often waking my wife and I up.  Inevitably, I'd find that the battery was dead.  The case mostly (but not completely) solved that problem.Half of the time, when I try to turn volume up or down, I hit the power switch, and have to restart.  Still have this problem after several months of use, even though I consciously try to avoid turning it off.Great for ebook reading.  It's nice to turn off all of the lights and read a book.  I'm constantly turning it off accidentally as I move around to get comfortable, though  (also have this problem when watching movies).

Reviews.Title: Pretty Good
Reviews.Author: Dan
Reviews.Content: I got this as an inexpensive alternative to our family Ipad.  I wanted something that I could hoard for myself.  I've been pleasantly surprised with this item.  It does much of what I used my Ipad for (music, books, news, etc.).  It is apparent at times that this isn't quite the processor powerhouse that the Ipad is, but then again, I didn't pay as much.  The keypad on this thing sucks compared to the Ipad; it is glitchy, slow to load, and much less sensitive.  The internet browser also crashes from time to time, and sometimes the apps freeze up.  These were all issues that I did not experience on my Ipad.  Nonetheless, for the price, I'm pretty happy with this purchase.  For listening to music, reading books, and surfing the web, it works pretty well.

Reviews.Title: My new big,beautiful KFHD
Reviews.Author: ellafan
Reviews.Content: I received this new kindle because the price was right,and I wanted to check out a bigger screen KF.I have had a 1st generation KF since it was offered.I loved it right away,and actually used it more than I did my computers.I loaded a gazillion books and magazines and  movies, enjoyed every second I spent with it.Then,I just for grins, I checked out this particular version.Love at first sight!! Setting it up with my Wi-Fi network was a snap.I registered it,and was immediately connected to amazon.I chose a few books from my cloud,and the transfers were blazing fast. I love apps,youtube,amazon prime,and Pandora.And I buy everything the Rifftrax guys put out.All of the above look beautiful on the big screen(for me) .I am still experimenting with the camera,but the few shots I have taken look pretty good.I installed a battery-use app,and a few otherz.Everything works fine.And the audio sounds fantastic,even using a set of ancient headphones.I am completely besotted with my KFHD.Check one out!!

Reviews.Title: Pretty darn nice tablet, once you install N2A!
Reviews.Author: Peter Naus "Spd Rdr"
Reviews.Content: I struggled with the awful Amazon software and crippled operating system for nearly a week, before I gave up in total disgust.Look, for the vast majority of folks, it's fine as a simple e-reader, with a slow but adequate browser and some pretty addons. But if you're outside of the US, and you're barred from the Prime content, you will lose nothing and gain everything by spending $20 extra and getting the N2A software installed.It takes about 25 minutes, and at the end of that time, you'll have a gorgeous looking AND working operating system, with all your kindle ebooks easily downloadable - you won't even lose your page position!The only thing I wish I'd done was to do it before I bought a bunch of useless apps in the Amazon store!I don't go in for hacking stuff if there's no need - but there's a need on the Fire HD, believe me. Faster booting, smoother scrolling, faster apps, better and more useful apps, real web browsers, and of course the sensational graphics.After more than 10 years, I'm never buying another bit of Amazon proprietary hardware. Period.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: anonymous
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle Fire 7" and really enjoy it.  Ordered the Kindle Fire 8.9" and I am so very disappointed!  Could not download apps and some of the apps that downloaded from my 7" Kindle would not even work.  I called Amazon several times to try and get this fixed and they didn't even seen to care to help me.  So I sent it back.  Only Sunday when I once again called Amazon to make sure the return was correct did a employee ask if I wanted to exchange for another 8.9".  I said no because I was tired of having to amazon all the time.  Also, I did think of returning the 8.9" for the new HDX 8.9" to come out soon but after all the trouble I had with the HD 8.9" I don't even want to try another one.  I am also very disappointed with amazon not caring if they could help me with the HD 8.9".  They have a very dissatisfied customer who thought amazon was so good!

Reviews.Title: Great Device - Operating System Needs Work
Reviews.Author: A. Freedman
Reviews.Content: We have owned many apple "i"devices over the years and we finally decided that Apple has lost its edge but not its price tag.  So we bought a Barnes and Noble Nook.  The nook quickly proved to be a poor tablet.  Very limited utility and awful to configure and use.  And exceptionally difficult customer service (bought at a university bookstore three hours from our house and the local B&N; store could not accept the return - return was expensive and difficult).So we bought a Kindle Fire HD.  Now it is worth noting that we have three black and white kindle devices in the house.  The Kindle Fire HD is a whole new device - it is a computer.Good Points*Fast response times - operating on our "n" wifi network the machine is very fast*Good selection of apps and media (our interest is movies)*excellent screen quality - movies really pop*great battery life - generally runs eight hours before next charge*My son is dyslexic - the "immersive reading" option for many books is fantastic - my son hears the book being read, by a talented human not a computer, while he watches the words highlighted - can be run at slower speeds without materially changing the comprehensionWeak Points*The primary interface is poor - the apps are (apparently) only offered in a "ribbon" which is fine until you have tons of apps, books, etc.  There are favorite lists and other ways to search but all are a pain.  I don't know why they can't use the accepted device of having all the apps in small pictures on sortable pages for quick location and use.  This is an "Achilles heel" for the device and must be pushing away potential buyers.*The charger is extra - who sells an electronic device without the charger (it runs off of any USB charger so we are able to use our own kindle chargers and the computer)Overall for the price this is a very good value.  It accomplishes our goals of being a well rounded entertainment device at half the price of a iPad.  In general the only advantage of iPad is a more user friendly interface.  If, and when, Kindle fixes this issue, there is little advantage and certainly not for an extra $300.

Reviews.Title: Joy writ LARGE!
Reviews.Author: Greg C.
Reviews.Content: As an up-grade to the Kindle Fire my wife purchased for me over a year ago, I couldn't pass up the opportunity to purchase the Fire HD. Even though it's marked as "refurbished", you'd never know it. The device is immaculate, the image is crystal-clear, and the layout of the homescreen is, quite simply, logical. I've had other e-readers in the past, but the versatility of the Fire (and Amazon's exceptional customer service, product reviews, shipping policies, etc.) is what pulls me back again and again. So, give it a year, and I'll probably be upgrading to the newer Kindle addition which recently came out. I am THOROUGHLY satisfied with this product; even the larger, 8.9" screen is a joy to behold, and the price couldn't be beat for the value it brings.

Reviews.Title: Not recommended for ordinary reading, but good for pdf files, complex images movies and much more
Reviews.Author: Robert S. Hanenberg "Bob"
Reviews.Content: For normal reading I use the Kindle Paperwhite.  I like the fact that it looks like paper.  Like paper it depends on an external source of light.  I do not like reading on screens where the light shines at me from behind the screen.Which is what the Kindle Fire does.  However, the Paperwhite is not useful for books which are colorful, or which have irregular fonts or complex formatting.  I originally bought the Kindle Fire because I wanted to own a certain book on plants.  This book was full of pictures.  A friend of mine owned it, but I could not find another copy anywhere.  It was an old book and out of print, the author had long since died and there was no copy in any library in the state of California and none for sale anywhere on the internet.So I borrowed my friend's book, bought a Kindle Fire and scanned the entire book into a group of PDF files.  There is a fine app for viewing pdf files on the Kindle Fire.  The photographs were perfectly clear, and using my fingers with a reverse pinching motion, I could enlarge any part of a photograph.  You could get the same effect with a paper book using a magnifying glass, but this was easier.Later I found similar uses for the Kindle Fire.  I had always wanted to own a facsimile of the First Folio, but I never could bring myself to buy one.  However, there is a free pdf file of the First Folio on the internet.  Now I have it on my Kindle Fire.  To my surprise, I found it was more satisfying to read King Lear in the First Folio than in a modern, annotated version.  I had also wanted for a long time to own a facsimile of a medieval book called the Tres riches heures du Duc de Berry, but it would have been too expensive to buy one.  I could not find the whole thing on the internet, but a found a part of it as a pdf file, and now can look at it on the Kindle Fire.  Or: I was helping my nephew apply to college.  It turns out to be an easy thing to download an entire college handbook of several hundred pages, and read it in its original formatting.  Later I wanted a government report on the economic value of college majors.  They give this out for free as a pdf file, and with the Kindle Fire I could read the whole 200 page book in its original formatting.I read magazines on the Paperwhite.  But certain graphs, tables and pictures do not show up in the Kindle Paperwhite.  Images, even at their best, loose much of their value on the Paperwhite. Sometimes, as in the Economist's edition for the Paperwhite, the images are skipped altogether.  I keep finding something like "See figure 1" and there is no figure 1.  Or, you might have a tabulation, but when you zoom in on it, all you get is a blank screen.So when I find it absolutely necessary to look at a graph, table or image, I open the same magazine in the Kindle Fire, which has no trouble displaying any image, tabulation or graph.The Kindle Fire is also a tablet.  Young people will like it for this reason.  You can do many of the things you do on a laptop, such as write documents and send emails.  I read my email in the morning, and look at the weather forecast, before turning on my computer.  But I do not do complicated work on it.Movies are a joy on this machine.  Netflix (the movies which are streamed) and Amazon's Prime videos come through flawlessly.  I find the speakers of the Kindle Fire adequate for most movies.The main problem, aside from the fact that the Kindle Fire is useless in bright light and irritating when reading long texts, is that it is heavy when reading in certain positions.  I like to read lying on my back, but the Kindle Fire is too heavy to hold in front of my eyes for very long (I have the larger 8.6 inch display).So I bought a stand to support it ("LEVO Deluxe iPad Floor Stand for all iPads Galaxy Xoom Nook and Other eBooks and Tablets").  You can attach any eBook to this stand.  I often fix the Kindle Fire to the stand, which has a long arm which can position the device at any point in space.  I lie on my back in bed at night and watch movies.  I use the same stand for reading on my Kindle Paperwhite.  You cannot use the stand to read a paper book, because there is no mechanism for turning the pages.  But with an eBook you can swipe the screen to turn a page.There is something very decadent in all this.

Reviews.Title: I use it every day....all day long
Reviews.Author: Pepper
Reviews.Content: I am so pleased with this item.  I got it mostly because I love to read and am losing my vision.  This has brought something  back that I love, and thought I had lost forever.  A few months after I purchased my kindle, I was having trouble with it, and in trying to get it going again I had hit something I shouldn't have I think, and it froze up.  I couldn't get it to do anything.  I was heartbroken.  I called the help number and a very polite and patient gentleman (who spoke clear English, I might add) walked me through several steps to try to get it working again.  When that didn't work, he told me that it needed to be exchanged.  It was still under warranty, so he sent me a new one out that very day, not waiting for the old one to be replaced.  He emailed me a return label and when my new one came a couple days later I shipped the old one back at no cost to me.  Not only that, he called me back twice to make sure that I had received everything and it was up and running.  I have never received such stellar customer service before.  Thank you so much.

Reviews.Title: Must be a QC problem somewhere
Reviews.Author: Daniel E. Klingler
Reviews.Content: Received this yesterday.  Initialized and registered it today.  Never got around to installing any apps.  Spent 4 hours trying to get simple gmail to work, including 3 lengthy calls with Amazon tech support.  Appears to be a software version problem/incompatibility (?), but no amount of "sleep"ing, rebooting, synching, etc would fix it.  Amazon is shipping a replacement.  May be time consider a new iPad.  Lesson seems to be you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Very happy with this KIndle Fire HD Tablet
Reviews.Author: jaap schuiling
Reviews.Content: Bought this Kindle Fire HD Tablet in the first place to be able to read the books i bought and will buy in the Kindle store everywhere i want.I am very happy with the quality and all the options for reading.Also listning to music and watching videos is of high quality.It's only not possible to buy music and movies from Amazon because i don't live in the US,that's the only reason i didn;t rate 5 stars.Perfect Tablet!!

Reviews.Title: Better than the original Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Phillip Centola
Reviews.Content: Unit is better than the original Kindle Fire. I was hoping for a better charging system. I had trouble with the original Kindle Fire charging system. The connections became loose on two different units. I still think that Kindle is number one for E-Reader type systems, and will continue to buy Kindles.

Reviews.Title: Not so great.
Reviews.Author: brainless
Reviews.Content: The internet runs really slow and some of the videos stop right in the middle and have to start all over again.  It's not my internet because I don't have that problem on any of my other devices.

Reviews.Title: It's OKAY
Reviews.Author: Glenna J Dooley
Reviews.Content: I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 about 4 months ago.  I've given it a pretty good test, but I find I keep going back to my iPad.The biggest issue I have with the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is using it to actually type something.  I hate the keyboard.  It does not seem to be calibrated at all and I haven't found a way to calibrate it.  You touch on a key and nine times out of ten you get one somewhere around it and auto-correct inserts whatever word it wants to.  I have turned auto-correct, auto-capitalization and next word prediction off but it still seems to throw in whatever word it wants to. I spend more time correcting auto-correct changes than I do typing a document.  I don't want to have to watch the screen when I'm typing something.  Here is what the Kindle fire typed as the first few words of this paragraph:  The biggrdt isshr i ba  eithtbr Kidke fiI read a lot, so I am amassing a large library - some of it replacing my hardback/paperback books which I am donating to charity.  It is lighter than my old first generation iPad, but I've been using the Kindle app for years, and an eReader is my choice for reading now.I purchased the WiFi enabled version because I don't take it anywhere that I would need 3 or 4 g connectivity.  Even with WiFi it seems a little slow to connect to the internet, but that's okay.  I'm not impressed with many of the apps out there - I've tried a few of the free ones because I won't purchase any apps until I test them out.I do not regret purchasing the Kindle Fire, but if I could have afforded it, I would have purchased another iPad.

Reviews.Title: It is a cut above many higher priced tablets on the marketplace!
Reviews.Author: Terry Ayers
Reviews.Content: We have both an iPad as well as the Kindle. The Kindle Fire HD is hands down the clear cut winner!

Reviews.Title: new 8.9
Reviews.Author: Maria G. Medina "FOOFAH"
Reviews.Content: i love it. the screen is so much better. the games are bigger. for people who need larger print because they can't read small print this is perfect. i love watching films  on this screen. the picture is so clear. the sound is amazing. i workout to music on my kindle.i do my banking. i contact my family with my kindle. i take pictures with my kindle. my cousin works for apple and she is trying to get me to buy an ipad. no way. leave me and my kindle alone.  i'm a kindle girl through and through.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: D. M. Nicol
Reviews.Content: I enjoy my Kindle and find it easy to operate. I was hesitant to buy one but now I'm very glad I did.

Reviews.Title: horrible touch screen response
Reviews.Author: ASG "angryshortguy"
