Reviews.Content: does everything I wwanted plus some.it's fast easy to use and the picture quality is awesome.I recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: I can't put it down.
Reviews.Author: Gisellé L. Holland "Boston's Finest Diva"
Reviews.Content: I bought this for myself for xmas/b-day gift. I bought it not knowing my boyfriend got me a Nexus 7, This is hands down BETTER then the Nexus 7 which is overrated but nice. The Kindle is very easy to use right out the box,  It has a lot of good apps, I mainly bought this because my ipad makes my purse extra heavy so I wanted to tote around a smaller tablet when I'm out and about. I didn't buy this to search the web(which I can and is nice), I got this for movies, games and my books. Amazon has the best online book selection then anyone. I'm so in love with this, the movies look amazing and so clear, it's nice to hold in one hand and isn't bulky. I'm thankful that I got it with the $50  off.

Reviews.Title: I have been won over
Reviews.Author: cjgreb
Reviews.Content: As an iPad user, I was a skeptic.  I am not a believer.  It is a great tablet.  Easy to use and a great travel companion.

Reviews.Title: Great Device
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I am currently writing this review from my new Kindle Fire!  It is an amazing device that has exceeded my expectations.  Only issue I have had with it is the silk browser.  It has crashed on me a few times, but I am sure this will be fixed in future software updates.  I am very satisfied with the quality and speed of the device.  I would recommend this to anyone looking for a tablet.  It does everything I need it to do - schoolwork, business, reading, movies, tv shows, web browsing, etc.  The email/contacts/calender support is great (my previous kindle fire was lacking this big time).  I have faith the device will only get better with future software updates, and as always, amazon's customer support is incredible and always ready to help if you get confused with anything.  I have only had it for a few days so I will update this review if anything comes up.  Overall, I am very satisfied.  After using my dad's ipad for the past few months, I have to say this device is better...not just for the money, but overall.  Thank you amazon for delivering an incredible product!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire  HD
Reviews.Author: DEB
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is lot better than I thought. Love the bigger screen and picture quality. The sound feels like you are in your own small theater. J ust love it!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic product
Reviews.Author: Kindle Customer "tjpaingod"
Reviews.Content: I already have the kindle fire and kindle fire HD 7" versions.  I bought this when Amazon have a discount on it right before xmas.  All the outstanding features from the 7" HD version but in a larger, easier to view and type on package.  BTW, larger size does not at all mean awkward or heavy.  This is easy to hold in portrait or landscape and is very light.

Reviews.Title: Love the larger Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: J. Cord "beautyandbeastfan7"
Reviews.Content: I upgraded to the larger Kindle Fire as a pre-Christmas gift.  I must say I mainly use the Kindle for reading and email/facebook.  I love the size and speed of the 8.9 Fire.  I had the 1st generation Kindle Fire and although may of the features are the same, many are updated and improved.  One major improvement is the placement of the power/sleep button.  Good job Kindle.  You actually listened to customers!I love the HD...great picture, the updated sounds, the speed, and the larger screen for books.  This Kindle is compilable to the new Ipad....especially if you have a job with a network or home computer that is windows based and not Apple compatible.  I LOVE this Kindle!!!!

Reviews.Title: Finaly broke down and got an e-reader!
Reviews.Author: Zummer
Reviews.Content: What a great invention!  The only thing that would make it better would be, if it could cook! I know I will use it for all kinds of use beyond just reading the latest books, etc!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely LOVE this product
Reviews.Author: spops1
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire HD!  I'm having so much fun with this, I'm so glad I decided to get this one.  It's not only great for books, (both reading and audio) but for general browsing on the internet. It's the perfect size and so much fun to use.  It's quick, it handy and it's FUN!  I'm so glad I have this one!

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: It works great.has a great picture .grate graphs .good sound easy to use.holds a charge good easy to change applications

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Johnie
Reviews.Content: Great Buy, if you like to read, and surf the net when you need a break. Also nice if you want to download a movie.

Reviews.Title: Glad I made this purchase!
Reviews.Author: Juliet
Reviews.Content: Great device at an affordable price, and my kids love it. I will recommend this product to all my friends.

Reviews.Title: very nice
Reviews.Author: Keith A
Reviews.Content: Love it with one exception. It would be nice to be able to connect and run external drives via usb port.

Reviews.Title: A Great Kindle...Just Remember, it's not an iPad
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I've had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" for about a week now, enough time to put it through some paces and see what it's got.  I own the original Fire 7" as well, so I'm familiar with the product already.  I wasn't expecting an iPad, so I'm a bit less critical than many of the reviewers on here.What I like:- The screen is phenomenal.  Pics, videos, apps...all of them display clearly and crisply.  The best I've seen (and my wife has an iPad 4)- The updated carousel - I actually like the recommendations...helps me see what else is out there- Wi-Fi connected easily, and works great...thinking that most people are having issues with their service provider, not the Fire.- Ease of use- very intuitive...my kids picked it up in no time!- Cloud- I have a ton of music, and I can access it easily as long as I have wi-fi (which I do at work and home, so why pay for 4G?).- Overall speed- MUCH quicker and more responsive than the original Fire.- Prime - I don't know who wouldn't pay the $79 per year for this gem.  Between free shipping and free movies...it's a no brainer.- Size- I always felt the 7" screen was just too small for anything besides reading.  The 8.9 is perfect for reading (love the new two-page layout), watching movies, playing games, typing...great job Amazon!What's Not-so-great:- Silk - After all the hoopla regarding speed with this browser setup, I'm still left unimpressed.  Hangs up often, lags, takes too long to get rolling.  It's not horrible (I remember dial-up), but just not what you'd expect with all the lingo thrown around.- Apps - Let me say that if an app is designed for the Fire HD, then it's amazing on this device.  However, even some of the simplest apps (Feedly, for one) have issues.  I know these can (and hopefully will) be resolved as more people move to these devices, but it is an issue nonetheless. And I'm still not sure of how I update an app...some of the technical aspects could be made simpler to go along with the overall ease of using this tablet.Overall, I'm extremely pleased with the Fire.  I wasn't going to upgrade just yet, but when Amazon offered it @ a $50 discount, I figured "why not?" I don't regret the investment one bit.  If you go into this expecting an iPad, you'll be disappointed.  You get what you pay for with the iPad and Apple's ecosystem.  The Fire is designed to immerse you in Amazon, and if you're like me and buy your books and music there (it's cheaper btw), it's an amazing device.

Reviews.Title: Love the size!
Reviews.Author: John S. Linton "John"
Reviews.Content: I bought this with the intention of getting new graphic novels which are hard to get in my town. The comics look great and are very clear. Videos look great and they sound is excellent. One thing I did not like is the update just did its self.

Reviews.Title: I like my Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: carol hill
Reviews.Content: I had an older Kindle with buttons and a tablet. When I saw the Kindle fire it would combine the two. Also, like the high definition and many other features.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD Dolby Audio, Dual-Bank Wi-Fi , 16 GB
Reviews.Author: Karen Edgecombe
Reviews.Content: I had my first Kindle for over two years, and used it all the time.  I could not wait for the new one to come out, and I find that I absolutely love it! The color is beautiful, and I like the additional features that were not on my other Kindle.

Reviews.Title: KINDLEFIRE HD
Reviews.Author: rebecca
Reviews.Content: I am thrilled with  with everything EXCEPT..The fact the BATTERY LIFE. It always seems to die after a few hours even.if it has been charging over night. I still feel this tablet is the Greatest for less money This is my 4 kindle and am giving my husband one for Christmas I Can`t wait.

Reviews.Title: Way better than I expected!!
Reviews.Author: thecowboy56
Reviews.Content: The Kindle HD 8.9 was much more than I ever expected. It is so much more than a fancy e reader. Thanks!

Reviews.Title: New Kindle Fire HD 8.9"
Reviews.Author: Sharon A. Francis "wishing it"
Reviews.Content: WOW... I had the first Kindle Fire.  This is just sogreat ..  Clear picture. Larger screen.  Games areamazing.  love it.

Reviews.Title: great
Reviews.Author: chuck bottom
Reviews.Content: it is just great. i had the other kindle and upgraded because of the web this one has.i love to see the book covers.i just wish that in the discriptions the books,they would state how bad the language is.i wont buy more from an author that uses the Lord' s name so horriblly.other than that this is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: Everything I want & needed in a tablet/e-reader.
Reviews.Author: Nancy R.
Reviews.Content: I love it!. This tablet has met and exceeded my expectations.There is nothing I want a tablet for that this product will not do.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Fyrluna1
Reviews.Content: I'm so glad I decided to splurge and buy this for myself.  I've had the 3G Kindle for three years so that I wouldn't have to keep buying books.  I've not only been able to read a book, but I've found fun games and I've watched some videos.  The picture quality is great.  Best purchase I've made in a long time.

Reviews.Title: My new Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Debra
Reviews.Content: Love, love, love my new Kindle!Only one disappointment! When we skype our grandchildren in Nevada, the picture isn't clear, it's fuzzy! Would appreciate it if that feature could be corrected somehow! Otherwise, we love our Kindle!  D.T.

Reviews.Title: HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Frederick Donahoe
Reviews.Content: HD 8.9The quality of the movies are great. No buffering when viewing. The screen size is very good. Back lighting is also excellent feature when reading.

Reviews.Title: Awesome!
Reviews.Author: Sheila
Reviews.Content: I love the Kindle Fire!  I'm not a tech person but was able to figure out how to use the Kindle fairly easy.  It's lots of fun & I love reading books on it!

Reviews.Title: Artist Portfolio
Reviews.Author: Blues Lover
Reviews.Content: I owned the original Kindle Fire and love it it from the start. It's size was ok, but hearing of new Kindle Fire HD with the larger 8.9 screen was too good to resist. I am an artist and having a handy portfolio at my disposal is essential. I ordered the 32 GB version to allow me to display all the bodies of work from photography, fine art to my own animations. The display is sharp and clear and the size is perfect. With all the high resolution art I placed on my Kindle plus my massive book collection, it has hardly mad a dent in my memory. All the other wonderful things packed into this device are just added attractions that make me grin with complete satisfaction every time I turn it on. No longer disturbing my wife to watch movies in the middle of the night, my headphones and netflix or reading a book in bed. How many ways can I say I love my Kindle HD 8.9  My only complaint is the camera. A camera that point only at me is useless, I'm not into video chat, but I am into photographing and would like to see a camera that is better than 1 mega pixel, low res. (10mp hi res.) Would love to see the lens on both sides. As I mentioned, I am an artist, if I could combine framing out a shot with my Kindle and then instantly it take into one of my apps, like photoshop touch, that would be a big plus for me. Perhaps future incarnations of Kindle Fire will address that. Being that's my only complaint I gave it a 5 starsRibitch

Reviews.Title: love it
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: love it love it love it... had an older kindle and fell in love with this as soon as I opened it up and turned it on...

Reviews.Title: Pleasant surprise from Santa
Reviews.Author: John Basarab
Reviews.Content: Great Christmas gift and I'm throughly enjoying it, however ,not being very tech savvy, a quick start guide would have been very helpful

Reviews.Title: Great But...
Reviews.Author: Beverly Maitland-Chase
Reviews.Content: Great.. Like to be able to read at night without a light on...But  Needs to have the ability to make collections like the older models...

Reviews.Title: Most Awesome Tablet Ever In The World!
Reviews.Author: Tracy Majerczak
Reviews.Content: I am so very, very please with my new Kindle Fire HD 8.9. It is one the best purchases I've ever made and well worth the money. I am please with all the apps, the book shop and that I can watch Net Fix on this wonderful device. My son likes it for his games and for books as well. I also like that I can check my social media and read and compose emails. This is a wonderful tablet. Highly recommend it!!

Reviews.Title: excellent screen
Reviews.Author: Gary Sun
Reviews.Content: It has aan excellent screen performance, and I use it reading PDF, it's perfect besides it's interface.It need more change.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful device.
Reviews.Author: trish rushing
Reviews.Content: Well, I chose this kindle because I have had the others and loved them so I figured that having the that was a bit bigger would be wonderful and that the 4g would also be great because that way I can have signal anywhere I go instead of just waiting till I could use WiFi. I really love this device It is so much brighter and I just love it.All aspects of it.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: Kathleen Verdi
Reviews.Content: I thought I was ordering an e-reader. I had no idea it could do everything!!!!! and more. I'm discovering things I can do with it.

Reviews.Title: love, love the 8.9 hd kindle fire
Reviews.Author: R. Coyle
Reviews.Content: I absolutely love, love my new kf hd 8.9.  One of the best features is the clarity of the screen.  I am very pleased with every aspect of the tablet. The hdmi cord for viewing on tv is another very big plus.  The picture is amazing.  The sound is fantastc.  I have discovered that the capability of reading with voice is something I find more useful than I thought. You can get ready for work, wash dishes or whatever and listen to the book you are reading. I bought a set of speakers and use my kindle as my stereo system.  Using the hdmi cord on our tv also works as a great stereo system also.I have only found one app that doesn't work well.  After a few minutes of playing this game app the game completely shuts down.  There are way too many great features to let one game spoil my apprection for the new fire.

Reviews.Title: This is better then all the rest of the Kindles.
Reviews.Author: Marilyne
Reviews.Content: This Kindle does wonders. It is better then all the Ipads. Amazon has really out done them selves on this. The sound is wonderful, the screen is clear and bright and its easier then the rest.

Reviews.Title: love it!
Reviews.Author: Katie "Katie"
Reviews.Content: After already owning the original kindle fire and loving the product all around, the fire HD 8.9 was announced, I knew I had to have it. Why spend 200+ more to get an ipad when I can save money and get a product that's just as good AND I don't have restrictions on which devices I use my apps. So worth the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Great Kindle
Reviews.Author: Mary Ann Bryant
Reviews.Content: Just love this Kindle! Very easy to start up and is very user friendly in every app.  I bought a red cover for the tablet and it looks sharp!

Reviews.Title: 5 Star Winner
Reviews.Author: Scott J. Wulf
Reviews.Content: A winner.Met all of my expectations.Part of the fun is trying all the features .My reading enjoyment level has quadrupled.

Reviews.Title: Love At First Sight
Reviews.Author: Kef Hollenbach "Love those Light-Bulb Moments"
Reviews.Content: Balanced well. Good "heft" without being overly heavy.Screen display is unbelievable! Sound is clear and audible at a low volume.Touch screen is extraordinarily responsive, if fact it takes some slight getting used to.HIGHLY recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Potter
Reviews.Content: The picture is crystal clear sound is good over all i'm very pleased with my new Kindle,and the customer serviceis great.

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Nicole M. Miller
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a birthday gift for my husband and he's pretty happy with it so it's definitely a win. It can't be beaten in the realm of content consumption. The only other tablets that have access to Amazon Instant Video are iPads. Unfortunately, no other Android tablets do a very good job of doing that.It isn't the kind of device for hackers but if you want a solid tablet with a nice display and a lot of features, it's a better bargain than anything in its class.My main tablet is still the Motorola Xoom LTE but that is because I have an SD slot that I can use at will and it can still do most of what this tablet does. I paid $600 for it though. This tablet costs a lot less and can do everything that I do with the Xoom with the exceptions of using the SD card, installing custom ROMs easily and using Verizon's LTE network without the assistance of another device. The Kindle Fire 8.9" has an accelerometer that seems to be a bit temperamental but overall, I think this is the best tablet you can get right now.

Reviews.Title: Nice Tablet.
Reviews.Author: James E Mello
Reviews.Content: Have just tried this tablet. Great looking hd screen,and just the right size. I couldn't get a IPad because of the price,so this was a close second choice. So far it has been very easy to set up and use. Many apps to look for and purchase,and it is worth getting the prime membership,for even more savings. This is only a short review as I have only owned this for a few weeks. "But so far so good"!!!!

Reviews.Title: Quick review and a couple questions....?
Reviews.Author: tomp
Reviews.Content: I got this little tablet a couple of weeks ago and am (reasonably) well pleased.  Screen and sound are EXCELLENT, right up there with IPad and Nexus 10.  Internet brousing seems a bit "buggy" and siezes up occasionally.  Hope they are working on a software upgrade.I would say that if you are looking for a content device (amazon prime, books, magazines, etc.) rather than a creation devise, this is an excellent choice and an excellent price.  If they can "smooth out" the web surfing experience a bit, I would give it 5 stars...Especially on price/value.I do have a couple of questions for anyone who cares to reply, as I am NOT very tech oriented --1.  I want to be able to stream content from the websites of the major T.V. networks (CBS, ABC, NBC, etc.)  But right now, this little tablet will not do it.  I understand it could be because Flash is not supported anymore.  What is my fix here??....Please, remember that I am not too tech savy, so please "go easy on me" in your reply.  I can follow basic instructions, but try to keep it simple.  Thanks!2.  I have a wireless printer at home (Brother MFC-7840w).  Is it possible to print from my tablet to my printer?  Is there an app or something I need, etc.?THANKS IN ADVANCE FOR YOUR HELP!!

Reviews.Title: I absolutely think this is the best tablet out there
Reviews.Author: Suntobeach "sunandbeach"
Reviews.Content: This is my third Kindle-- I upgraded my Kindle Fire to the HD.  There is no comparison.  I am amazed on the upgrades made since the Fire.

Reviews.Title: Nice tablet from good company
Reviews.Author: janice399 "JM"
Reviews.Content: The first generation fire I had was used all the time and I did not want to upgrade. Then I saw one of these 8.9 fire hd in a store an was hooked. This 8.9 hd fire is easy to use because the touch screen is a huge improvement on my last fire. The typewriter responds accurately and it was used type this review. Videos look and sound great. I have only read a page or two in my book so far because I keep wanting to explore the applications.

Reviews.Title: My New Kindle...
Reviews.Author: DONNA M GILCHRIST
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle, still learning more about it everyday...I love being able to put it in my purse and take it to work or on trips.

Reviews.Title: Xmas Gift for our daughter
Reviews.Author: sunsine
Reviews.Content: Just set up her account so it's all ready for use when she opens it in 13days!Seems to work great, arrived fast.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Wilcie
Reviews.Content: I like it but I'm still trying the different "Apps". I have read several books.Today I downloaded the camera.

Reviews.Title: awesome kindle
Reviews.Author: Teracia Loretan
Reviews.Content: awesome product however it should come with an easy start up  guide just to give you a few quick tips and by that i ment on paper not e book

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: I really love this product (and the Kindle Fire basic from last year)It's convenient that it connects to free games/books using Amazon services and is easy to use.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle HD
Reviews.Author: Stephen Piersall
Reviews.Content: LOVE IT! The bigger screen is better to view everything you do. A bit heavier but then again it's bigger. Battery life is longer then the original Kindle Fire.

Reviews.Title: wow this is Amazing technology
Reviews.Author: Robert J. Griffin "jeepbob1"
Reviews.Content: mine landed yesterday and in 15 minutes we were completely operational along w/ 40 books and other stuff from my kindle DX sooo thanks and we r sooo happy w/ our investment n Merry Christmas dev team :)

Reviews.Title: A Must Have for Travelers
Reviews.Author: Bizzle
Reviews.Content: I fly twice a week. I needed something compact but was put off by the ipad's price point. The screen is a beauty when streaming in HD. It's a really great way to integrate all of your amazon media and I like the layout. Silk is still a bit buggy but I expect that will improve. Hoping to see more apps get incorporated onto the platform. Speakers are pretty excellent and the hdmi socket is a huge plus for connecting to hotel TVs. Battery live goes quickly with movies and depending on your charger, you might have to put your kindle to sleep. If you're not a Maccolyte, the kindle's price should get you what you need.

Reviews.Title: Really good hardware wise...
Reviews.Author: Benjamin T. Horne III
Reviews.Content: Beautiful device. Great sound.. Really like it for the hardware...Only problem is the apps... A lot of really good apps are out there for android and ipad...  However, it seems most apps are really  slow in coming to the Kindle (if ever)....This is a shame and I think it will ultimately be the downfall of the Kindle.As an example, just subscribed to Verizon Fios. Verizon has a really good app for accessing live tv for tablets . It is available for , of course, the android and ipad market.. The one available for Kindle is severely limited and, quite frankly, sucks..It is not the same one as for the other platforms.I am seriously considering buying an android tablet so I can use all of the good apps that come available.What's the good in having state of the art hardware if it will only run a subset of the available apps....

Reviews.Title: NOTHING is compatible with this thing
Reviews.Author: Moe
Reviews.Content: Pros: Amazing screen resolution and easy to use. Videos and pictures play beautifully.Cons: Webs browser and insanely slow and freezes up frequently, but its manageable. The thing I hate the very most though is that even though its an android product, NOTHING is compatible with this thing. Want any of the latest, popular games (CandyCrush, Mini Golf Match Up, or Words With Friends)? Too bad. You cant download them, and if you do they wont run. Want to rent free books from your library using the M3 e-reader? Nope, not happening. Whats the point of having a tablet that made its name as a reader that you cant read actual books on?I asked for this as a gift thinking that it would be like a giant Galaxy, but I was sorely mistaken. If I could trade it in for an iPad at this point I would in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: I was disappointed
Reviews.Author: KMD
Reviews.Content: As a diehard Kindle fan, I could barely wait to get my hands on the Kindle Fire HD.  An affordable tablet with fabulous color, Dolby sound, and a reasonable price?  What was not to like.I wish I could say my excitement lasted once I got my hands on the device itself.  Unfortunately, that wasn't to be.The first device I received froze up time and again, but Amazon, true to their EXCELLENT customer service, sent me a replacement.  The replacement almost never freezes up.  So why don't I like it?  Keeping in mind the fact that this is one user's experience, here are the pros and cons as I see them.Pros:* The e-reader can't be beat.  A great visual experience and the almost seamless ability to purchase/borrow books.*  The Kindle Fire is first-class when it comes to downloading and watching videos, especially if you're an Amazon Prime member and have lots of free videos to choose from.*  The HD experience is A-M-A-Z-I-N-G!*  Plenty of useful apps for download, many of them free.*  The size is really nice.Cons:*  Amazon Silk is herky-jerky at best.  Crashes frequently, even after reboot.  Links are often unresponsive.  Doesn't support Flash.*  Hate, hate, hate the carousel.  Cluttered and ungainly and pretty much useless.  Would much rather be able to put my favorite applications on the home screen.*  Actually, this brings us to one of my biggest gripes against the Kindle Fire HD, i.e., the lack of personalization options.  Amazon has pretty much locked you into their concept of usability ... and brother, it's not mine!*  The Dolby speakers ain't all they're cracked up to be.I guess my biggest problem with the Kindle Fire HD echoes a problem I have with Apple products, namely, the user doesn't seem to come first here.  The business plan comes first.  Selling stuff comes first.Basically, I would say if you're after a terrific e-reader and a device you can use to watch videos in glorious color, this would be a good choice.  If you're looking for a tablet, I would say look elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: Don't waste you money if you want it for browsing
Reviews.Author: Shadowmarten
Reviews.Content: Silk is the worst browser.  Incrediblely slow and unresponsive.  I read "help" files from support dating back to Nov 2011, and the problem still has not been fixed.  If you like apps, the selection is much less  for the Kindle HD than for android.  If you want to watch movies, the resolution is excellent...if you can get the file downloaded.

Reviews.Title: Clunky, lots of extra costs, and not an iPad alternative,
Reviews.Author: Brit Anderson "brittles"
Reviews.Content: I wrote a much longer review that appears to have disappeared, but I'll cover the high level issues. First the positives though:Good:It's a somewhat cheap device for accessing the internet and amazon content.Bad:Basically everything else.1. Wi-fi connection speed in my home was awful... I could load webpages 4-5 times faster on my iPhone 5 and even my old iPhone 3GS. YouTube videos for the most part just wouldn't load. On every other device, iphones, ps3, ipad, etc... no problems in the same room.2. Touchscreen was having all sorts of problems. Typing was an exercise in futility at times. I'd press the same letter key dozens of times before it was recognized. And it seemed to not be an issue with one location on the screen... just generally unresponsive.3. The absolute worst is the content. Paying for a service like Prime, you'd think would be similar to Netflix since they are positioned as a competitor. It's nothing like Netflix. The available TV and Movie content (PAID content, mind you) is miserable. There is no use for getting prime unless you constantly read books. The worst thing is that they have a MASSIVE catalog of movies, but they have their own rental and purchase prices ON TOP of prime. Some of these go for as much as $20 for HD. That means there is no excuse for not improving the selection of Prime content. I really don't understand why they don't boost their prime content to make it more attractive and leave the new releases as pay per view.Conclusion:I think the best think about the whole situation is that Amazon really does have amazing return policies. That sounds like a backhanded comment, but really if you are interested in trying it out Amazon will give you 30 days to do whatever you want... even give you a trial of prime. Could be worth it to see if it does enough to warrant not springing the extra and getting an ipad with tons of extra features and a much better ecosystem (itunes/facetime/messaging/etc).

Reviews.Title: Love my new Kindle
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I had the first Kindle Fire for a very long time and I loved it.  I went to my sister's bridal shower recently and left it on the plane.  I was heartbroken.  After several days, when I knew I would not be receiving it back from the airlines, I started to go through my options.  I am not an apple user, as my phone is an android, and I have every type of google account you can have.  All of my apps are either from Google or Amazon.  My other option was a Nexus (either 7 or 10).  My boyfriend has the Nexus 7 and enjoys it a lot.In order to decide what tablet I would go with I started to list the things I did on the tablet:read bookswatch video (Amazon Prime is amazing)play a few app gamesread the news and look up recipes using Flipboard and Pinterestsurf the web (but not as much as I do on my computer)Both the Kindle HD Fire and Nexus do all of those things except the Kindle has two bonuses:Kindle Lending LibraryAmazon VideosSince I do have Amazon Prime, I watch a lot of my tv shows through that as they are free.I received my Kindle Fire HD 8.9" (if I was going to upgrade I will go big) and was immediately happy that I got it.  It is very beautiful and works extremely well.  Yes there are a few cons (web browsing is a bit slow, typing is somewhat awkward, limited apps since can only use the Amazon app store, interface is not customizable) but I bought it knowing these things.  It does the job I wanted it for and it does it looking good.

Reviews.Title: GRRRR...needs replacing after 2.5 months...
Reviews.Author: Jennifer
Reviews.Content: I was so excited to enter into the "world of tablets" when I got my new KF HD 8.9" about 1.5 months ago. I had done A LOT of searching, reviewing, and comparing other tablets before purchasing this one. I finally decided that though the KF HD lacked the latest Android OS, and would be centered around the Amazon universe (no Google Play apps, etc) this would be a good beginner tablet. I wasn't wrong about the ease of use and I don't particularly mind not being able to download apps from other than Amazon, especially since everything appears in the Cloud and I can easily delete/retrieve apps at will.However, I was NOT prepared for all the problems I have had with the device since almost day one. I initially had issues with the device locking up all the time and the battery life seemed waaaay short for the time usage. I did my homework and learned to shut down the device by the hard/cold reset. Thought I was home free for a couple of days til the device would no longer charge at all even though there was nothing wrong with my charger. Spoke to customer service for the 3rd time and they sent out THEIR rapid charger because obviously mine was inferior (not her exact words, but that's the gist) I will admit that the tablet absolutely charged better and even performed better with the rapid charger. I was really starting to enjoy using the tablet and happily played games/read my books with little problems for almost 2 WHOLE weeks...until today.I was in the middle of playing a game when it suddenly froze. I had no choice but to shut it down via the hard reset. When I powered it back on, the load screen ran continuously. After an several hours of trying to resolve it on my own, I grudgingly called CS again. The guy was really nice and tried to remotely reset the device (or something to that effect) but when that failed, he offered to replace the device.I am REALLY hoping I simply had a DUD because there are several features i really liked about this tablet. 1.) the screen brightness is awesome for bright days - not so good for battery life but you can really see the screen well.2.) the auto-sleep sensor is awesome when using a case that supports it.3.) size is perfect for me due to poor vision, I felt the 7" was too small and a 10" was just too bulky 4.) the gorilla glass screen is really durable and sensitive to the touch. I had a screen protector but took it off when the stylus had too much drag for sketching/drawing. 5.) the carousel is nicer than I thought it would be, keeps the apps and books easily accessible with a simple flick of a finger.Time will tell if the replacement KF HD will perform better than my first one. I will be happy to change my rating! The only reason I didn't rate it lower to begin with is because I really enjoy the tablet when its working and customer service has been quite good, albeit a little stubborn at times.UPDATE July 2013: The replacement KF HD 8.9" is performing MUCH better than my first one, therefore I will now give the device 4 stars. There are still some issues that prevent me from giving a 5 star rating.  For some weird reason, my carousel will randomly disappear and I am left with a black screen with the menus at the top. Luckily the menus are still there and I can simply  There really seems to be no rhyme or reason for this and in all fairness I haven't spoken to CS yet to see if there's a resolution. Another thing is there are often errors when I download apps from the app store and I end up having to redownload them. I don't know if this is a device issue for certain, but it is annoying.As an added note, I had the opportunity to play around with an Asus 10 " tablet a few weeks ago and was jealous she could have an animated background that changed with the times of day! But unless there's a way to enlarge the icons on the opening screen, I admit I like the big ol' carousel (when it isn't hiding) as my eyesight is deteriorating.

Reviews.Title: A 21st Century Must Have Tool For Living
Reviews.Author: Alan Batten "promoman"
Reviews.Content: Until I purchased my Kindle Fire HD 8.9", I had been resisting getting an e-book reader as well as something in addition to my iPad 3. Well, the light weight and versatility of the Kindle beat out the perceived advantages of my Apple tablet. I love the clarity of the images and text on the Kindle as well as the ability to look something up at a tap in the text. I've read several books on the Kindle and found it to be very convenient. I'm also an Audible member, so I can use the Whispersync feature when I wish or listen to one of the audio books in my cloud library. The Dolby audio is crisp and clear as I play music from my Amazon Cloud Player.  Another great feature is the long battery life. Minor problems with finding particular aps for the Kindle Fire have not been too bad.  Over all, I would highly recommend it!

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Does What It Was Design To Do Very Well
Reviews.Author: Ivy J. Frazier "Cadillac Joe"
Reviews.Content: I just got my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 yesterday and am very pleased with it out the box.  I read comparisons between the Kindle, IPad and Nexus 7 for weeks and the bottom line is people i.e. reviewers like what they like and it doesn’t take long when they are comparing the various devices to see if they are IPad, Nexus or Kindle fans.  You can compare processors, screen contrast, memory, etc. until you are blue in the face; I personally can’t see anything in the way of speed, sound and display when using the Kindle that would cause me to switch to an IPad or Nexus.  I will say I’m not a big fan of Apple; they seem to nickel and dime you to death and are rarely competitive when it comes to price.  I am an Prime Amazon consumer i.e. I buy everything under the sun from Amazon and like the idea that the Kindle is tailored for their website and products.  I like the idea that Amazon does offer the consumer books and magazines for FREE; if nothing else it is a great gesture from a retailer to a consumer.Last night I streamed a movie, surfed the web, listen to my music as well loaded roughly 5600 mp3 to the cloud last night (It took about 8 hours) so that I can have them at my finger tips with the Kindle.  The entire Kindle experience was satisfying.  Being a man that doesn’t carry a purse, backpack, clutch or anything along those lines, I decided on the 8.9 inch version; the 7 inch wouldn’t fit in my pants pocket, so what was the point in passing up a larger screen for roughly the same price as the 7 inch.  Women on the other hand carry a suitcase around daily so the 7 inch may be better, if you are considering portability.If you like one stop shopping the IPad and Kindle are what you are looking for.  If you want to be locked inside a room with only a front door and no key, I would say stick with Apple products and buy an IPad.  If you would like the option of a locked front door and an unlocked back door then I’d say go with the Kindle and Amazon’s products.  If you want a front and back door with a window and a key to lock and unlock both doors, then go with a Nexus; you will however have to find independent sites to buy your movies, music, books, magazines, etc.  Personally, I don’t have the time or desire to go from site to site trying to find media and audio content for my entertainment device.Lastly, I own 3 PCs, 1 Netbook, 1 Apple Mini computer, 1 Barnes and Noble Nook,  a Kindle DX and now the Kindle Fire.  I believe in buying the right tool for the job.  If I wanted the fastest CPU and was doing serious multitasking on the go, I would buy a notebook computer, not a tablet that is designed for pure entertainment which both the IPad and Kindle are really design to accommodate.  I hope this review helps you in your decision making.

Reviews.Title: Amazon Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Erin Fuhrhop
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product for the price.  Make sure you do research and look at reviews before you decide which tablet you want.  I am a big time facebooker and gamer and was very disappointed after I bought this and found out you cannot download the facebook games to the kindle fire hd or play them.  As far as getting on the internet it is easy and is very fast.  I love to watch netflix movies on it and it has great picture and sound.  Skyping is great.  Downloading apps from the android market is quick and easy.  Love reading books on my kindle.If you are looking to buy one that plays all those facebook games, might as well spend the extra $$ to get an ipad so you can do that.Seems to freeze up more times than what seems normal.  Not sure if this is just mine or something that happens to all of them.  I guess with all computers there is a chance of that.Overall- good product for the price you pay for it.

Reviews.Title: Have one and ordered another today
Reviews.Author: Brad Bradsher "silverlake"
Reviews.Content: I got the 7" Fire a few months ago and then purchased the 8.9" HD a month or so later.  My wife has taken to using the 8.9" Fire and my son has confiscated the 7" one; so I ordered another for myself tonight.  The color on all is outstanding, and we are an Amazon family.Having Prime and ordering like we do on Amazon made getting Kindles a no brainer. Both my wife and I are retired and can use the Fire for anything we want to do. Movies are easily and quickly streamed on WiFi with no stutter, etc.  I would highly recommend this to anyone who is heavily invested in Amazon, as we are!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD  7"
Reviews.Author: Alene
Reviews.Content: I bought my Kindle last December. I'm 83 love to read but don't see well so books are out. My Grandson set it all up for me. There is nothing about it I don't like except for the adds!!! I'm a Prime member I don't think I should have to be bothered by the adds. They blink on and you can't get rid of them till they are ready to go.Some are very bad but all are a nuisence. Get rid of them for Prime ussers!!! Alene

Reviews.Title: A Pretty Amazing Device
Reviews.Author: S. Rhodes
Reviews.Content: Over the years technology has changed so much.  And so quickly.  I still remember when the first Kindle came out and pretty much changed the world.  It was a revolution for book readers.  And then other things happened.  The release of the iPad, for instance, which caused everyone to jump up and make a tablet.  Now there are so many to choose from that when I considered buying a tablet I wasn't sure what to go with.  In the end I went with the Kindle Fire HD.  The price was good and I've been a part of the Amazon community for years on end.  I haven't been disappointed in my purchase one bit.  There are a couple of small gripes that add up, but nothing much.I won't spend much time talking about the technical specs of the Kindle Fire HD.  I have the 16GB one that's 8.9 inches.  It comes with a USB cord, but doesn't come with one of those actual chargers.  This isn't too bad, because if you already have a smart phone that charger will suffice, but if you don't have a charger already it's kind of silly that you get the cord but not the charger itself and you immediately need to pay $20 on top of this.Setting up your kindle is pretty simple.  If you've already got an Amazon account you can connect to that easily.  If you are not an Amazon Prime member you can start a free trial.  If you have a Kindle, however, I urge you become a part of Amazon Prime.  It'll be a good decision in the long run.  It not only gives you some pretty decent shipping prices, but for people who own a Kindle Fire you'll be able to have access to a few things you wouldn't otherwise, such as television shows on the IMDB.  Or you can "borrow" books for free from the Amazon Library for as long as you want without having to pay a dime.  If you have a kindle, you might as well get prime on top of it.  It's not bad for a years time.The tablet itself is extremely light and feels pretty nice and sleek.  There are two speakers on the back near the bottom that give off some good sound, but you can always plug in head phones or a speaker if you want.  There is also a camera that should be at the top if you hold it for a landscape view, and on the left if you're holding it like a book.  The orientation will adjust automatically (though you can lock the orientation if you so choose to), but some applications and games will have a preset orientation you cannot change.  Likewise, I would highly suggest a case and a screen protector for your Kindle fire HD immediately.  It's light and simple.  Perfect for on the go stuff.  All the more reason to have a case.  And if you're going to constantly be having your fingers on it a screen protector will do nice so that the screen doesn't smudge.The display itself is pretty crisp.  Everything being displayed in fine HD.  You can adjust the brightness in the settings menu if you want just about any time you want with a pretty easy interface of a menu.  Even if you're in the middle of an app or a book you can access the settings by sliding your finger (or stylus, as I prefer to use) down from the top and it allows quick access to things like your settings, notifications wi-fi access, etc.  The user interface of the Kindle Fire HD is pretty easy stuff.  And no matter where you are it's easy to return to the home menu at any time.Any time you leave a program, app or book, it will be on display in your "carousal" which allows you to go through every item.  Recently downloaded items also appear here.  If your carousal gets too crowded you can always hold your finger (or stylus) on the item and select to remove it from the carousal.  You can also put it on your favorites for easier access.  The carousal is a good idea, but I've found that mine gets crowded a little too easy.  I use a lot of apps and read a lot of books and from time to time browse the web.  Every now and then my carousal gets too full and I have to go through removing stuff from it one by one by one.  There is no option to universally clear your carousal.There's Bluetooth and Wifi on the Kindle Fire HD.  I did not purchase the one with 4G so I can't tell you about that.  It's pretty easy to connect to the internet.  And it'll be able to store all kinds of wireless networks in its memory.  The only problem that I have is that the web browser itself is not that good.  More often than not when I'm surfing the web and read news stories or going to certain sites that no application exist for, I'll get a message that the browser has stopped working or that the tab I'm using has stopped working.  These messages are not infrequent in the slightest. I would highly recommend downloading a different browser as opposed to using the default browser.  Most other browsers are a lot better.Of course, one of the biggest tenants you're looking for is probably the apps.  And there are a lot of apps to choose from on the Kindle Fire HD.  Cheap as well as expensive.  The good news is that you can always get a sense of what you're in for because there are always reviews for each app.  They download fast (most of the time, if they're not too big).  There are 16GB of space available on my tablet (there is a 32GB one available, if you wish) and even that feels like a lot.  Apps and books are pretty small and take up nearly no space whatsoever.  In fact, most of the space on mine is occupied by the professional narration on some of the books I have.  Case in point, unless you're feeling like you'll download tons of movies or things which take up whole gigabytes of space, the 16GB hard drive is more than enough to satisfy.When you download movies they come up very crisp indeed, but I don't download a lot of movies to my tablet.  I use my Ultraviolet account a lot, but that uses the internet to stream from my collection (and a handy little application called Flixster for that).  It's the books I'm more interested in.  There are LOTS of classic literature books you can download for free.  When you download books you can add professional narration to them as well.  Sometimes it's free and sometimes it isn't.  It's more or less like putting an audiobook version to your standard book.  Most times the professional narration is unabridged.  I've yet to find an abridged one.  For some books there is still an option to tap to hear text read aloud, but since it's not the "professional" narration it's just a robotic voice that really drones on (and it's boring... very boring).  So if you feel the need to listen to your books, the professional narration is pretty amazing.  If you feel like reading, however, you can adjust the settings by changing the background, font size and even the font itself.  But the best feature is the ability to "X-Ray" the book.  You can see certain terms used a lot and how often.  You can read about certain things that other kindle users highlighted.  But you can go deeper and read about the author himself or herself.  You can look up terms and locations.  You'll instantly be taken to the web if you see something you may not know about and you're curious to learn.  It's overall pretty handy to X-Ray a book.  You can also make as many notes as you like on your book.When you're finished with a book (or when you X-Ray) it always offers suggestions of where to go from there or what to read next.  It's always offering suggestions and you can always find reviews if you like to help you out.You can use that USB cord to connect your Kindle Fire HD to your computer at any time and put documents from your computer or even a few other things if you desire.  Sometimes this is pretty nice.  I was able to transfer documents to my Kindle from my laptop pretty easily.  This includes music and movies if you want them.  And the Kindle can read quite a few formats.There are a few things that can be urksome about the Kindle Fire.  Some are little and some are bigger problems.  The first is that it isn't easy to access the files.  Unless you download an outside app for that.  You can get into the basic stuff like your music, books and movies.  But if you want to go just a little deeper you have to download an outside app for that.  Likewise, it's difficult to move things from one folder to another.  If you put a document on your Kindle Fire and it automatically puts it in the books (I'm not sure why mine did this) it's not easy to move it over without going onto your laptop to do so, or downloading a document manager app of sorts.  It just seems strange to me that management type options wouldn't be built into the Kindle itself from the get go.  Instead you need an app.  It's a free app, but why should I have to do this?Another strange problem I've run into is that my kindle, from time to time, freezes or just goes blank for no apparent reason.  Then it'll suddenly start rebooting.  I'm not sure what happens.  This doesn't happen often, but it happens often enough to be noticeable.  There were also times when it lagged so much that I wasn't sure if my clicking on certain links, apps or books was actually registering.  Come to find out that sometimes it registers just a little too late.  And other times it just so happens my Kindle has frozen on me and I have to shut it down and restart it.  Again, not too often, but often enough to be noticeable.  I have also run into times when it can't seem to seek out the wireless network in the area.  The solution is--you guessed it--I have to shut down and reboot the Kindle Fire HD (although for this little problem sometimes putting it in sleep mode and then bringing it out works just the same).  Like the other two issues, this doesn't happen often--but it happens often enough to be noticeable.Overall, though, I like my Kindle Fire HD a lot.  I wouldn't trade it for anything.  Not an iPad or a Nexus 7 or any other tablet.  The problems I've encountered aren't big enough and it's very possible that no one is experiencing some of the things I experience at all.  I've been enjoying my Kindle Fire because it's made a lot of my life simpler.  Particularly when I travel.  It's nice to have all my books in one place without having to have a bag full of six or seven when I'm out.  And I can also get magazine subscriptions and go to Youtube or whatever without hassle at all.  If you're looking for a nice, inexpensive tablet, then the Kindle Fire HD is a pretty good deal.  You'll end up having to splurge a few extra bucks for some much needed accessories (charger, case, screen protector and stylus are the ones I recommend most) but in the end it is definitely worth while to do so.  It's a solid tablet, and I give it a four.

Reviews.Title: Ah yes! Better than it's competitor from a famous company named after a fruit
Reviews.Author: Brigitte Pauli
Reviews.Content: Stunning HD. Actually very decent stereo sound. Great when connected to my Subaru sound system in the car. Works fantastically as an e-reader (finally in the perfect reading size for books AND magazines). I was among the first people on this planet to "fall" for the original iPad, which is still have. This fall the option was to buy its smaller successor or the larger Kindle. I opted for the latter primarily because of the fantastic price. When I got it, it already had all the basic info on it. Within seconds, I was wirelessly connected and ready to use all of my Amazon cloud content. Amazing what my friends at Amazon have done for so little money. You are my electronic heroes! New slogan for you guys: Amazon delivers amazing once again. You aren't the inventors of normal, you're the improvers of supposedly perfect.

Reviews.Title: Fire HD 4G: not bad, but there ARE a few bugs... ..
Reviews.Author: Markus B
Reviews.Content: Well, we've had this for a couple of weeks now, and overall, we are pretty happy with them (we got two).When We got ready to buy a tablet, I did a lot of research, and decided that most of the useage we would have for one would be media consumption(movies, TV shows, books, etc.), and web surfing, checking emails and the like. After comparing most of the popular tablets, I was down to the iPad and the Fire 8.9 HD 4G. The iPad was a bit more expensive, and had more features and more apps, but the Kindle allows you access to a lot more free media if you get an Amazon Prime account, which we had planned to do anyway.(Honestly, if you want productivity and real-world WORK capability, like document production, etc., buy an iPad, or really, buy a laptop. The laptop will be cheaper.)The screen is bright,clear and the video and audio quality is very good. The touch screen can be a bit balky at times, though. I'd recommend buying a stylus. It is far smoother with that than with your finger.Make sure your hands are clean and not sweaty or greasy.The loading is fast...VERY fast if you have either a good WiFi signal, or are connected to 4G. Which is another issue. 4G is not always available...if you are on trips, driving, like we do, then you will find a lot of areas where you will find yourself hooked to 3G or Edge instead, which is much slower. Grrrr.Forget streaming video if you are on Edge. It's too slow. However, you CAN download content, and then play it back at your leisure...but some HD movies are larger than your memory, unless you have the 64Gb memory, so there's another issue.Also, you cannot play ANY Flash content, like, say, a lot of YouTube videos, and some commercial websites. This is not Amazon's fault. Adobe no longer supports ANY mobile devices, including phones or iPads.Don't worry...there is a work-around. You just download the ES File Explorer from the app store(which, believe me, you are going to want anyway. It's a super useful app.) and then you download the Dolphin web browser, and then (finally!) you can go get Flash Player 11 for mobile devices, which runs with Dolphin, but not Silk. (Silk is the web browser that comes with your Kindle.) Supposedly, in the future, this will not be an issue since most websites are supposed to be switching to HTML5.Bottom line: We pretty much like it. If we had it to do over, we'd still buy two more Kindle Fire's, in spite of the above noted glitches. It still has more upside than downside. The huge availability of media content of all types makes up for the shortcomings. We just can't give it five stars, so...four stars.Very good, it is.Perfect, it is not.

Reviews.Title: Battery drains too fast
Reviews.Author: M M
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Kindle 8.9 for Christmas and do like the quality and feel of the device, speaker sound and screen resolution.  I have only placed two apps on it, along with 4 songs I bought via Amazon.  I have not used the device for games or viewing videos and have only used it to access the internet and I have also played the songs I bought.  Even so, the battery drains at a very rapid rate and does not provide anywhere near the 11 hours of support advertised for the device.  I had read a comment from another customer who had a similar problem and he stated that his device was replaced immediately, and with the new Kindle already loaded with the same apps he had on the defective device.  I called customer support and was told my problem was not one that they do a replacement for and that I could do a return and then turn around and buy the device again.  I had agreed to wait for the Kindle techs to analyze the data logs sent from my Kindle so they could provide a fix but decided that I should not have to wait for a fix for a device that came to me already defective.  So, I'm doing the return but will have to do some serious thinking about ordering another one.  Including my recent purchases for this Christmas and last, I have bought a total of 7 Kindles.  You figure customer support would have gladly done an exchange in order to keep me as a customer.

Reviews.Title: I think it's better than Ipad
Reviews.Author: chunhui liu
Reviews.Content: The color of this product is very good.I like the most is that its MOBI format the function of the books.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: penny kendall
Reviews.Content: I am new with thing tablet, but what I have seen I really like. Just the right size, a little heaver then I figured the longer I held it, but I know I will enjoy it. Thank you honey for my Christmas gift....

Reviews.Title: Definitely worth giving a shot
Reviews.Author: Daniel W. Grilley
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD is probably the best value tablet you can buy, but it does have some shortcomings.  The build quality of the device seems as good as the iPad and I don't notice any major differences there.  If you follow some of the you tube videos it is possible to basically turn this into a full service andriod tablet.  Right out of the box it is somewhat restricted because you can only go the the amazon app store.  Here are the what I find to be the advantages/disadvantages of the kindle versus the ipad:ProsPrice - the best priced tablet on the market, especially after the deals amazon has be running.Build Quality - Found it to be on par with the ipad.Picture Quality - Sitting next to my Ipad 2 I find the picture quality to be better on the kindle.Configuration - There are a lot of ways to tweak this product and unlock features that aren't immediately available.HDMI port - Unlike the ipad this thing has an HDMI out which mirrors the dispaly on your tv.Super Fast Wireless - It is very fast and reliable.Parental Controls - Best of any tablet.ConsPower/Volume Button - The power button and volume are hard to find with your fingers.  I typically have to look.Location of USB/HDMI - Really bad design and I can't believe no one caught this in development very annoying.On Screen Keyboard - The return key is often missing and it makes working with some apps difficult.Lacking Device to play through wireless? - Have not found a way to mirror this over wireless (like Apple TV).I found most apps I use on the iPad to be available either at the kindle store or via adding another app store.  My issues with the power button were mostly overcome by adding a case because now it comes back on automatically when I open the case so I only need to find the power button if I need to turn the device off completely(almost never).  My brother and I both bought the kindle at the same time and I love mine overall, but he was so annoyed about the issues with the on screen keyboard and the fact that twitter doesn't allow copy and paste in their andriod app that he will probably return his.  I don't use twitter, but this was clearly not a fault of the kindle.  Overall I would definitely buy it again, but I do see some users having a different experience depending on what they use the tablet to do.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat the functionality for the price
Reviews.Author: pasadena201
Reviews.Content: I used to have a gen 1 iPad, which I loved, but I think I love the Kindle even more. It's less expensive, looks great, has the same apps - except iTunes, but I have an iPhone, so I don't care about that. I use mine the most to watch Netflix and Hulu as I wander about the house doing things. It's so portable!  Doesn't need extra speakers, the sound is great as is. Someday I might even read a book on it.

Reviews.Title: I am IN LOVE
Reviews.Author: Jose Garcia
Reviews.Content: ahhhh the Kindle Fire HD 8.9/ What can I say about this beauty. This is Very well made. Doesnt have that cheap plastic feel to it like other tablets and phones do. It is pretty thin, but heavy enough to know its durable. Very sexy look to it. I love the HDMI out feature. Battery life is decent. screen resolution is AMAZING. very very clear. I could watch it all day. Screen is a great size too. I don't have anything bad to say about this besides the obvious lack of apps and games (since it uses the amazon store and not the google play store) but it has more than enough to keep me entertained for a long time. combined with amazon prime, this tablet is a keeper for me. AMAZING DEVICE.

Reviews.Title: my 4th kindle
Reviews.Author: MEH
Reviews.Content: I JUST GOT MY FOURTH KINDLE.  KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9.  I LOVE IT!  MY FIRST TWO KINDLE'S  (GENERATION ONE AND TWO), WENT TO MY KIDS, THEY UPGRADED AND GAVE THE FIRST TWO TO THEIR KIDS.  MY THIRD KINDLE, (KINDLE FIRE) WENT TO MY HUSBAND, WHO BY THE WAY SAID HE DIDN'T NEED ONE, WOULDN'T USE IT,  BUT SPENT THREE HOURS ON IT LAST NIGHT AND REFUSES TO PASS IT ON.  MY KINDLE FIRE HD 8.9, 16 GB HAS FANTASTIC COLOR, DIMENSIONS, GRAPHICS,  AND FEATURES (BUT) THE INSTRUCTIONS ARE SOME WHAT HELPFUL BUT NOT DETAILED ENOUGH FOR ME FOR SO I'M GOING TO GET THE COPY FOR DUMMIES.  TRANSFERRING AND DOWNLOADING TOOK A FEW CALLS TO AMAZON BUT LIKE I SAID I NEED DUMMIES INSTRUCTIONS.  I DON'T LIKE THE SUGGESTED ITEMS WHERE THEY ARE BUT I DO LIKE THEM.  I MISS THE BOOKCASE LOOK ON HOME  PAGE BUT NO BIGGY. THE BIGGEST ISSUE TO ME IS LACK OF THE CLICKING SOUND WHEN YOU TYPE ON THE SCREEN KEYBOARD BUT I STILL LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Gorgeous display.
Reviews.Author: M. Kirst
Reviews.Content: I'm in love with this tablet. The display is crisp and beautiful, the browsing is fast. This is the tablet version of getting into a brand new BMW. You know how all the little details have been thought of? I really like the ways it changes screens, accepts setting changes, switches modes, etc. They've thought of the esthetic experience as well. (We also have an iPad 3). Really really nice tablet

Reviews.Title: If you are a E-reader Purist.....
Reviews.Author: T. Washington "BADelta"
Reviews.Content: then this device is not for you.  I have been a Kindle owner since the first one, you know the white one with the clicky things on the side.  I have upgraded with (almost) each new device.  When I owned the original Kindle I read all the time.  With all of the features on this device, the last thing I do is read.  It started with the Kindle Fire, now its full blown with this upgrade.  Not bashing the device, I love it as a tablet.  We have a "family" I-Pad and I rarely use it because of the limitations with certain programs/websites. I am not an Apple hater,  I have an IPOD but I can do basically everything I can do on a laptop with this device. My job requires me to be in the field alot and while waiting on appointments  I can check emails, Facebook, do info search on the web for my appointment, play apps....everything but read!  The resolution is amazing, the responsiveness of the touch screen is great. The web is very responsive.  I like the fact that I can jump between free WI-FI when available and AT&T; when WI-FI is not available. Like everyone, I am concerned how much this luxury will cost me when the year is up.  But for now I am pleasently pleased with my purchased.

Reviews.Title: IT IS BIGGER THAN I THOUHGT!
Reviews.Author: K. Ulmer
Reviews.Content: After my first Kindle Fire, I thought I would like the bigger one.  Didn't take to mind that 8.9 is the size of the screen, that the actual tablet is REALLY BIG inside my case. YIKES!Took a bit of getting used to figuring how to maneuver, but think I have it figured now. Easier to use now than at first.  LOVE the speakers, WOW, what sound, no need for my ear phones, and I am hearing impaired....My 3 CONS---the button to turn it on, is HARD to find by feel, so I placed a little sticker on the border where it is!  The other thing, before, there is a button with a light when the Kindle Fire is charging, this one has NO light , so I just plug it in at night.  Still last a LONG time on one charge.My last con....my first Kindle Fire, had a GUIDE book that came on it.  This one has nothing like that.  Odd.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD
Reviews.Author: TIM_IA
Reviews.Content: I would say overall a few improvements in picture (HD) and generally in the speed of everything thanks to the newer processor - I own an original Kindle Fire also.  The front camera is nice and Skype works pretty well (in low light however it struggles).  Sound is nice - not sure I'd describe it as loud even at peak volume.WiFi is nice and fast and 5GHz compatible with my N router which is nice.  The touch on the screen is nice and responsive - we are using a stylus also which I personally find easier.Don't need the fast charger ($19.99) if you have a PC with a USB port - it includes the cable to charge with a PC.There is no mini HDMI cable included - so if you are hoping to output to a TV screen or monitor - you'll need to order a part to do that.Overall as solid and responsive than the original Kindle Fire.  Built in microphone and camera are a big plus.

Reviews.Title: I love my fire
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle Fire HD 8.9!  Everything works as advertise!  Great video playback on Amazon Prime.  No drops in video with the wifi.  I love the Immersion Reading and I have been looking for something like this for a very long time.  If you have a disability and can work a stylus, then a this tablet is for you.  Hooking up to an HDTV is very nice and works great.The only bad thing is where the cables plug into if you are using the holder.  You have to make the camera on the bottom, so the cables are on top.

Reviews.Title: Great product!
Reviews.Author: DLM
Reviews.Content: I have the 8.9" 4G model.  I already have a Kindle Keyboard that I love.  This is my first tablet, but I am familiar with an iPad from work.  I love my Kindle Keyboard so much that I decided to go for the Kindle Fire. It does exactly what I need. It is a quick way to access the Internet and check e-mail.  I have downloaded a few apps so far and am satisfied with that. It is solidly based in the Amazon World obviously.  It is light and the screen is so clear it is wonderful. To address a few things that people have complained about:1.  Ads:  The ads are on the lock screen and I do not even notice them!  They are also supposed to be on the bottom corner of the home screen, but I have never noticed them!2.  Charger: I have at least 3 plugs at my house that accommodate the Kindle Fire charger.  I am perfectly fine with the fact that there was not a charger in the box.  Plus, I knew there was no charger in the box since I had read the description before ordering! Thus, it was not a surprise!3.  Setup:  Yes, it was a bit confusing when I took it out of the box and there was no directions and no clear on/off switch.  But I took the included USB wire and plugged it into a charger in my house and let it start charging.  After a few minutes, I was able to start using it while it was charging.  It took me maybe 10 minutes to set it up...very easy.Overall, I am pleased. I am not yet a Prime member, but plan on joining.  I am just waiting to start my free month till I have something I want!  I am still figuring some things out but am enjoying the tablet so far.Here are my reasons why I did not give it 5 stars.  And there is the chance that some of these things I just have not figured out yet!1.  I do not like the carousel.  I like the idea...but I wish I could put things in folders.  All books in one folder. All Apps in one folder (or subdivide them once get a lot), Music in one folder... I feel like I am going to forget about things that "fall" to the back of the carousel.2. E-mail.  I am not sure if I am missing something, but I wish there was some kind of notification of when I get new e-mail.  The iPad beeps just like my computer.  As far as I can tell on the Fire, the only way to tell if I have new mail is to go in and check it.  Am I missing something?3.  Apps.  While I am satisfied with the apps, the number of apps is much smaller than what I am used to on an iPad.4.  4G.  I tried registering for the $50 4G plan from AT&T.;  But when I put down that I am already an AT&T; customer it didn't give me the $50/year option.  It gave me several other options, all of which were more expensive than the $50.  I have not tried again yet.  Thought I would wait a few days and see if I figure out how to do it from reading other people's reviews.  But very frustrating that it was not simple!Overall, it is not perfect.  But it works for me!

Reviews.Title: Very pleased
Reviews.Author: K. Kressenberg
Reviews.Content: I've been sitting back, waiting to buy a tablet. I do own an original Kindle, which died 2 weeks ago.Well, that pushed me right over the edge. I determined in short order that the new 8.9" form factor and HD screen moved this away from simple e-reader to tablet. Also, as I live in the boonies with just one broadband card for my desktop, plus I travel frequently for work, plus my addiction to the NY Times; I felt that 4G was a must. So I went all in, except I did stick with the 32GB memory.It arrived almost a week earlier than I'd been warned at the time of purchase and so far so good. It was a little cranky to get my subscriptions sorted out (NYT can only be "bound" to one device, and I had to get support to assist with that.)I did not realize it required an AT&T; plan at the time of purchase, I had assumed it was like my old Kindle with the WhisperNet thing. Still, the intro deal at $49.95 for 12 months is fair. When I see what it goes up to after that, I may scream bloody murder!! In any case, the AT&T; deal was easy to set up and works flawlessly.I think this thing is a winner. EMail is great, Silk works well and quickly, and of course there's the improved layout of NYT and other pubs over the text-only view on my old Kindle. In fact, along those lines, with my old reader there were books, such as biographies, which if I suspected had lots of pictures I would still buy as a physical book rather than the Kindle version till now.

Reviews.Title: WOOHOO!!!
Reviews.Author: Alyce
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire!!!  I look forward to many, many happy hours playing and learning with it.  My lifestyle includes train travel fairly often and childcare in homes that, often, don't have TV.  My Kindle provides me with entertainment always!!

Reviews.Title: Kindle HD review
Reviews.Author: Robert W. Larkin
Reviews.Content: This is a great improvement over the first generation unit.  It imported all my documents and apps over from the old unit.  much better design and the integration of the apps are well done.  I especially like the size of the larger unit but yet it's not at all like an IPAD which I found a bit too large.  I decided to purchase a 32 GB unit with the AT&T; service contract but so far have found that the wireless serves most of my needs.  Love the unit and find new apps I must have each day.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire, WOW!
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Lane "Liberal with bullets"
Reviews.Content: Have had three Kindle's and this is the best!  We had a tablet before and this is a vast improvement on the Galaxy 10.1!  Does everything well so far.  We are impressed with the web experience as well as the reader features.  Seamless setup and very intuitive as well.  Buy one, you will love it!

Reviews.Title: Great Picture
Reviews.Author: A. Warner
Reviews.Content: Love the new HD 8.9 Kindle Fire.  I enjoy how fast it is on WiFi and the new HD picture and improved sound is AWESOME!  Amazon's Prime selection of books and movies really made this purchase worth it.

Reviews.Title: Upgrade from original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Peter Thrift
Reviews.Content: I purchased this Kindle Fire hd 8.9 as a replacement/upgrade to my original Kindle Fire tablet.  The display quality is equal to the iPad.  Its Wi-Fi performance exceeds the iPad 4.  I used the Amazon trade-in program for my old Kindle Fire.Well worth the investment!  I would definitely buy again!

Reviews.Title: Beware of refurbished
Reviews.Author: Mary
Reviews.Content: Excellent product for about 120 days - recommend saving ALL the packaging if you hope to return it for service.

Reviews.Title: Has Potential, But limits self
Reviews.Author: Emedtech
Reviews.Content: I ordered my kindle Fire HD with the aspirations of using it as my main weapon of choice for conquering my classes at school. I was going to use it mainly for keeping books and documents on my device and as a medical study tool. I am an avid Google user, so naturally I was torn between the new Nexus 7 FDH and this. Because of an amazing deal that Amazon ordered I decided to go with the kindle. I was excited. Once I received my device, the hidden disappointments began to roll in. Carousel; is pointless and rather aggravating to use. It becomes an endless list that's annoying to continually delete programs from. My other disappointment is how shallow the app base is for the kindle. Very controlling; almost like Apple but without the massive app resources. I can't use Google chrome, google docs (side note: amazon does have their own versions of cloud storage, but I prefer the seamless browsing that google provides) or any google play apps or even Itunes apps; only amazon apps (mainly consisting of paid apps). The tablet is a beautify made and the screen is crisp and responsive. The real power of the kindle comes from the massive Amazon prime account. So if you're not into that, you're pretty much missing out on the true point of this tablet; a media devouring machine. This thing has potential, but Amazon put's limits of what could be an amazing device. Despite it's beautiful screen, the adds, the limited app store, the need to get an amazon prime account to get real use out of it, the useless Carousel option, the lack of support for google made it a no for me. I ended up sending it back and getting a Nexus 7 FDH instead, which is what I should have done in the first place.

Reviews.Title: I like it a lot
Reviews.Author: Willie B.
Reviews.Content: Not somethng you will slip in your pocket, but with the Amazon leather cover, quite comfortably portable (easier and more weatherproof than carrying a book in your hand). If you recognize that this is not intended as a replacement for a laptop Windows computer you will find that, with free or inexpensive apps, you have full access to e-mail, an MS-Office clone, and plenty of gadgets that will carry you through without a full laptop. It even outputs HDMI for a big screen or projector. There are even apps for remotely accessing files on, or even taking control of your home or office desktop. I've been using it for several weeks, and find it my constant companion.The screen resolution and colors are fantastic, and the touch is reliable. Unless your fingers are greasy, the screen does not gather smudges that cloud the display. The user interface is easy to get used to, and, with a 4G account you needn't worry about finding a WiFi hotspot. The only drawback I can see is that there is only a front-facing camera. Great for Skyping, but no way to take pictures or capture video without turning the tablet away from you. For my needs that's not worth taking away a star from an otherwise stellar product.

Reviews.Title: Like it, but a few problems
Reviews.Author: Kathy  R. Portie
Reviews.Content: This is our 1st tablet. Our daughter and family have two IPADs and we were impressed with what they could do. After much research, we decided on the Kindle Fire 8.9.I must say the picture quality is great on the device itself, however, I also purchased an HDMI cable to stream movies from Prime on the Kindle to our TV. This is where it breaks down. While the picture quality on the Kindle itself is great, the picture quality on our TV was horrible. The colors where way off and the picture was hazy. Almost like viewing a 3D movie without the glasses. We were hoping to use this feature when we travel, but it doesn't look like it now.Then there was the connecting the Kindle to my husbands PC to download files and pictures. It never could find the device driver to install, and therefore he is unable to connect and download anything. When he went to the help screen at Amazon, he notice that this is a very common problem. He tried some of the fixes, but nothing worked. He then started a chat with the technical support and that was a joke. After an hour, the tech support came to the conclusion that my Kindle was defective, even though many other customers were having the same problem. He then tried connecting to my computer and it connected right away. He advised the tech support person, and asked where he could get the device driver to download to his computer, since that seem to be the problem. The tech support response was that they don't make one since the Kindle doesn't need it....Really!!! So, now to download files from his computer, he has to download to a flash drive, upload to my computer, then download to the Kindle. Very cumbersome, but it's all we have, since Amazon doesn't have a workaround themselves.If you are only going to use the Kindle by itself, it is a great tablet, but beware of it's shortcomings, if you intend to use it for some other purpose. Also, beware of their tech support, my husband basically knew more than they did!!

Reviews.Title: Definitely meets my high expectations!
Reviews.Author: Cory
Reviews.Content: I love the new Kindle Fire. The picture and sound are amazing, and right out of the box it was so easy to use.

Reviews.Title: My first tablet
Reviews.Author: Rob
Reviews.Content: I am a total fanboi of the Kindle Fire now. I love the size and features it has to offer. It's nice and slim and Amazon has many programs to offer for it. I only go to the computer for serious hardcore games and big work on the computer. Other than that I am on this lovely and portable device.

Reviews.Title: Love my new Fire HD
Reviews.Author: Time to Read "time to read"
Reviews.Content: I have to admit, that I am a Kindle junkie!  I have owned several different versions of the Kindle and also the first Kindle Fire.  When I got the new 8.9 HD, I was so excitied.  First, it's beautiful!  Second, OMG the image is clear, crisp and so sharp.  The Kindle Fire HD is very easy to use with on screen instructions and tips.  It is very easy to connect to all of your social media including, facebook, twitter and my space.  You also have access to all of your yahoo, hotmail and gmail accounts.  The app store is not as robust as Google Play however there are some decent apps out there.I am a Prime member, so I have all of my books, music and movies on Amazon.  I really worried with this one how surfing the web would be as the last fire seemed to be rather cumbersome and slow.  The Fire HD is FAST!
