I have a newer Dell laptop core i5 and this new Kindle Fire loads just as quick if not quicker in some instances than my laptop.I have spent about a week now with my new Fire HD and my love and awe continue.  I love being able to do everything online that I need to do, check my bank, check my school work, office work, shop, play games and facebook.  I really barely use my laptop these days unless I have to type something.  I do hope they come out with keyboard case for the Kindle Fire.Now on to Kindle Free time - I have a 5 year old who loves my Kindle.  I started up the free time for him and set up his profile.  We downloaded all of his apps and books and he clicks on his name to see just his stuff when he wants to use the Kindle.  I am rather disappointed that the books that I have ordered for him say text to speech is enabled but it only reads the credit of the books.  I was hoping that he would be able to read along with the stories.  Hope this gets fixed soon!Ipad vs. Kindle Fire HD - I also own and IPad.. and to be honest, I hate it.  It sits here and I never use it.  It's heavy and cold.  I really hate the metal feel in my hands and the price is ungodly.  The Ipad2 is also much slower than the Fire HD.  That being said I was very happy with the price for the Fire HD.  I opted to purchace the one without special ads.  I was really bothered that the Fire HD only comes with the cable for charging and not the actual wall charger.  You have to buy this seperatly for 19.99.So why the 4 star review and not 5 if I love it?  Well for one the fact that I have to pay for a charger.  This in my opinion is BS.  Two, we need more apps... and some of the apps that are out there just don't work, even after uninstalling and reinstalling (slotomania and scramble with friends).  There are also paid versions of the apps that I have on my Samsung Galaxy SIII that I would love to put on my Kindle Fire but that is sadly not available.  Overall, I do love my Kindle Fire 8.9 HD, the size and weight are perfect.  It truly is a stunning tablet/e-reader.

Reviews.Title: So Beautiful!!!
Reviews.Author: Seraphine Flores
Reviews.Content: I love this!  The colors are so gorgeous....the sound fantastic!  I could still hear my movie when our very loud trash truck passed by my house! (Though not as good,of course! :D)  There is a problem with the power button on this particular unit though....doesn't depress.  But I phoned customer service, and they are sending me a new unit immediately! (And I can keep using this unit until then....fantastic customer service!)Anyway, I had the original kindle fire, but traded it in for this bigger screen. And for me, the bigger screen is much easier to use.....to view things and also the typing experience.  Ipad users who use their Ipads for entertainment purposes only....well, all I can say is, I am so glad I have this Kindle Fire HD!  Much prettier....(I could care less about "retina display"...give me crisp, bright, and colorful any day! :D)  Thank you, Amazon!!! :D

Reviews.Title: Very Nice
Reviews.Author: Thomas "curious 1"
Reviews.Content: My third Kindle and they just keep getting better. Great display and very fast. If it gets any thinner we'll be able to see through it. Has the feel of a tough piece of equipment. I really like it.

Reviews.Title: Mostly Love it, but a few Issues
Reviews.Author: Period Movie/Film Noir Lover
Reviews.Content: I was really hoping to love this new Kindle Fire HD five stars worth. Due to a few issues, I gave it a four because it's not possible to give a half star, otherwise I would have given it a four and a half.I've had a first generation Fire since they came out, and loved it from the start. There are some great improvements on this new one that I really love, but there are also a few things that I think could be better.  First, the good:The screen really does look as gorgeous as Amazon promised. The first thing I did when I received it was go to videos and watch the trailer for the movie "Brave", and I must say, I was absolutely blown away at the incredibly beautiful quality of the screen.  It's amazing!  After watching more videos, I am still just as impressed - they look fabulous and run smoothly with no lag. I'm also extremely happy with how spectacular my magazines look.The sound is great, and hugely improved over the first generation Kindle Fire, which makes enjoying video and music all the better.I love the larger size of the 8.9".  It makes the whole Kindle Fire experience even more enjoyable without being hard to handle.  Feels just right, nice and thin, and not heavy to hold.Processing speed is great, and so is Wifi speed.  Screen operation is very smooth, with scrolling much smoother than the first Kindle Fire.Very happy to have the camera to Skype on this Fire - I'll be Skyping with my friend in France who I don't get to see all that often, so for me that's a nice plus.  I know some people are complaining about the lack of another camera, but I knew that before I purchased it, and I don't intend to take pictures with my Fire so it's not an issue for me.Ok, now for the things that need improvement:I don't know what they were thinking when they decided on the on/off and volume buttons - they're hard to feel or see, and I quickly got sick of hunting for them.  However, I just received a case I ordered from Amazon, and now with the cut-out holes for the buttons in the case, they are easier to find.  Also the case automatically wakes/sleeps the Fire, so that's less pressing of the on/off button for me as well.  By the way, you don't have to spend a small fortune for a case - mine is really nice and it only cost about $15 on Amazon.Yesterday when I typed on my new Fire I had no problems.  Today, though I still have auto capitalization and word suggestions turned on (I checked), the auto caps and word suggestions are not working.  I'm going to call Amazon about this, but I would hope that issues like these will be fixed with the next automatic update.The Silk browser crashed several times yesterday as soon as I opened more than one tab, though it's been ok today.  Again, another issue that will hopefully be fixed with an update, as I believe Amazon did for the Silk browser on the first generation Fires (initially I had problems with Silk being unstable on my first Fire, but that issue was resolved).I found Amazon's "recommendations" for me below my carousel annoying, so I got rid of them by going to Settings, then Applications, then Home Recommendations and turning them off.  Annoying problem solved.  As for the ads on the opening screen, they don't bother me as they're only there briefly till I swipe the screen.Based on the experience I had with my first Kindle Fire, I think once there is an update for the new Kindle Fire HD, many of the kinks that I and others are experiencing should be solved (except, of course, for the buttons). Overall, I do love my new Fire, and I hope to be just as happy with it as I have been with my first generation Fire.  Hopefully after fixes, the only thing that would keep me from giving it a five-star review would be the on/off and volume buttons.

Reviews.Title: Nice improvement over the original Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Dave Edmiston
Reviews.Content: I've been using my original Kindle Fire for about a year now, and I've been using Kindle eBook readers since the original version of the Kindle (K1), so I have many years worth of likes and dislikes with the Kindle devices.  I've been using this new Fire HD 8.9" for about four days now and am very happy with it, with a few notable exceptions.  In general though, it's an amazing device and I'm pretty thrilled with it.I'm not happy about the lack of Flash, but that's inevitable based on Adobe's removal of Flash from the Android world.  My bigger complaint is over the lack of autocomplete in the Silk browser. I don't get it. They also changed the keyboard layout a little bit so that punctuation characters like the comma, the apostrophe, the question mark, etc. aren't available by just pressing and holding the period. So between the lack of autocomplete and the new location for these characters, typing text is clunkier than it was on the original Fire.Other than that, I really do love the new Fire.It's super fast. They really enhanced the browser and the CPU speed. Having a larger screen makes it easier to work with too. They also improved a lot of things on the UI to make the experience better.They stopped dumping your entire Library to the Carousel, which makes it a lot less cluttered when you initially start it up.I don't really care for the Related Items below the Carousel though (where the Favorites used to be). It's a pretty ham handed attempt to funnel you back to the Amazon store.The Facebook app stinks, but the screen is large enough and the tablet is fast enough that it's easier just to use the full Web-based version instead of the app or the mobile version.The product Offers on the home screen aren't as annoying as I had expected. I actually like them more than the screen saver images on the original Fire. At least these change up more often and give more variety.I like the new camera and the ability to use Skype.I like the attempts at location services, but it probably would have been easier just to put a cheap GPS radio in it.I thought I would really love the new location for the power button and the physical volume up/down buttons. The buttons are cheap though. I tried pushing volume down + power to take a screenshot (a feature that I was really hoping for), but the key combination never worked for me. This actually caused the power button to get stuck. With the power button stuck, there was no way to turn the device back on. I had to thump on the button with my finger a bunch of times to get it to unstick. I'll probably need to have Amazon replace this unit for me, because that's not OK.The Dolby speakers that Amazon touted so hard are actually really nice. I was surprised how good the sound quality is.For me the biggest and most awesome improvement is in the actual Book reader app. Reading Kindle books on the Fire HD 8.9" is amazing. The larger screen is so much easier to read on. And one very cool feature is that when you turn the device to landscape view, it gives you a two-page view. This is a very comfortable way to read. (My wife says she's had the two-page view in her iPad's Kindle app for a long time.)I've heard a lot of people complain about the lack of power adapter.  You get a USB cord, and the idea is that you plug this into your PC.  If you stick with this option, you will get a very slow charge from your Kindle.  If you have an original Kindle Fire, you are much better off using that charger for the new Fire HD.  I actually like the fact that it comes with a good USB cable.  I have plenty of 2.1A USB chargers around the house, so I'll use the cable with those chargers.All in all, I'm really happy with the fire. I'm still steamed about the quirky text input experience in the Silk browser, but hopefully enough people will gripe about the browser that they'll fix it in another version.

Reviews.Title: Fire OS 3.0; where art thou?
Reviews.Author: Iago "trinity"
Reviews.Content: As per Amazon's PR:Amazon currently has no plans to update the software on the existing Kindle Fire or Kindle Fire HD tablets.It states that Fire OS 3.0 will be "available exclusively" on the new Kindle Fire HD and the Kindle Fire HDX 7 and 8.9-inch models.BOOOOO!  Typical android fragmentation b/s for a mediocre tablet at best.  I don't want to "cry Apple", but seriously, if Apple Inc. can update their 3 year old hardware with a new OS, why can't Amazon?There is no reason to abandon original Kindle Fire HD 7 or 8.9-inch devices, considering that the technologies used are very similar to those in the new Kindle Fire HD!Here's my 2 cents...  Over and out.

Reviews.Title: Great ebook reader. Overall mixed feeling
Reviews.Author: Sonali Barua
Reviews.Content: Things I like about it:1. Great interface. Easy to use and lightweight enough to carry like a small book.2. I like the moving home button. That's one thing that annoyed me about the iPad when I played with it in the Apple store is that the home button was a physical button. The home button is a soft button on the screen that moves around as the screen does. It is at a convenient location all the time so that helps.3. I can now read my tech books while lying down on the bed, which are usually heavy and a pain to carry around. I used my laptop before ( too big) and my iPhone ( too small) too and neither were comfortable for me to read while I was lying in bed or just lounging around at a cafe. I feel like Goldilocks when I say this but the 8.9 kindle fire is just right.4. The sound and video quality is pretty good. so are apps on the Amazon.5. Going to the store and buying the apps/games/books/music/video is pretty easy, smooth and very quick over wireless.Things I didn't like:1. Packaging. I felt like besides that small thin USB cable, it could have included something else. Like maybe an power adapter that should NOT be 10 dollars more. I don't know what the iPad comes with but I have an iPhone and iPod touch and they both came with their own adapters. I luckily , like every other tech junkie out there, already have a belk USB adapter so its not like I was totally inconvenienced or something. Just enough to crib about it on Amazon anyway. I also thought it should have come with its own earphones. It doesn't. you have to get those too. :(. I just think it sweetens the deal, that's all. Then again, I might be totally spoiled by Apple.2. Keyboard. The keyboard is easy enough to use but the response seems to have a little lag and it isn't as smooth as one might think it could be. it has suggested words on top of the keyboard which does help speed up searches. Luckily I'm not going to be using it much for typing.3. Auto correct. I do like features like these when I am texting and it is a great help. Usually, but the auto correct kept correcting my name when I used it as a proper noun in most instances like while entering it in fields like "first or last name" or "username" or other places where you would think it shouldn't matter what you typed in because it specifically asks for uniqueness. iPhone had that problem too but I fixed that by entering it in the address field. Which I felt I shouldn't have to do because guess what? The thing is registered to me and it says so on the top left hand corner too that this is "Sonali's Kindle". So it should stop auto correcting it to Somalia.  I spent a good 4 minutes entering my name over and over again because it kept auto correcting it. It needs to get a clue that after the first try the "typo" was intentional.4. GUI to the amazon store to buy physical stuff is clunky and non responsive. I wanted to buy a cover for my kindle. It just didn't respond to my touch to enter payment information or address and I kept trying. I've also notice some apps like Netflix and facebook have really slow response times and at times they just hang. Since I don't face any problem with response when I use the ebook reader or the app store and certain games, I am not sure if this one can be blamed on the kindle but on the app developers.Overall it's doing what I want it to do. Be an ebook reader with the added perk of some browsing and light entertainment. I will be keeping it.

Reviews.Title: Would be 5 Stars with these three things.
Reviews.Author: John James "johnaz"
Reviews.Content: I would give this 5 stars if it had three things.1.  Micro SD Card Slot.  I have movies that take up 1GB each.2.  The ability to "easily" decide which apps I want to maintain and which ones I want to permanently delete.3.  Being able to turn off "App Updates" when on 4G.  I only want updates when on WiFi.

Reviews.Title: Ho-hum
Reviews.Author: A. Paton
Reviews.Content: I have a first generation Kindle Fire that I'm in love with.  When the refurbished Kindle HDs were offered at a great price, I decided to "upgrade" and give the old Kindle to my eight year old.The product arrived quickly and, from all appearances, looked brand new.  Some people have mentioned the size of this Kindle compared to the smaller one, and while it is a significant change, it doesn't bother me.  What DOES bother me is the terrible, terrible, terrible battery life.  Maybe the one I got is defective, but I think I'm with others who have noticed that keeping this thing charged is a real pain.  So much so that when we travel, I choose the first gen over the HD.If you are always near a plug and want to stream to your TV, this isn't a bad choice.  For me, reading, checking email, watching the occasional video, I'm pretty happy with the older, smaller Kindle.

Reviews.Title: I could not put enough "Loves!" in this title line
Reviews.Author: Miss Barbara
Reviews.Content: I've been a hold out for a tablet but have done a lot of research into which one best fits my needs.  I hate to admit it but price was a major consideration.  The Refurbished Kindle Fire 8.9 HD turned out to be a practical choice but I had no idea until after I had it up and running that I'd basically given up almost nothing over it's Apple counterpart.This screen is bright.  The downloading is quick and efficient.  The operation is intuitive.  I'm going to be 70 next week and use social media to keep connected to the cutting edge of news and events.  With this tablet I can easily take it along with me and never be cut off from family, friends, world events or movies and TV.  = Love x infinity.

Reviews.Title: dont do it
Reviews.Author: melissa
Reviews.Content: When your within warranty why do you have to get refurbished items. Amazon sends you a broken one at that. Twice. Never again, i gave in my new item to get a refurbished item. Never again.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Thank you Amazon for replacing my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 with a replacement. What I thought was a bad "apple" actually is the Kindle itself. Hard to believe Kindle Fire is so disappointing considering original Kindle Fire was wonderful.Definitely considering IPAD or a tablet.

Reviews.Title: kindle fire hdx 8.9 tablet
Reviews.Author: Cathy in WI
Reviews.Content: Extremely happy with product. Works in all areas of my home. Light weight and sits comfortably and safely on my lap while I use the keyboard.Easy to learn to use. Very excellent screen viewing. I love this product.

Reviews.Title: I love this so much, I really want the Brand new one though and prime but I'm disabled so I'm saving for both
Reviews.Author: SudohaShmayya "Lexis"
Reviews.Content: I have to say everyone told me get an iPad, I always wanted a Kindle the readers when they came out and then I heard about these Kindle fire tablets and I checked out a friends and had my first one in  a few months but it was a 7" and had a connection issue, so I returned that and was sad cuz I knew the one I wanted was 8.9" and I was not getting a new Kindle for a long long time, then this one went on super sale, it works great, the size I need, well I'd like a 10" with 64gb but I love this one. The HD is amazing, books I enjoy listening to my books, amazing and games and apps. I always loved Amazon kindles but I have to say the Kindle Fire is the top of the line best Tablet made. I've tried others, this is lighter, sleeker, looks pretty to carry around, I am saving for that new bigger 64g but for now I am loving this item. Amazon once again you have outdone yourself with the Kindle fire  I highly recommend this product to children of all ages.

Reviews.Title: Kindle problems
Reviews.Author: William Wragge
Reviews.Content: I am having issues with this Kindle also.  It drags, throws me out of what I'm working on while working on it.  I would prefer the ipad compared to the Kindle for all the problems I've been having.  Is the Kindle ready for the public?  Please let me know if I can exchange for the ipad.

Reviews.Title: Not so happy!
Reviews.Author: Diane Lolley
Reviews.Content: The Kindle fire I ordered and received it right away. I had it for maybe a month and it just died on me. The screen went black and never came back on. I called Amazon and they sent me replacement right away.  My second one doesn't connect to wifi as easily as the first . So this has not met my expectations very well.

Reviews.Title: very good
Reviews.Author: Robert Feldman
Reviews.Content: very good . priced right .better then ipads or any other devices. and great hd screen great for movies and tv shows on the go.

Reviews.Title: Best reader around...
Reviews.Author: Teri Williams
Reviews.Content: I really loved my kindle reader. The eye fatique I used to suffer from reading has now reduced to almost nothing. Its nice to have all my books with me at anytime! The apps are nice too that I can get. I like the color display a lot. The only down side is ,it takes forever to charge. I would reccommend this to anyone.

Reviews.Title: iPad replacement
Reviews.Author: Kathy L. Hall "Mom of a Chef and a Third Grader"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to replace my 8 year old's iPad and he loves it!  He doesn't miss the iPad at all. But for the better camera and video option on the iPad, it's the same thing just much, much cheaper!

Reviews.Title: Love it! Parental controls a little out of control though.
Reviews.Author: Nitwit4Lit
Reviews.Content: This is a great tablet, I bought mine refurb and have had no issues whatsoever.  I hemmed and hawed over getting a Fire because we already had 3 nook tablets (a decision made due to BN having a better presence in kids books when we started three years ago- and the 1st tablet was for a 2 year old.  Not a device issue.)  And didn't want to have to start over with apps and such.  Then they started Kindle FreeTime and I knew it was time to go all Kindle (the grownups all read on Kindles!)FreeTime is an amazing value for kids.  It gives them access to all the books and apps that they want.  Not cheesy free or 99cent variety ones- but name brand Disney and the like that you would be paying $12-$15/book for.The parental controls- if you use them like I do, to make sure your kid doesn't accidentally get on the web or delete or buy stuff- are a little cumbersome.  Basically I want to be the one to turn wifi on/off.  Well, once you are in freetime- that requires a ridiculous number of password entries.  You have to enter your password to even bring up the menu to get to turning the wifi on, then enter it again to enter that section of the menu, and then yes, a third time to actually turn it on.  YIKES!  The nukes don't have this much security!  And if your child is sitting there watching- they are going to learn your password pretty quick.  Luckily my kid isn't trying to bypass me- but if you have a more sneaky kid, be forewarned.  It is easier too exit freetime and do any adjustments, then reopen freetime. (even if you remove turning wifi on/off from being controlled- there is still no way to get to the menu to turn it on or off without entering your password.  It is crazy. I would just leave the wifi on, but it uses so much battery when we aren't using the fire.As a parent, I think once I have entered my password to get into parental controls- that should be enough.  I don't want to use it again at every step.  I am hoping Amazon will fix this in the future.Other than that- it is great.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Jill Sanders
Reviews.Content: Unfortunately this Kindle has not met my expectations. This is my third Kindle and the first two would have received a rating of 5 stars. However this particular Kindle does not work nearly as well. I often must turn the item off after each turn for it to continue with progressing in certain programs such as Words With Friends. It often does not accept or record my input; only for me to discover the issue a day later. It is to my regret that I must post this. It does allow me to read downloaded books easily.

Reviews.Title: Love My Kindle Fire HD 8.9"!
Reviews.Author: Carol from Chelmsford
Reviews.Content: I wanted the bigger screen as an ereader even though a Kindle rep told me once that the Kindle Paperwhite is the best ereader.  I love my Paperwhite as well.  I wish it came in the larger size like the Kindle Fire HD 8.9".  I use the Web feature on the Kindle Fire as well even though my iPhone does a good job as well.  I think I'm a technology junkie!  Only complaint is that it is so heavy but it does so much, I guess it has to be.

Reviews.Title: LOVE
Reviews.Author: surgee
Reviews.Content: MY NEW KINDLE IS WONDERFUL. THE SOUND IS GOOD.  OPERATION IS GOOD. LOVE ALL THE FREE APPS.  WI-FI IS PRETTY FAST.

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Mohan Sitlani
Reviews.Content: Frequent "web page not available."Silk browser quits frequently.Poor customer service - many transfers without satisfactory end results.I recently had corneal transplant surgery that degraded my vision, making it difficult to view.  As Amazon refund, an upgrade to the Fire HEX should would be reasonable resolution.  Although I offered to pay the price difference, your customer "service"was unreasonably intransigent.For now I am using my wife's iPad.M.  Sitlani

Reviews.Title: sucked
Reviews.Author: John R. Mccutcheon
Reviews.Content: I sent it back as for that kind of money you would think it could do more things, as it would not even play a slideshow on my homepage.

Reviews.Title: problems with charger port
Reviews.Author: Alecia
Reviews.Content: This is my second kindle fire HD8.9 in 3 months and I just got this 2 days ago and it looks like it's going to break the same way my 1st one broke. First the charger port where the kindle charger plugs in gets all lose and then eventually breaks off in there. Then it becomes unchargeable. It has come to the point where I am afraid to plug and unplug it. I can't believe it's only been 48 hours and it is already wiggily. I can't say I'm happy about this in fact I think it is the worst place for the charger as it is on the bottom when playing most games and apps it should be on the side then it wouldn't be bumped or in the way I am starting to consider returning it all together and getting a tablet that supports google play because they have better apps and games

Reviews.Title: Wish I bought a different Kindle
Reviews.Author: M. Shikibu
Reviews.Content: I have the first Kindle ever made, but I wanted the color format and web capacity, so I got this one.  I hate this thing and wish I'd purchased a different one.  First of all, I guess I didn't pay close enough attention to the description because I really wasn't aware that you had to have a known Wi-Fi connection to make it work.  I thought it would be like the original one, and work anywhere.  Secondly, it has to be constantly fed electricity, or the battery goes down.  And finally, it's constantly crashing.  And I mean constantly.  My advice would be to spend a little more and get a better one;  this one is buggy, etc.

Reviews.Title: Apps not reponding
Reviews.Author: Sandy Doepker
Reviews.Content: First 30 days seemed to be no problems. Now the screen freezes up and apps do not respond, ie candy crush and words with friends. I will be calling customer service soon!!

Reviews.Title: Stick with iPad
Reviews.Author: Steve Hostetter
Reviews.Content: Read Amazon's claim that the internet browsing was faster than Ipad with "Ultra-fast Wi-Fi" due to the dual antennas.  Horribly slow!  The three iPads that we have (including a first generation) are all faster.  The internet browser that comes installed on the Kindle is Silk - consistently unresponsive and I have to frequently close the window.  Can't remove Silk and replace with Chrome.  The screen is clear, but that is about it.  The power and volume buttons are on the bottom of the tablet, so when browsing in the "landscape" orientation, it is very easy to hit the buttons thus turning off the device.  Very disappointing!Bottom line ... for a few dollars more, I'd purchase a refurbished iPad

Reviews.Title: Don't bother...
Reviews.Author: mjm "rigbycorp"
Reviews.Content: You'll be much better off with a Samsung, Asus, or even an iPad (although admittedly, iPads are more costly, and you can't expand the storage space; but you can't do that with the kindle either). The web browser (Silk) is lousy, and most others popular browsers aren't compatible. Amazon made their version of android more proprietary than other tablets, and its not very customizable. Finding files isn't easy, and they often end up where you wouldn't expect them. I'll get videos in the photo app, and not be able to move them. I get the wrong artwork for my music files, and can't change it. The only thing I like is, I have Amazon prime, and I can connect the kindle to my flat screen, and stream movies. I will not buy another one though. It's becoming much easier to stream with other tablets now. Btw, I've had this tablet for a couple of years now, so this review is based on a lot of use.

Reviews.Title: loving my Kindle fire
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I love my Kindle and so does my daughter. I can't keep her off it. It's great for watching movies and searching the web

Reviews.Title: kindle
Reviews.Author: mniiller
Reviews.Content: Love the bigger screen. Great bargain and user friendly. Deliverd on time and fully loaded with my old account settings

Reviews.Title: Amazon customer support ROCKS!
Reviews.Author: M. Brannan
Reviews.Content: I bought my kindle off from a tv shopping channel. I could not register it and the customer support at Amazon came to my rescue!They had a replacement Kindle Fire at my door so fast I couldn't believe it. I had the replacement up and running within minutes of getting it out of package. My son hinted he would like to have a kindle fire when he found out I had ordered one shortly before Christmas 2013. So I ended up giving him the one I had ordered for myself and I turned around and ordered another one. I have several friends with these also. My only complaint is the game "Hay Day" is not available on the kindle.

Reviews.Title: would not connect to my WiFi
Reviews.Author: tommykoke
Reviews.Content: I liked it but could not get it to connect to my wi-fi.  I have four other devises in the house, including two kindles, that work of this wi-fi system.  Cisco 1500.  I called Kindle service and they worked with me to try and correct this issue.  We downloaded the latest software and tried other  things but could not get it to go.  The Fire connected to my neighbors Wi-Fi and I liked the tablet and would like to have kept it but never did get it connected to my system.  I ended up sending it back and buying a Samsung Galaxy tablet at Best Buy.  It connected right up and is working fine.  I don't think it is any better than the Kindle but I am happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Poor performance
Reviews.Author: Mer
Reviews.Content: I have gone through 4 Kindle Fires - none of which would charge properly.  Amazon has been very good at replacing the Kindles, but I am very disappointed in this product.  Definitely doesn't live up to the advertising!  I hope that other people don't have the problems that I have had.  Finally, Amazon has decided that sending more Kindles is not the answer and is giving me my money back.

Reviews.Title: Constantly dropping WiFi connection-Updated
Reviews.Author: D. White
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is an improvement over the previous Fire due to the larger screen and better quality display. That said be very careful of buying this device if you are doing any serious web access work. The Fire HD drops WiFi signals continuously, even when sitting only a few feet from the router. We have four other devices (non-Kindle) that work fine on our home network. This Fire will lose signal. Checking on the internet we have found this is a pretty common problem with this device. On a recent trip, I could use my iPad on our hotel room WiFi but the Kindle was useless. The camera is only good for selfies...period. Got a better camera on my phone. Overall, this is an improvement over the older Fire, but the WiFi connectivity issue makes it a loser for us.UPDATEAmazon contacted us after this review.  After more discussions with their techies, they ended up sending us a new device.  This one is much more stable, although SILK still freezes on occasion, but not as much.  It has not dropped wifi connection either.  We shall see if it performs better on public hotspots on our next trip.  At any rate, I changed rating to a 4 star for the time being.  I still like my iPad better.

Reviews.Title: Silk Browser on Kindle Fire is a joke
Reviews.Author: SILVERBEAD
Reviews.Content: I have loved my Kindle Fire HD 8.9". It has been a source of enjoyment. I use it for videos, music, shopping, email and many other things. The enjoyment part ended recently when the Silk Browser became an object of frustration. If you don't know, the Silk Browser is Kindle's access to the internet. It is down, not working, more than it is up and working. When you are in the middle of completing some business, and the Silk Browser goes down,  you get to start all over when it comes back, when/if it comes back. This creates a very frustrating situation. This happens too many times. Amazon has a fix for this but it means putting your entire Kindle content in the cloud. This creates a ton of frustration and download time. Trouble is, the fix doesn't last and soon, you are back with an internet browser that does not work. Forget it if you think Amazon will give you a refund on this defective product. NO WAY. This is the attitude of the largest retailer in the world? Give me a break. If you want a tablet that is internet worthy, do not buy a Kindle Fire HD 8.9". Amazon finally, after much unpleasant argument, sent me a replacement of the same model I had purchased. Do I expect a better browser from this paltry offering. No. In the mean time, I have purchased an iPad. For a 70 year-old on retirement income, this was hard to handle, but a necessary step if I want to keep up and depend on the internet for information, shopping, fun and entertainment, not to mention email.  For quite some time now I have done nothing but sing the praises of Amazon. I will continue to do business with them. This time though, you got a black eye Amazon. On second thought, maybe I am the one with the black eye.

Reviews.Title: Should have bought a Nook!
Reviews.Author: Donna Pugh
Reviews.Content: The only reason I gave the Kindle 2 stars is because it is a good reader.  The rest of the features I Wouldn't even give it one star.  If you bought it to also go on Facebook, Twitter or any other website forget it.  Everything freezes up and the silk browser constantly freezes up and becomes unresponsive.  Tried to get support and after explaining what my issues were I was directed to a technical support person that has a lot of experience with the silk browser and he told me his credentials and told me he could help me, but his first ? To me was not to explain what issues I was having but how much I was willing to pay.  Very disappointed in the Kindle fire HD 8.9 and will never recommend it to any one.  Total waste of my hard earned money!

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Gregg
Reviews.Content: Very Nice, especially considering the reasonable price.. Excellent picture quality. Overall, seems like a well designed, very functional tablet. Don't like all the 'ads' that come with it however.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire problem
Reviews.Author: Maryann Jakubczyk
Reviews.Content: About 2yrs. Ago my husband gave me a Kindle Fire for Christmas, loved it until it just died.  I received a new one and that lasted about 10 months (+/-).  I called Amazon and they sent me a another one, that one didn't work, so they sent me another one, which again didn't work.This was the issue;  the kindle kept on saying hat I needed to connect to the network, it would work for one day, then not, sometimes it would go off and on throughout the day, which everything in my home was already connected to our network.  My husbands ipad, our wireless phone, stereo and cell phones all worked.  After numerous calls, speaking with numerous technicians and supervisors, calling our network and replacing our home router and then receiving another kindle (this is now the 3rd), none of them would hold a charge or stay connected to the network.  I spoke with someone who was extremely helpful and sent me return labels for both and I was told I would be refunded 80% of what I paid for the kindle, which I feel unacceptable, since none of them worked. As of this date, I have not received my refund nor do I have a kindle.  I am extremely disappointed with Amazon and try not to purchase items because of this issue.  I am also very disappointed with the supervisors service of promising to correct this issue, since I followed all the correct steps in trying to rectify the kindle problem, by talking to the tech support people who tried to help.  I even went as far to check with all the people I know who have a Kindle and mine seemed to be the one with the problem.  Amazon has done nothing to correct this, again to which I am extremely dissapointed with their service.  If there were a half star rating, that is what It would be rated.

Reviews.Title: it's okay for the price
Reviews.Author: valarie williams
Reviews.Content: Kindle is my second tablet. Purchased it for downtime at work. The speed is very slow compared to my  iPad. Silk browser disconnects frequently. Downloads are fine. It does what it was designed to do very well; book reader. The price is reasonable. If you can afford it, I would recommend the iPad instead.

Reviews.Title: A good toy but not for the serious user
Reviews.Author: Cookin Joe
Reviews.Content: I have been using Kindle fire HD tablets for  about a year now so I feel I can now submit what I consider to be a fair review. These tablets use a customized Android Ice Cream Sandwich operating system. Apps have to be purchased from the Amazon App store for installation in order to be supported by Amazon. Apps purchased  through the App store and installed may not perform properly and may not be supported by Amazon. By default the tablets are set up to only  download and install Apps from the Amazon App store. You can change this setting but Amazon does not recommend it. Many of the Android apps that you are used to using on other Android tablets and smart phones are not available for the Kindle fire HD.I have used these tablets to stream video from two sources, Amazon Prime and Netflix. The main issue I have with the video streaming is when you first start streaming the video will not be at full resolution for the first 60 seconds or so and is choppy and blurry. Exactly what causes this is unknown but it happens on both Amazon Prime and Netflix and on all of the Fire HD tablets that I have used. It is not a wireless or bandwidth issue as I have much more capacity than these tablets need for streaming.This is a great tablet for using on Skype. It works well and the video quality is great and the battery lasts a good 5 hours when using video messaging. I initially had issues with Skype SMS using the touchscreen keyboard. The cursor would not stay at the end of the sentence being typed and the keyboard would not function properly reacting slowly and not entering the letters correctly. After two replacement Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch tablets, Amazon changed the version of Skype they had in the App store and the issue is resolved I am happy to say.The Amazon Silk browser works well but Flash is not supported so video sometimes does not work using the browser. The browser operates well and is easy to navigate.The Kindle Fire HD does a great job with e-mail, supporting all of the popular e-mail providers as well as corporate e-mail. Amazon brings all your e-mail accounts together in a single application.If you are planning on using this tablet in place of a Laptop it would not be a good choice. The productivity software available is not that good and is not compatible with Windows based programs such as Office. If you plan to do  lot of typing such as in e-mails I suggest you buy the Amazon Basics Bluetooth keyboard to use instead of the on screen keyboard.If you are looking for a tablet to use as an e-reader, to stream video on the device or to your tv via HDMI port and access your e-mail it is a decent choice. If you are looking to do productive work I suggest you look at other products.

Reviews.Title: SLOW
Reviews.Author: Muttley
Reviews.Content: I have used this tablet for 9 months now. I have been thinking about reviewing it for a while but I waited until fair amount of time passes to evaluate its function over time.This was the first tablet I bought and I was very happy with my purchase initially. I was so happy I caused two of my relatives to buy it as well. However the honeymoon period is long gone. after a couple of months the performance started declining considerably. Although I removed most of the apps I am not using and keep good eye on cleaning the cache etc, it did not improve at all. My main use of the tablet is internet browsing and there you are very limited with your browser options. Silk, the default browser, is the worst I have ever seen. If Amazon needs to fire some employees, it should start with the developpers of this nasty browser. It crashes a minimum of 5-6 times in less than 30 minutes of browsing. Otherwise, it is extremely slow and mostly inadequate in performance. Amazon's arrogance to create a monopoly over that browser is really irritating as well. (we can not get puffin e.g) Apart from the browsing experience, the app selection is limited and the general operation is slow and unreliable. It may take an easy 60 seconds to start up. Besides, one of the three items I purchased had a charging problem showing 0% no matter what and shuts down as we disconnect from the charger. This is someting that you dont expect in a device that is less than a year old.But apart from the negative issues, it , for sure, has some worthy parts. Reading, and streaming amazon prime movies are really enjoyable. And the sound is really booming. However if you don't have prime membership, the video section is useless and streaming videos from other sources like different websites is not always reliable.So at the end of the day, I feel like being mislead by what Jeff Bezos said. He told that this item is cheap because they sold it with no profit so that people would buy content from their website, but in reality this item is cheap because it is cheaply made and the rule of thumb works as well: You get what you pay for...

Reviews.Title: Returned 2 of these
Reviews.Author: Susan M Roman
Reviews.Content: I had to return 2 of the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch.  I am planning on getting the HDX as the processor should be much better.  It was too slow to respond and would freeze up all the time.  The keyboard would either run very slow or I would be typing in letters and get numbers instead.  I realize that it is not some high end computer but still it did not meet my expectations at all.  Forget about using the web every 5 mins or less it would stop responding.  Honestly I would say spend another hundred dollars and get the HDX.  dual core compared to quad core processor.  I was really disappointed in this product.

Reviews.Title: Second one seems okay
Reviews.Author: R. Borchert "Jeepsforever"
Reviews.Content: This was replacement for defective 7".  Upgraded To this one.  The first 8.9" was also defective, so now this is the 3rd kindle we've had.  Amazon is great to work with, but I'm concerned we had to get three before they got it right.  This is for my wide, I like My ipad much better.

Reviews.Title: New toy
Reviews.Author: ashley velasco
Reviews.Content: Best gift I bought myself, I feel like a kid I have all my movies,books on there and as a mom it nice to have something to entertain myself with

Reviews.Title: Customer Service the worst!!!!
Reviews.Author: Marti
Reviews.Content: My Kindle which is only a little over a year old, died.  CS would not replace cause the warranty expired, which is fine, but why didn't this product last longer after I paid over $300.00 for it?  The wanted me to replace with a refurbished  one costing as much as the new one.  Not having that kind of money, I refused.  When I find some money, I will purchase another product that is not Kindle.  Very disappointed as I really liked my Kindle, but what good is it if it only lasts a short time.

Reviews.Title: Another Winner
Reviews.Author: Miss A
Reviews.Content: I really like the kindle fire. I can't imagine why sooo many people are hung up on the apple I pad when the kindle fire, for less $$$ is as good or, better.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire
Reviews.Author: Karen
Reviews.Content: The unit was dead right out of the box.  If I could rate it lower than a 1, I would do so.  We went through 3 or 4 technicians and the thing was a waste of time.  We wanted to get it on time to use while on vacation, we paid 20 bucks for extra fast shipping.  We finally sent it back the day we left. was disappointed in the whole purchase.  By the way, your best person that helped us was the last woman that spoke great English (probably a American) and she believed what we told her about the fixing it over the phone process that we already tried with others before her.  Also she had the UPS return sticker sent to UPS, instead of me. that was a great help to us.  As I said before, we left on Vacation without your kindle fire and the charger and of course we didn't need a cover for it.  Thanks, Karen

Reviews.Title: Present for husband
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Had and older Kindle got a I-Pad for my birthday, gave the hubby old kindle he was using it all the time so bought him the kindle fire. He's told me it's one of his best presents ever. On a side note I perfer the kindle to the I-pad.

Reviews.Title: better than iPad
Reviews.Author: Lisa Malesich
Reviews.Content: My kids absolutely love their Kindles. I loaded educational apps, gamed and bookd on it for them. ALL FREE! I even got one for myself. Lots of free books on Amazon

Reviews.Title: Great product - even better customer service
Reviews.Author: Stacey
Reviews.Content: I had been enjoying my kindle fire very much until 8 days ago when it experienced sudden death.  I suspect that may have been my fault - I guess there's something that comes with the kindle that tells how to take good care of the battery.  If I read it, I forgot what it said . . . . I guess you have to be careful with these types of batteries.  I read that on a forum after I'd already messed it up.Anyway.  I contacted customer service and they were amazing.  Absolutely no hassle whatsoever, very nice and respectful.  They talked me through the trouble shooting and then sent me a free PowerFast adapter to see if that would bring it back to life.  It didn't, so I contacted them again and they immediately offered to send me another kindle fire, free of charge.  It will be here in 2 days, and I can ship the old one back for free in the box the new one comes in.  Both times I talked to them online using the "contact us" button and the conversations were quick and easy.The Kindle worked great right up until I killed the battery.  Very good color and HD, lots of fun game apps, enjoyed reading full-color magazines on it.  I prefer my regular old kindle for reading books because it's not backlit and therefore easier on my eyes, but for anything full-color and for internet and games I love the fire.

Reviews.Title: Worse decision ever
Reviews.Author: kindle user
Reviews.Content: I decided to buy this for my niece thinking she could use it for school. Wrong!!!! The apps that she would need are only available on ipad or android. She couldn't read any of the ebooks she had for class, this is a kindle how is that possible. She used it for about 30 mins and it got so hot it damn near burned her. The quality of the graphic were horrendous. All of the things it brags and boast about didn't happen. It didn't play flash, it wouldn't even show youtube. I'm so glad that we returned it! Do you think amazon tried to do anything to fix my issues, nope not at all. I'm still waiting on a refund and its been almost 2 weeks. Be careful, it seems they are selling refurbished kindles at new kindle prices. Oh yeah and not to mention the charging port was bad and they want you to pay $15 to get their "special offers" of the front of the kindle.

Reviews.Title: New Kindle for me
Reviews.Author: Josie
Reviews.Content: I have a Kindle second generation reader which has been very good, but I can't do audible books or video on it so I bought this Fire HD and so far really like it.  It's lighter than my iPad2 and I can do more with it than the 2nd gen Kindle.  I saved $80 by taking advantage of an Amazon special before Valentines Day.  The special Offers feature doesn't bother me at all.  I'm very glad I made the jump at the price savings time.

Reviews.Title: Wireless printer
Reviews.Author: Lloyd Bullard
Reviews.Content: No one has mentioned wireless printing.  Does the amazon kindle fire HD have capability for wireless printing?No rating yet.  All I want is this info before buying.

Reviews.Title: I have had two Kindles.
Reviews.Author: Bill Lee
Reviews.Content: The reason for my LOW rating is pretty simple.While my first Kindle was very nice - for a while it came to the point where the Charging Port wasn't working and I could not recharge it. I contacted Amazon and found that the Kindle's are not repairable. But that the were willinbg to sell me a new one at a discounted price. HMMM the prices they gave me were the same as at my local store.However I liked it enough that I decieded to move up to the Kindle Fire HD larger version. When I recieved it - the Charging Port was also not any good. I talked to a Friend who had a total of three Kindles for his Wife and Kids - two of theirs had the same issue. Bad Charging Port, No way to Recharge, No way to have it Fixed.When I called the Amazon Help desk I was told that the issue was an unheard of issue and they hadn't hade any issues reported. (Note - my buddy, a Very Senor Engineering Director, told me that he had had the very same response). He went out and bought an Apple - So did I. We both love them.

Reviews.Title: Great Product! Great Value!
Reviews.Author: Brad L
Reviews.Content: Thin, great screen resolution, loads/runs Prime videos without hesitation.Slower on the browser than an iPad, but still fast.I would recommend this over the iPad and save the $200+

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 is appropriate for my needs. I couldn't afford an IPad but needed something just as efficient.
Reviews.Author: favorbigd@yahoo.com
Reviews.Content: After getting a little help in learning how to get around my new Kindle, I have become quite satisfied with it. My main purpose was to be able to get e-textbooks, do research and complete assignments. I have been able to accomplish all of this. It's great for entertainment, such as games, watching videos, past TV shows and putting puzzles together. I love it.Several of my co-workers have been asking a lot of questions, I have strongly recommended the Kindle to them to meet their needs. You can't beat it for the low price! It's light and easy to carry. It beats carrying those heavy textbooks any day.

Reviews.Title: Was expecting more...
Reviews.Author: Leonardo de Waal
Reviews.Content: It is a nice device and works well within cross-platforms, so I can carry on reading from my smart-phone. The battery life hasn't been an issue and can be charged with conventional smart-phone USB chargers.One of the things I WAS disappointed about was the fact that it doesn't come with the Vocabulary Builder that does come with the more basic version (Kindle Paperwhite). I would have thought that being a newer model it would have even more features - not less! This feature makes the Kindle unique, as opposed to an ordinary tablet!Something else I was disappointed about was the fact that physical books with pictures are utterly guttered once bought as ebooks in this Kindle (perhaps in all Kindles), so you might find a picture a tenth its size, some can't be enlarged, and located at unexpected places.Other than that, I am happy to have bought it.

Reviews.Title: I already want to buy an additional one!
Reviews.Author: legends mommy
Reviews.Content: I purchased the HD 9.8 for my son's 6 birthday present and I have to say amazon and kindle have the most wonderful helpful customer service. I've had a lot of questions and so has my son. They've been prompt and extremely thourough. The kindle fire is awesome itself I want to buy another for me soon

Reviews.Title: No light for charging
Reviews.Author: Linda Whitten
Reviews.Content: I miss not having the light that tells me when the kindle is charged.I had one on my kindle fire so when I got the kindle fire 8.9 for my birthday it's the first thing I noticed when I plugged in my new charger that come with my kindle. NO LIGHT

Reviews.Title: Best thing ever
Reviews.Author: bunra long
Reviews.Content: This is my first Kindle and I'm completely amazed how great this is. I use it daily and recommend it to anyone looking for a tablet but not wanting to spend 4-5 hundred dollars for an IPAD.

Reviews.Title: I love my kindle fire...
Reviews.Author: Beverli A. Pullen
Reviews.Content: This is my 4th kindle. My whole family loves them. I take my kindle everywhere I go. Never know when I may have to wait somewhere & I have it available to read or play games to pass the time.

Reviews.Title: Jerky jerky
Reviews.Author: Roland McNeal
Reviews.Content: I got this for Christmas and I sent it back and bought a Samsung galaxy note 10.1 an I'm happy with it the Kindle Fire 8.9 is ok the Silk Browser is just treble. Games are cool and I was able to side load some apps like Google crome youtube but overall it's a cool tablet but it's just not for me.

Reviews.Title: Horrible Product!
Reviews.Author: Kristie
Reviews.Content: I was a kindle lover for years! I asked for the new Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for my birthday in November. I am on my 3rd replacement!!!! Original and first 2 replacements had maybe 4 hours of battery life...NOT using internet! Just reading!!! Ridiculous! So my guy at Amazon asked if he could send my yet another one...so I got it the other day...and....it doesn't work at all! I registered it and can't use anything or read ANY book! You have GOT to be kidding! So...I am asking for a full refund and going for the Ipad! DONE!!!!

Reviews.Title: The kindle
Reviews.Author: cheryl Bowers
Reviews.Content: The kindle after a year is not working properly. It will not charge and the battery life is disappointing. Its very bad for now my boyfriend who I gave it to can't even get on it half the time.

Reviews.Title: The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 Is Great But...
Reviews.Author: William Ryan Rice
Reviews.Content: I have had my Kindle Fire HD 8.9 for a little over a month now (Christmas gift to myself) and I love this thing. But be forewarned; this device is NOT an iPad and to expect any Amazon device to function anywhere close to an iPad is an unrealistic expectation.  If you're in the market for a tablet and you really want an iPad, then save up for an iPad.  I chose the Kindle Fire HD 8.9 because a) it was cheaper, and b) for the amount of screen real estate that I was getting at the price of it, it was too good to pass up.  But here's a few pro's and con's that I've noticed with it...Pro's:-The HD display does not disappoint!  I bought an episode of the Twilight Zone and threw it on my KF HD and it looks phenomenal.  The audio is as good as advertised, although to really get the most out of audio, you'll want to get a good set of earphones or earbuds as the speakers can be drowned out if there is something going on in the background (i.e. screaming kids, dishwasher, whatever).-The Kindle Fire HD 8.9 doesn't weigh much, so lugging it around with you is no big deal.  I take mine to work everyday in my backpack and I can't tell that it's in there.  In fact, I sometimes forget it's in there.-There aren't a whole lot of apps to choose from as compared to the Apple App Store, but if you go to a site like Good e-reader you can sideload a ton of decent apps to go along with your Kindle Fire HD.Con's:-I'm not crazy about where the ports are for this device.  The power charger and the HDMI output are technically on the bottom, thus making it useless to try to charge my Kindle and keep it on its stand at the same time.  While we are discussing the placement of things on the device, the power and volume control is in an annoying place.  That is one thing I believe the old Kindle Fire has over the new(er) HD model with having the power control on bottom.-Battery life can be a little deceiving on most electronics, and I think there's no exception when it comes to the Kindle Fire HD 8.9.  If I stream anything on Netflix, my battery is almost depleted in a couple of hours.  If I'm reading, watching something on YouTube, or surfing the web/checking email, battery life is awesome.  And while we're at it, if you plan on purchasing any Kindle Fire products, BE SURE TO PURCHASE THE FAST CHARGER!!!  I have no clue why this doesn't ship automatically with the device (shame on you Amazon) but for $19 you can charge your device much quicker than with an iPhone cube or connected to your computer.All things considered, I still love this device, and I realize it's not perfect, but for the price I can't argue.  I hope this helps those of you potentially looking at purchasing this device in the near future.

Reviews.Title: If it worked, I would love it
Reviews.Author: Debi Smith
Reviews.Content: I am a first time kindle user and if this worked properly I would love it but  within 2 weeks it was making strange popping noises and then began shutting itself off and repeatedly while using it. I called Amazon and to their credit they did send me a replacement right away but this one is even worse. It shuts itself off every 2 to 3 minutes while reading and it is so frustrating. It is getting returned tomorrow. I was considering giving this one to my sister and ordering the new HDX but with the problems I'm having with this I don't see me spending any more money in Kindles.

Reviews.Title: Kindle number six
Reviews.Author: jp
Reviews.Content: The battery still only let's five hours, one hour longer than the last one. Other wise it works just fine.

Reviews.Title: bad equipment
Reviews.Author: Debra D Miller
Reviews.Content: This was my second kindle. Worked fine for a month, now it will not connect to my Kindle Account and keeps de-registering itself .Save your money and by_pass this device. Get a better tablet.

Reviews.Title: Needs improvement.
Reviews.Author: Salvador Carrillo
Reviews.Content: Great screen. I like how it integrates Amazon Music and Video. However, it crashes too much when web browsing and it lags significantly.

Reviews.Title: no hard copy directions and hints
Reviews.Author: Dennis Baker
Reviews.Content: The Kindle Fire HD is such a great device.  Too bad rookies like us can't operate it.  Why not send a hard copy booklet on how to.  The tutorial was too  sketchy and easy to forget.  Need print work to examine as we go through it.

Reviews.Title: Kindel fire
Reviews.Author: Karen Kieper
Reviews.Content: Great tool for myself and my grandchildren.I have had some problems but the immediate assistance more than makes up for the problems.To date I have purchased 5.Pretty much speaks for itself.

Reviews.Title: Quality lacking
Reviews.Author: David J. Morgan
Reviews.Content: We have had ours for exactly a year. Our two-year old uses the FreeTime quite a bit, and he has learned his letters and numbers from all the wonderful games and puzzles. He can also watch Thomas and Friends and Dora the Explorer, and his other favorites (like old episodes of Blue's Clues). I love the content and the device was flawless for 11 months. Then the battery started really getting bad and would last about an hour. Then, it stopped working even while plugged in. I thought it was the battery, so I replaced it with the kit sold here. This is definitely not for the faint of heart--this thing is put together like a swiss watch, and it's no fun doing surgery on this thing. That said, it came apart and went back together OK, but it's still completely dead. The battery indicator will flash for a minute, and then nothing, which suggests to me it wasn't the battery but something in its internal power supply and regulation. Ironically, I just bought another one exactly like it, and we'll see if this one does better. If it doesn't, then Amazon's gambit to sell oodles of content is going out the window. Their plan relies on inexpensive content delivery devices that WORK. If I keep getting screwed every year for $350, I think I'll cancel my Prime subscription, start hitting the Costco for more things, get an Android device for my son, and start hitting the app store.

Reviews.Title: Best gadgets I own, have two, his and hers
Reviews.Author: Marla Stohr
Reviews.Content: I'm still not done finding out what these little monsters are capable of. We use them at home and on the road, watched many a movies and tv shows on my kindle.. Can't say enough, glad we didn't go ipad.

Reviews.Title: Not quite as good as I expected
Reviews.Author: Adele Bader
Reviews.Content: I ordered this Kindle expecting it to be so much better than my Kindle 7" but have not seen that yet. I do not find it faster as stated, my 7" is just as fast, and I find it has lag time and you have to touch some things several times in order for the screen to change,  the picture which is suppose to be HD is not any better that the 7". I put the same movie side by side to compare and didn't see any difference in picture. So I'm a little disappointed in this product.

Reviews.Title: learning my kindle
Reviews.Author: Sally Boehme
Reviews.Content: I am 76 years old, and decided I should learn something new.  I have really enjoyed having it for travel and  home use.  You have been helpfully with the support team.  I Still have a lot to learn.  Salandjoeb

Reviews.Title: very good price/quality rate
Reviews.Author: Kanellis Konstantinos
Reviews.Content: The kindle came into its original packaging in perfect condition.It's size is very handy and its screen is perfect for watching movies while travelling.

Reviews.Title: KKINDLE fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Vince Pinedo
Reviews.Content: What a wonderful Christmas present this was.  I love to read the books, many of them costing less than 5 dollars.  There are cute mindless games that you can download for those times that you feel like doing absolutely nothing except amuse yourself.  The sound is great and the colors are vibrant.  It is a good value compared to the apple thing.

Reviews.Title: Better than I Thought
Reviews.Author: Doug Moore
Reviews.Content: So, after looking for quite some time, reading the reviews, comparing tablet to tablet to e-reader, I decided this was more bang for my buck and I haven't been disappointed.  Actually, this was a birthday present after I pointed it out.  My first has a boot issue.  I called customer service and spoke with a rather kind gentleman in South Africa...just a day after Nelson Mandela passed.  He told me he was ordering me another and told me when it would be delivered-and bingo! It was delivered 2 days early. He even sent me via email the return postage.  The new one is great - no issues, no complaints and great customer service.  The screen is super clear, easy to read and enlarging the view is a breeze. The sound is perfect and wonderful with stereo buds or headphones.  I tried the protective sheet on the screen but it made for bubbles so I tossed it away.  The hard cover is wonderful and offers good protection. If you are looking for a portable - this is the all-in-one you need.

Reviews.Title: Not a negative review about product not working
Reviews.Author: Heather
Reviews.Content: I can't stand it when people give something a negative review just because they received a defective item, or the shipping didn't come or something that doesn't really tell you about the actual working product. Well, this review isn't one of those.I never thought I would say this...as I really have tried so hard to avoid being one of "those people," but after using the Kindle Fire, it's safe to say, yes, I am an Apple person.Right now I am using the iPhone 5, and the Kindle HD 8.9, and there is just no comparison when it comes to the quality. The following is a brief bullet pointed list of problems I have with the Kindle, that I do not have on the iPhone:- The glare. Oh god, the glare!!! Isn't this device advertised as being better than the iPad when it comes to glare? I don't see how that can be possible, because looking at this screen is like looking in the mirror. That is how reflective it is. And if you should want to watch a movie or tv show that's primarily dark, well good luck, because you're basically going to be staring at yourself for the next hour or two. IT IS TERRIBLE!- Startup. Start up is sloooooooow. I mean, this thing takes minutes to start up. And even then, once it's actually started, it's gonna take another few minutes to wait in order to pull up any of the apps, otherwise they will just freeze and/or crash. Best thing to do when you want to use it is press the start key, and then walk away and come back in another 15 minutes. Then you should finally be good to go.- App availability. It's really unfair to yourself to ever purchase and Apple product and then get a device that is going to use an android app, because let's face it - we all know there are a million more apps for Apple. That said, I thought there would still be a decent enough amount of apps to choose from on the Kindle, being that Amazon owns the other half of our world. Nope. Not even close. I looked up the apps I have on my Apple, and only was able to find about 1/8 of them. Let me repeat - about 1/8. That is unreal, and frankly, unacceptable. The entire device is built around apps, therefore one would expect there to be a decent amount.- App functionality. The few apps I have been able to find and download regularly freeze and crash, and are generally much slower than Apple apps to start up. Some of them were in fact so unreliable that I ended up just deleting them.- Customizable options. Ummm, yeah...there aren't any. At all. Being somewhat tech savvy, I enjoy the ability to greatly customize my devices. I choose different backgrounds, different start up screens, password protect my devices, etc. That I have found, you can do NONE of that on the Kindle. You're basically stuck with that glaring black background, and that stupid "carousel" app display.- Sound. The sound stinks as well. If you want to watch or listen to anything, just plan on having to turn the volume up all the way. And that's in a quiet, child-free household. If you have children or a loud house, just plan on not being able to hear it at all.- Buttons. If you can find the buttons, good luck pressing the right one. Half the time I press the shut down button trying to press the volume because they put all three of them right in a row. I get that they were trying to make the buttons blend in with the device for sleekness, but sometimes functionality over looks is the better way to go.Basically, I will use this thing until I can save up enough for an iPad. That's how terrible I think it is - and it is brand new. Do yourself a favor and save up a little extra cash and get the iPad. You won't be sorry!

Reviews.Title: Disappointed
Reviews.Author: Amazonette
Reviews.Content: Because I love my Kindle Paperwhite, I decided to buy a Kindle Fire HD last May before a trip so I could access my email, newspaper, and travel arrangements along the way. I had read dozens of user reviews in advance and really, really wanted to like it. Unfortunately, probably because I was not yet familiar enough with it, relying on it caused me to miss a crucial email and a long-awaited meeting. This one was my bad, not Kindle's.Back home, I started using it more and found it difficult or impossible to access the online versions of my mail subscriptions. A magazine sample downloaded from Amazon Kindle site froze at 48% and did not let me advance. First star lost. Accessing my Gmail account was still cumbersome -- second star lost. For me, it was best for reading books: the vertical page size is about the same as a paper book's, and an off-white background selection is easy on the eyes.Now comes the function that dropped the third star: it goes dead frequently and is a hassle to revive. The first time it happened, the user guide was useless and online instructions did not work. I had to contact Kindle Help who walked me through it on two calls, one hour apart. The second time around, I followed the steps that Kindle Help had shown me. Again, it took an hour to revive it. Too labor intensive for me! I want something that comes to life when I plug it in to recharge it. Preferably something with a clear on-off button and a power indicator like my laptop and my phone.Kindle Fire may be an excellent tablet for most users, just not for me. I need something that makes it easy to read my newspaper and magazine subscriptions and access email. It also has to be available when I need it without an hour-long multi-step revival process. I guess I have been spoiled by the ease of using and recharging cellular phones and laptops. After eight months of intermittent use and comparing notes with savvy friends, I have concluded that an up-to-date smartphone and a 13-inch notebook will bridge all my needs, and I no longer even need a tablet. For reading books, Kindle PaperWhite is still the best.

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9
Reviews.Author: Jolene Wipf
Reviews.Content: I love my new Kindle Fire. Kindles are proof of how computers are becoming a thing of the past. For example, desktops were replaced by laptops in terms of popularity because laptops are smaller and more portable. Now laptops seem big and bulky to carry compared to tablets such as the Kindle. Amazon has created the Kindle to do everything a laptop can do. The graphics are outstanding. The Kindle is easy to use with options for everything on the home screen. Examples of these options include books, magazines, the web, and several more.All users have to do is click one of these options and they will get to where they need to go.I predict that people will eventually use only tablets such as the Kindle. In fact, if my laptop ever dies, I will not replace it. Instead, I will just rely on my Kindle.

Reviews.Title: More Kindle to love
Reviews.Author: BigBamBam
Reviews.Content: I had the 2nd generation Kindle Fire HD loved it. Now there's more to love. Added a few more capabilities and larger screen to what I was so happy with in my old Fire HD. Love the available option of having a wireless keyboard at the ready, added convenience. Screen size is ideal, larger but not a 10in tablet, easily fits into my purse. I upgraded to give my son my Fire HD which is optimal for him at its 7.3in size. We're all very happy, very contented with the Kindle and its operating system. An 8in to 9in screen size in my opinion is where its at for portability, weight, and viewing comfort. If your happy with any other Kindle but want a bigger screen, and  more options then this just maybe the ticket. Cheers

Reviews.Title: Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch
Reviews.Author: Tim Risher
Reviews.Content: This is my second Kindle Fire HD 8.9 inch; the first one locked up on the second day and would not come back on. . . even after I followed the troubleshooting guide at Amazon's website. The replacement process went well and worked just as advertized. The replacement tablet was apparently used/refurbished, but it works like it should. I just received notification that the original was received at Amazon.I also purchased the Kindle Fire HD Standing Leather Case. It fits the case well, and as others have noted, it puts the Kindle to sleep when closed. It doesn't appear to protect the Kindle well. I don't plan to drop the tablet, but accidents happen. The less expensive case appears to be sturdier and definitely provides greater protection of the corners against falls. I may exchange the more expensive case for the less expensive case while I still can.

Reviews.Title: WONDERFUL TABLET!!
Reviews.Author: Dizzy Lizzy
Reviews.Content: I think the Kindle Fire is the best thing I ever bought!  It does just about everything (except the camera is not that great) and more! I take with me wherever I go. Even doctors have asked me about it! When I tell them how much I love it, the next time I see them, they tell me I was right and how they don't need a computer when you have a Kindle Fire. Get your Kindle Fire today!

Reviews.Title: Fun and Easy to use!
Reviews.Author: Aubree.Portune
Reviews.Content: Better than an Ipad! I love my new Kindle, works great, has a long lasting battery! Now my whole family owns a Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: Love my Kindle Fire!
Reviews.Author: Victoria Close
Reviews.Content: My husband purchased this for me for my Birthday, and I am thrilled with it! As an avid book reader, this was the perfect gift! I not only use it to read, but I also use it to watch my favorite shows on Netflix at night (must have a Netflix account) while I am trying to go to sleep. I love the 8.9" size, because while it may be a bit more "bulky" than the smaller sizes, I like having the bigger screen.We did have an issue with the first one we purchased; the Kindle overheated and shut off, and would not come back on for quite some time. Amazon promptly replaced it, and I have not had a problem at all with this second one. (I believe the first one had a faulty battery?)Overall, I am more than happy with my Kindle Fire!

Reviews.Title: excellent  for reading.
Reviews.Author: mike lovejoy
Reviews.Content: Excellent  video and sound,  easy to use,  being able to increase print  size is great. Able to use when away from home is a plus.

Reviews.Title: Satisfied Customer
Reviews.Author: Joan Groff
Reviews.Content: I have an IPAd and I am satisfied with this Kindle in comparison. I feels that it has a lot to offer for the differe nice in price.

Reviews.Title: Non-techy loves Kindle
Reviews.Author: Tea Lassie
Reviews.Content: I am a grandmother and not at all savvy when it comes to computers, but I love my new Kindle Fire that I received for Christmas.  It was easy to use and set up right out of the box.  I didn't even have to ask my husband for help and that is pretty amazing.  I love how easy it is to navigate, and the very bright colorful screens.  I also love how it responds to the slightest touch or swipe.  I use it mostly for reading books, but my grandchildren played some of the games on it and the graphics were so good.  I think it is well worth the price.

Reviews.Title: My Kindle
Reviews.Author: JayBee
Reviews.Content: Entertainment on the Go. Awesome size screen with HD videos. Ample storage for games and apps. Overall a good product and now a fan of kindle.

Reviews.Title: LOVELY
Reviews.Author: fernon wilson
Reviews.Content: The kindle fire HD has a BEAUTIFUL PICTURE, it's runs pretty fast and it has cloud connected. Would recommend it for anyone, but especially for gamers.

Reviews.Title: Okay
Reviews.Author: JJ
Reviews.Content: Not as impressive as I thought it would be. The battery life is not good. I hardly find the apps I'm interested in. disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Bonnie S. Kenk "parroted"
Reviews.Content: This is my second tablet.  My first tablet was a Google.  The battery needed charging at least twice a day (and I didn't even use it much) and the browser took forever.  The Kindle Fire HD 8.9" is the opposite of this.  I've had it for about a month now, and have only had to charge the battery twice (IN ONE MONTH!).I'm pretty technologically challenged, so I don't really care (or even really understand) that this tablet only has a front camera.  If I want to take pictures, I'll use my phone.But, all in all, I would recommend this to people who aren't going to be using it heavily.  It really is great quality for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Nekiesha
Reviews.Content: It's a great product but a little expensive for my taste. It's easy to carry around and a great screen size.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use....
Reviews.Author: mitzimae
Reviews.Content: I love my kindle.  I prefer reading on the kindle to my I-pad.  I love that you can control the size of the font and the background is easy to read on.

Reviews.Title: Great picture and sound
Reviews.Author: Steve Brammer
Reviews.Content: I bought the Fire HD just to do e-mails and web browsing because my home computer failed. I found that I enjoyed streaming shows on it quite a bit. The picture is very sharp and the audio very clear. And I am enjoying reading at night more than my old kindle because of the built in illumination. The only drawback is the battery life (I just don't like being hooked to cords....)

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Tablet
Reviews.Author: David M. Loucks
Reviews.Content: Unbelievably cool.  Resolution is unmatched.  I'm an apple guy through and through, but why anyone would buy an Ipad when they could get the Kindle HD for so much less is sheer madness.

Reviews.Title: Great tablet
Reviews.Author: JesseValentine
Reviews.Content: This tablet works great. I can easily read my books on it. The HD is clear and bright, and very sharp. Books, photos and aps download onto it very easily.

Reviews.Title: It's Good But Could Be Better If Access To Android Opens Up
Reviews.Author: ILoveTheUSA
Reviews.Content: So many reviews have been submitted so I probably won't give any new insight.  I like this tablet, the sound is good, the screen is excellent, and for the most part it runs smoothly for a dual core system.  My gripe with this is first, the wifi distance is weak.  On my laptop I will get very good download speeds at almost 50 feet from my gateway roughly 15+ megs per second.  On the Kindle it's well  below that.  When I try to watch Netflix it constantly freezes up and goes into buffering.  On web pages the load time is excessive.  When I am closer to the gateway though, the Kindle runs fast.  My second complaint is the gated community that Kindle users are forced into so we can't use Google Play and download a large number of apps.  Silk is a horrible web browser also.*********UPDATE 12/30/2013: I did research on Google and I guess it's Google that won't allow Kindle in. Also, the Silk web browser seems to be working better now for whatever reason. It's not as slow as before. On the WiFi distance issue I solved that by raising the gateway on a top shelf near the ceiling and now the Kindle picks up the signal no problem. That being the case I would now give it 4 1/2 stars.

Reviews.Title: Returned
Reviews.Author: Nikki
Reviews.Content: I had been very excited to get this tablet. I read reviews and ended up purchasing it instead of the iPad air. It arrived very quickly. I set it up and began it play around with its features. Here are my thoughts:I won't get into the pros too much because I'm pretty sure those are quite easy to see: screen, sound, size, price. I just want to get into the reasons why I sent it back.First the internet connection was really finicky when starting it up after it was locked.
